loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a shelf and also to increase inventory which will enable him to offer more variety for his customers so they can find what they need.  The rest of the money will be used for personal expenses

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: Maria, tiene 39 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene una hija y reside en el municipio de San Francisco de Yojoa. Hace 9 años estableció una pulpería donde vende productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, manteca, huevos, pan, carnes,  y otros. El préstamo que solicita es el sexto ciclo y es por 8,000 lempiras, con el cual va surtir  el negocio con productos de la canasta básica como ser granos básicos, manteca, azúcar, pan, condimentos, churros, productos de abarrotes, etc. para aumentar el inventario y las ventas. Su plan es mejorar el local del negocio y su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old, and lives in union with her life partner, with who she has a daughter. She lives in the town of San Francisco de Yojoa. Nine years ago she established a small grocery store, where she sells basic products like rice, sugar, butter, eggs, bread, meats, and others. 

This is the 6th loan she is requesting, and it is for 8,000 lempiras. She will use it to supply her business with products of the basic food basket, like staple grains, butter, sugar, bread, condiments, churros, and other groceries. With this, she will increase her inventory and her sales. Her plan is to improve her store and her house.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, butter, sugar, bread, condiments, churros, and different grocery products.

loans.name: Chea Thach Group

texts.en:
Thach is 25 years old, a married woman with a child. She grows fruit trees at home with her husband on her plantation. Both of them can earn approximately $15 per day. They live in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

Now she would like to apply for a loan of 840,000 Riels as a group of three members to build new latrines. This loan will help her live in better conditions. In the future, she is going to plant rubber trees, renovate her home, and support her child to go to university.

loans.use: To build new latrines

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma previously accessed a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos, which she used to buy more quantities of products, like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures. She also sells frozen products for additional income.

Elma would like to apply for another loan of 10,000 to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of her children. Elma hopes to have more customers and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elma meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients, like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca de 45 años de edad, madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales tres viven ya con sus propias familias, se casó con su esposo hace seis años y en su casa vive con él y su último hijo de cinco años de edad.
Se creció al lado de su madre y un hermano quienes lucharon bastante para salir adelante, ya que tenía que trabajar durante todo el día para apoyar a su familia. Estudio hasta noveno grado y no siguió debido a que no tuvo el apoyo de su madre porque debía de trabajar durante el día para el sostén de la familia. 
Blanca se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde que era pequeña cuando al  lado de su madre trabajaban en la comunidad de donde obtenían ingresos económicos, actualmente trabaja siempre vendiendo tortillas, pues su madre ya no labora debido a su edad que ya es avanzada. Antes trabajo laborando en los oficios domésticos en una vivienda de una persona en la comunidad.
Hoy en día le ayuda su esposo quien le colabora en la entrega de las tortillas en las casas que le solicitan y él trabaja también en la agricultura y en otras actividades para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Blanca solicita un préstamo a Credicampo, para comprar 15 quintales de maíz, leña y a la vez comprara una cocina de gas, debido a que tiene una muy buena demanda. 
Blanca sueña con crecer cada día en su negocio de tortillería y para ello ahorra cada día de sus ganancias hacer un pequeño local más estable,  donde tener su negocio y así incrementar su producción debido a que en la comunidad hay bastante demanda. Además espera que su hijo ultimo ayudarle para que estudie en el futuro verlo convertido en todo un profesional.
texts.en:
Blanca is 45 years old. She is the mother of four children, three of whom are grown and already live with their own families. She married her husband six years ago. She lives in her home with him and her youngest child, who is five years old. 

She grew up with her mother and one brother, who really struggled to get ahead, because she had to work all day to support her family. She studied up to ninth grade and she didn't continue because she didn't have her mother's support, because she had to go to work days for the family's sustenance. 
 
Blanca has devoted her time to selling tortillas since she was little. At that time, she worked beside her mother in the community where they obtained their financial income. Currently, she is still working and selling tortillas, but her mother is no longer working because she is elderly. Previously, she worked as a housekeeper for someone in the community. 

These days, her husband helps her by delivering the tortillas to the homes that have ordered them, and he also works in farming and in other activities in order to improve their quality of life.

Blanca is requesting a loan from Credicampo, to buy 15 quintales (1,500 lbs) of corn, firewood, and at the same time buy a gas stove, because she has such high demand.
 
Blanca dreams every day about growing her tortilla business. Every day she saves some of her profits towards a small, more stable locale where she can have her business and increase production, because there is high demand in the community. She also hopes to help her youngest son study so she can see him become a professional in the future.

loans.use: To buy 15 quintales of corn, firewood and at the same time buy a gas stove, because she has such high demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, beverages, and other products needed for his business.

loans.name: Erazik

texts.en:
Erazik lives in Hovtun village of Shirak province. She lives there with her husband and 18-year-old son. 

Erazik's husband is a shepherd and also helps his wife in other agricultural activities. The family has been involved in animal husbandry for many years. They keep cattle, sheep, and hens, and also cultivate corn. 

Their agribusiness needs some investments to function in a more efficient way. That is why Erazik has applied for a loan of USD 2,000 to pay for 180 liters of fuel and buy pigs and calves. The agribusiness is the only revenue source for this hardworking woman and her family. They will appreciate any kind of support from the lenders. 

Let's help them expand their agribusiness and make their lives more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase fuel (180 liters) and pay for livestock (2 pigs and 2 calves)

loans.name: Fotemogoban A Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAPALA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de mil avec madame KOROTOUMOU débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme FOTEMOGOBAN A. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 25 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 36 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group FOTEMOGOBAN are married women who average 36 years of age and 3 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in KAPALA, a commune of the KSIKASSO circle, 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 3rd time partnering with the MFI. Both past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mrs. KOROTOUMOU grows millet. She is the member standing in the center in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy 25 kg of fertilizer and one can of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 0.25 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest the crops will be sold in the village, in Sikasso, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Korotoumou expects to earn an average profit of 36,000 FCFA per season, which she will use to repay her loan and the interest, and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing for the agricultural season.

loans.name: Marte

texts.en:
This is Marte, a 27-year-old married mother, with her 3-month-old baby. 

She is requesting a loan to build a stable for her animals. She owns some dynyms of agricultural land (a dynym is roughly 1,000 square meters), where she plants mostly any kind of veggies that grow well in her region and also grains such as wheat and corn; she’s got grapevines as well. All the fresh products that she produces she sells at the farmers’ market in her nearby city. Her husband works with a communication company that happens to be the largest in the country at the moment; yet many employees who work there are not covered for their unemployment and medical coverage, which are essential. 

Marte is a newcomer to the village and comes from a family of 12 children altogether, which is not atypical among Catholic families in the northern part of the country.

loans.use: to build a stable for her animals

loans.name: Alerta Group

texts.es:
Shorly: Es una mujer amable, desde hace aproximadamente 6 meses conformo al grupo alerta, integrado por 3 mujeres luchadoras, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para incrementar la mercadería para sus negocios y mejorar sus ingresos en el hogar. 

Esta sonriente mujer desde hace 15 años estableció su pequeña pulpería. Gracias a las ganancias percibidas y a los créditos otorgados anteriormente por PANA PANA, le han permitido crecer en su negocio, ha comprado una refrigeradora en la guarda los productos perecederos. Solicita financiamiento para comprar: pollo, carne molida, crema, embutidos, chivería, granos básicos, frutas para elaborar helados. Su sueño es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, ya que actualmente lo tiene en un pequeño anexo de madera en la sala de su casa.
texts.en:
Shorly is a kind woman.  Approximately 6 months ago she joined the communal banking group Alerta, made up of three hard-working women. Her goal was to access a loan in order to increase her market for her business and to increase the income for her household. 

This smiling woman began her own grocery store 15 years ago.  Thanks to the income earned and the previous credits received through Kiva partner PANA PANA, she has been able to grow her business.  She has purchased a refrigerator to keep her products fresh.  She is asking for a loan in order to buy chicken, ground beef, creme, sausages, candies, basic grains, and fruit for making ice cream.  Her dream is to improve the infrastructure of her business, since currently she has a small wooden annex in the living room of her home.

loans.use: to buy chicken, ground beef, creme, sausages, candies, basic grains, and fruit for making ice cream.

loans.name: Nerlyn

texts.en: Nerlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business. Nerlyn has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from food vending. Nerlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Sakedufatanye Cb Group

texts.en: Clementine is 22 years old. She is married and has one child who is five years old. She is a group leader of SAKEDUFATANYE, which means "let us work together" in English. The members of the group sell different items, and they wish to scale up for the better future of the business. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more bananas and sorghum for resale. With the profits from the business, she will renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Mireya Rosa

texts.es: Mireya: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada, tiene 30 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Con los créditos otorgados anteriormente por PANA PANA, le han permitido construir poco a poco su vivienda de concreto. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingreso, desde hace 2 años estableció su pequeña pulpería. Solicita financiamiento para comprar mercadería: Chiverías, granos básicos, papel higiénico, sopas instantáneas, entre otros productos. Su sueño es tener una vivienda segura que le brinde las condiciones a su familia.
texts.en: Mireya is originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is 30 years old, married and has three children. With previous loans from "Pana Pana", Mireya has been able gradually to build her home with concrete. In order to have her own source of income, Mireya started her own grocery store two years ago. She is applying for this loan in order to buy more merchandise (dairy products, basic grains, lavatory paper, instant soups and more). Mireya's dream is to have a secure house where she can offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (dairy products, basic grains, lavatory paper, instant soups and more).

loans.name: Cecilia Esperanza

texts.es:
Los profesores son la columna de la educación, son a quienes les atribuimos el desarrollo del conocimiento de cada individuo. A pesar de su gran aporte, el salario de los educadores es muy bajo en Nicaragua. Sin embargo, este no es un obstáculo para la profesora Cecilia, pues a sus 50 años de edad todavía se siente apasionada por su trabajo como Licenciada en Español desde hace 14 años, apartando por mucho lo monetario. Actualmente, ella se sigue formando, ya que quiere otorgar el mejor conocimiento a sus alumnos, por lo que está estudiando un posgrado y una maestría todos los sábados en la UNIVAL. 
Cecilia es soltera y sin hijos, sin embargo está encargada de una persona. Cuenta con el apoyo de su madre y de sus hermanos. Así como el apoyo económico de los bonos que ofrece el MINED. Anteriormente, había conseguido una maestría en Ciencia de la Comunicación con mención en Didacta, en la UNAN, pero su deseos por seguir forjando su futuro, no terminaron allí. En estos momentos necesita de un préstamo para pagar los gastos del posgrado y la maestría, la cual está estudiando. Uno de sus sueños es montar su propia librería, pero antes quiere enfocarse en esta etapa importante de su vida, puesto que está creciendo profesional e intelectualmente.
texts.en:
Teachers are the pillars of education; we attribute to them the development of knowledge in every individual. Despite their great contribution, educators' salaries in Nicaragua are very low. However, this is not an obstacle for Cecilia. Money aside, at 50 years old, she still is passionate about her job of 14 years as a certified Spanish teacher. 

Currently, she is continuing her studies, because she wants to impart greater knowledge to her students. She is taking postgraduate courses for her Master's degree every Saturday at the UNIVAL. 
 
Cecilia is single and has no children, however she does have one dependent. She has the support of her mother and her siblings, as well as the economic support of the bonds offered by the Ministry of Education. Previously, she obtained a Master's degree in Communication Science, with an emphasis in Teaching at the UNAN, but her desire to continue forging her future did not end there. At this time, she needs a loan to pay the expenses of the postgraduate and Master's degree, for which she is studying.

One of her dreams is to open her own book store, but before that, she wants to concentrate on this important stage in her life, since she is growing professionally and intellectually.

loans.use: To pay for the expenses of postgraduate and master's studies.

loans.name: Marika

texts.en:
Marika is a 43-year-old woman from the village of Khornabuji. She lives with her son and daughter, who are temporarily unemployed nowadays. The only source of income for the family is Marika's job working at a local cultural center. However, her income is insignificant to cover all daily costs for three members in the family. Marika has a great desire to make her activity more productive and start renting traditional Georgian dance costumes from this center. The demand is high for these mentioned costumes and she will rent them at a good price. Marika requested a loan to purchase all needed materials to sew these costumes.

The loan will greatly assist Marika and she will be able to continue her lovely job. Due to her kind and nice attitude toward clients, Marika will have a big list of loyal customers. And with regard to the Start Up program she will be able to make savings and provide a better future for her son and daughter.

loans.use: to sew traditional Georgian dance costumes and then rent them

loans.name: German Alfonso

texts.es: German: Tiene 26 años de edad, casado con un hijo de 3 años, trabaja en el área de proyectos de una ONG´s del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Con el propósito de reducir el hacinamiento,  tener su propia vivienda.  Solicita financiamiento para  ampliación de su vivienda de tambo de madera. Su sueño es tener una vivienda de concreto que le brinde las condiciones a su familia.
texts.en: German is 26 years old, married and has a three-year-old son. He works in the projects department of an NGO in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. With an aim of living in a less crowded environment, German wants to have his own house. German is applying for this loan in order to expand his wooden, country house. German's dream is to have a concrete house where he can provide his family with good living conditions.

loans.use: to expand his country house, which is made of wood.

loans.name: Impakaya Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario IMPAKAYA, está integrado por 4 mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras, que recientemente se organizaron para acceder por primera vez a financiamiento, con el propósito de incrementar su mercadería y como lo define su nombre en lengua miskita, buscar el progreso y salir adelante.

Elba: Es originaria de la comunidad Auhaya Pigni, que en lengua miskita significa arena, ubicada a 2 horas del municipio de Puerto Cabezas,  tiene  37 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos, que estudian su técnico en docencia en la Ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Su esposo es agricultor. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos desde hace 2 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en un anexo en la sala de su casa de tambo de madera, aun recuerda que inicio con capital propio con C$ 5000 (Cinco mil córdobas netos). Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar en el mercado de Puerto Cabezas productos para su negocio: Granos básicos, chiverías, cloros, papel higiénico, cepillos de diente y sopas instantáneas. Su sueño es comprar gallinas y cerdo engordarlos y venderlos a precios accesibles.
texts.en:
The "Impakaya" loan group has four feisty and enterprising members. They recently joined together in order to apply for their first loan. They are doing this with the aim of increasing their merchandise and, as their group name suggests in the Miskita language, look to progress and prosper.

Elba is originally from the Auhaya Pigni community. This name in Miskita means sand. Auhaya Pigni is two hours from the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. Elba is 37 years old, married and has three children, who are studying in the city of Bilwi, in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. Elba's husband is a farmer. In order to have her own source of income, two years ago Elba opened a small grocery store in her living room, in her country house that is built with wood. Elba still remembers opening her business with 5000 Córdobas. Elba is currently applying for a loan in order to buy products at the Puerto Cabezas market for her business. She will buy basic grains, dairy products, lavatory paper, toothbrushes, instant soups and cleaning products. Elba's dream is to buy hens and pigs to fatten up and sell at affordable prices.

loans.use: to buy products in Puerto Cabezas for her business (basic grains, dairy products, chlorine, lavatory paper, toothbrushes and instant soups).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 59 years old, married and blessed with six children aged between 20 and one year. He has been in farming activities for the last 15 years, earning an income of KES 20,000.

He has applied for his third loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya and will use the entire loan to buy more farm inputs like fertilizer and seedlings for use on the farm for better yields.

He desires to grow his business and be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 45-year-old man, who is married with eight children; six go to school. He is living in Kasese, Uganda. Joseph operates a retail shop of general merchandise; a business he has operated since 2012. He practices farming growing crops such as cocoa and vanilla, and bee and fish keeping as additional sources of income. Joseph is a hardworking man dreaming of educating his children to the national level. He wants a loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar, rice and soap to sell. Joseph usually complains of inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar, rice and soap to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Susan works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing  business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Susan is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing  business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a widow aged 66 with two children. She sells local beer (amasohi) in rural area and gets additional income from farming. Her clients are the natives. She desires to complete her house. She needs a loan to purchase more materials like iron sheets for constructing her house.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like iron sheets for constructing her house.

loans.name: Foud

texts.en:
Foud is 35 years old, married, and has three children. He is a resident of Dhamar, Yemen. He mentions that he has been involved in selling all kinds of ready-made clothes for more than five years. In the beginning, he started with a small grocery, selling foods and goods for customers in his area. Later, Foud was able to open the clothing store instead of the grocery. 

He has faced problems increasing his business. The location where he sells the clothes is in a clothes market in Dhamar. There is a lot of activity in this area; all types of stylish women's, men's, and children's clothes are sold here. Because of his good customer service skills, he is able to attract more shoppers. He would like to expand his business, so he took out a loan of 500,000 YER. He will use this loan to stock his business with all kinds of stylish ready-made clothes. 

Foud wishes to improve his living conditions by opening a large mall to sell all kinds of clothes and cosmetics.

loans.use: to stock his business with stylish ready-made clothes.

loans.name: Fidel De Jesus

texts.es:
Fidel es un campesino, humilde y trabajador con el empuje y verraquera que distingue a los hombres y mujeres del campo.
Es un Hombre de mente emprendedora y desde muy pequeño aprendió todos los oficios del campo como cultivos y crianza de animales, tanto así que hoy en día tiene su propio cultivo de café; alimentos que vende en la plaza de mercado del municipio de Cocorná, Antioquia.
Este personaje tiene como propósito aumentar sus cultivos y mejorar los que actualmente tiene y es por eso que acude a la ayuda de un crédito para la compra de insumos agropecuarios como fertilizantes y la compra de semillas de papa.
El préstamo le dará la oportunidad de progresar como empresario y como persona, además de aumentar sus ingresos y seguir aportando el sustento en su hogar.
Él lo único que quiere es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Fidel is a humble and hard-working farmer with the drive and will that distinguishes men and women from the country.  

He is a man with an enterprising mind and from a young age he learned all the jobs of the farm such as growing crops and raising livestock. Thus today he has his own coffee crop.  He sells the coffee in the market plaza in the city of Cocorná, Antioquia.  

His goal is to increase his yields and to improve his current crops, and for that reason he is seeking a loan in order to buy agricultural feed and fertilizers as well as seeds for potatoes.  

The loan will give him the opportunity to progress as a businessman and as a person, and it will also increase his income and help him continue to support his household.

The only thing he wants is to be able to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sengly

texts.en: Sengly is 22 years old; she is a student at Cambodia Asian Institute. She lives in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Due to the lack of financial support, she would like to apply for a loan of $2,040 to pay her tuition fee. This loan will help her get a higher education. She hopes that she will get a good job in any local organization or company and earn a bigger home.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fee.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her direct selling business. Her loan helped not just in her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julieta dreams to have a stall in the market to have more customers and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
This is Agnes, aged 45,  and resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nasario, a driver and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income continually for their everyday expenses.  

Agnes operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Agnes hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goats in order to raise and sell them in the local markets

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has four children and none goes to school. Aida has a business of selling green bananas. She has been in this business for over 13 years and works 7 days a week. Aida sells her products at the market, by means of retail and wholesale. Aida has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Aida include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also to educate her children through university. Aida lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include medication and food.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Fizad

texts.en:
Fizad is 52 years old, married and has three children. His family lives in Baku region, but they are IDP  (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city. Fiza's eldest son is 21 years old and learning Fizad’s profession. His eldest daughter is studying at a musical college, while his other child goes to secondary school. 

Fizad, an electrician, has applied for a loan in the amount of 1000AZN-Azerbaijan Neü Manat to repair equipment and buy more needed materials. Thankful to Kiva for this help, in the future he wants to recruit an assistant for his business.

loans.use: to repair his equipment and buy more necessary materials

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 43 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Virginia has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from fish vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Loryn

texts.en:
Loryn has faithfully repaid her previous loan that she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She has to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide their children with a better education. 

To improve sales, Loryn would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 15,000, she can purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Loryn hopes that she can also have stable work to provide for her family aside from making income through her business. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Mukagogo Abagambakamu Group

texts.en: Francis is a 33-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is also a member of Mukagogo Abagambakamu Group where members borrow and guarantee each other. He deals in mining pozzolana and taking photos. He is facing challenges of poor roads, which cause his vehicle to break down  as he is transporting pozzolana. However, he hopes of owning a retail shop as a way of diversifying his business. Francis needs a loan to hire land for mining pozzolana.

loans.use: to hire land for mining pozzolana.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Lenders! Meet Jane, a 54-year-old industrious and charming mother of two who has been farming for the past 24 years to support her family. Jane practices mixed farming (crop and animal farming) and especially enjoys farming finger millet. From the millet she is able to make a porridge that keeps her strong and youthful.

Jane is seeking a loan of KES 10000 so she can start rearing poultry. This will enable her to increase her income level and move out of poverty. Since she is very well known around her village, selling eggs and chicken meat will not be a problem, and repaying the loan will never be a problem.

Once begun, Jane’s major goal is to increase her poultry enterprise and buy a piece of land so that her children can have a secure future.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en: Kamel is a 23-year-old single Palestinian refugee, who has been working in selling vegetables. He has been doing this since he was nine years old after he had to quit school during the elementary stages to support his parents in their living, especially that they are living in a Palestinian refugees camp. Kamel is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenance to his car, which he uses for buying his merchandise from the wholesale market to sell them in the camp, where he lives and works. Kamel is planning to open a shoe selling shop in the future to improve his career path and develop his family's living.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance to his car, which he uses for buying his merchandise from the wholesale market.

loans.name: Lediva

texts.en: Lediva is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts and carry out maintenance for motorcycle to support her motorcycle transport business. Lediva has been in this business for two years. Lediva earns more income from food vending. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts and carry out maintenance for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Inmer Antonio

texts.es:
Inmer de 41 años de edad,  estudio hasta primer grado, manifiesta que no continuo con los estudios ya que proviene de una familia de escasos recursos y además el conflicto armado lo obligo junto a su familia a trasladarse de su vivienda constantemente.  Esta casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar y en la temporada de corta de café ella le apoya con los ingresos del hogar cuando realiza este rubro, con ella han procreado dos hijos un varón que tiene 16 años y está estudiando en el instituto de la ciudad, su hija tenía 10 años y ella falleció debido a que nació con una enfermedad que la llevo a la muerte con solo 10 años de vida, en su casa solo vive Inmer,  su esposa e hijo.

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde que era un niño,  aprendió este trabajo de su padre quien fue una persona entregada a su familia y a trabajar duro para ellos, Inmer ha seguido los pasos de su padre siendo un persona muy entregada a su familia y a trabajar para ellos, siente que con su trabajo él les da a su familia lo que ellos necesitan llevando el alimento para ellos y con muchos esfuerzos, pero con amor le está dando el estudio a su hijo ya que quiere que sea una persona de bien en la comunidad, en su trabajo el horario es muy variado ya que tiene que trabajar en la mañana como jornalero para poder llevar dinero a su familia y por la tarde cultiva la tierra para llevar el alimento a su casa,  así que prácticamente todo el día es de trabajo para él, los fines de semana o cuando su hijo no tiene clases le apoya en el trabajo para que pueda terminar pronto.  

Con el crédito el pagara el arrendo de la tierra donde cultiva maíz y frijol también comprara abonos, venenos e insecticidas para aplicarlos a los cultivos en el tiempo que esto sea requerido por ellos,  para así asegurar una buena producción de granos básicos, comprando todos estos productos él se asegurara de aplicarlos a tiempo a sus cultivos.

Sus sueños son muchos pero lo principal que desea es que su hijo estudie todo lo que el no pudo que se gradué en una carrera universitaria para que tenga una mejor condición de vida,  desea que sus esfuerzos sean bien recompensados por su hijo, también quiere ver su casa más grande con un material más resistente.
texts.en:
Inmer is 41 years old, and went as far as first grade in school. He says that he did not continue with his studies, as he comes from a low-income family and also, the armed conflict in the country obliged him and his family to move from their home constantly. He is married. His wife does the household chores and during the coffee harvest season helps him with the family income when he is carrying out this work.

They have two children, a boy of 16 who attends the local high school and a daughter is who was 10 years old and died due to an illness that led to her death when she was only 10. Only Inmer, his wife and their son live in their home.

He has farmed since he was a child, and learned this work from his father who was a person devoted to his family and to working hard for their sake. Inmer has followed in his father's footsteps by being a person very devoted to his family and to working for them. He feels that with his work he gives his family what they need, by bringing them food. With a great deal of effort but with love, he is helping his son receive an education, as he wants him to be a person of worth in the community. 

In his work the hours vary a great deal, as he has to work in the morning as a day laborer to be able to provide money for his family. In the afternoon, he cultivates the land in order to feed his household. So for him, practically the entire day is work. On weekends or when he has no classes, his son helps him with the work so that he can finish sooner.  

With the loan he will pay for the rent on the land where he grows corn and beans. He will also buy manures, herbicides and insecticides to apply to his crops at the time they need it. This is in order to ensure a good production of basic staples. By buying all these products he will be assured of applying them to his crops on time. 

He has many dreams, but the main one is for his son to study everything that he was not able to, and that he graduate with a university degree so that he will have a better standard of living. He hopes that his efforts will be well rewarded by his son and also wishes to see his house be larger and built with more resistant materials.

loans.use: To pay the rent on the land where he grows corn and beans. He will also buy manures, herbicides and insecticides to apply to his crops.

loans.name: Al- Kher 4 Group

texts.en:
Al- Kher 4 is comprised of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

Boshra is the leader of the group. She is a 38-year-old widow with six children ranging in age from two to 22 years of age. Boshra received only an  elementary school education, having married when she was very young. After her husband passed away, she assumed all responsibility for her children. 

Boshra lives with her children in her own house, and her father, an employee in the public sector, helps her financially because she is without a fixed income. Much of the time, she faces a financial crisis. For this reason, she has applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food for her family.

Boshra looks forward to supplying her house with a variety of foods in order to provide a secure future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase food for her family.

loans.name: José Luz

texts.es:
José de 56 años de edad,  tiene sexto grado de nivel académico.  Comenta que solo hasta ese grado llego ya que antes era bastante difícil estudiar más por la situación económica.  José es casado la esposa se dedica al comercio de granos básicos,  en esta relación ha procreado 8 hijos los cuales dos de ellos están en la escuela y los demás están en hogares apartes.  Con José solo vive la esposa,  dos hijos.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 15 años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño el padre ya que quería que aprendiera muy bien el trabajo para que en el futuro no fuera a sufrir;  pero también José le ayuda a la esposa en el negocio que tiene de granos básicos,  este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 20 minutos y viajan en vehículo y el de la agricultura le queda a una distancia de 10 minutos y viaja a pie en ocasiones le ayuda un hijo al trabajo en un horario de las 6 am a las 12 del mediodía. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para buscar personas que le ayuden a sembrar cacao,  ya que en este año se a propuesto sembrar 3,500 metros cuadrados de palos de cacao y también pagara un carro que le ayude a llevarlos a la casa ya que es ahí cerca que los va a sembrar esto le va ayudar mucho, ya que le están apostando bastante al cacao y esto le va generar muchas ganancias en el futuro

Los sueños de José es que  siempre tenga salud para seguir trabajando en la agricultura y poder ayudarle a la esposa siempre en el negocio que tiene y que les da bastante ganancias,  también espera que le sirva mucho el cultivo del cacao para que por medio de eso tenga muchos ingresos y con las ganancias poder seguir sembrando más hasta tener bastantes palos y una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
José, age 56, has a sixth grade education.  He says that he only got through this grade because it was very difficult to go to school more due to the financial situation.  José is married, and his wife sells basic grains.  They have eight children.  Two of them go to school, and the others are in separate households.  José only lives with his wife and two children.

José has been working in agriculture ever since he was 15 years old.  His father taught him this work because he wanted him to learn the work well so that he would not suffer in the future.  José also helps his wife with her basic grains business.  This work is 20 minutes away, and they get there in a vehicle.  His agricultural work is 10 minutes away, and he gets there by foot.  At times his son helps him work a schedule from 6 a.m. until 12 noon.

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo is to find people to help him plant cacao.  This year he has set out to plant 3,500 square meters of trees.  He will also pay a car to help him take them to his house.  It is near there that he will plant them, and this will help him a lot.  They are wagering a lot on cacao, and this is going to generate a lot of profits in the future.

José's dreams are to always have good health so that he can continue working in agriculture, to be able to help his wife always in the business that she has, and for the business to give them good profits.  He also hopes that the cacao crop is good for him so that he gets a lot of income.  With the profits he hopes to be able to continue planting more until he has plenty of trees and a good harvest.

loans.use: to find people to help plant cacao, to buy cacao trees, and to pay for a car to help him get the trees home.

loans.name: Ngetich

texts.en:
Lenders! Meet Ngetich, a 34-year-old very hardworking and passionate farmer, who loves every bit of farming. He comes from the Molo area of Kenya an area well known for potato farming. Being the only bread winner in his family Ngetich has to work even harder in his farm so that he can be able to comfortably take care of his four children and wife.

Ngetich has been doing farming for the past five years and through hard work that he puts in the field, he has made sure that his family does not lack any basic needs although he is not that comfortable.

Having an entrepreneurial mind has assisted Ngetich to diversify and not only do crop farming but also do dairy farming so that he can make ends meet. 
Ngetich's biggest challenge while doing dairy farming is dairy disease but he has managed to put the situation under control.

Because of a zeal to succeed Ngetich is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 in order to be able to put up a greenhouse .In the greenhouse he is planning to plant tomatoes and passion fruits.

Ngetich has been able to identify a niche market for tomatoes in his area and he wants to take full advantage of the situation because in his village he will be the only supplier of tomatoes.

Being the only supplier means that he will enjoy a monopoly which means reaping all the profits and hence improving their standard of living.  Through the profits he is able to always pay his loan on time and impact the people living around him and the surroundings

loans.use: to buy a greenhouse

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Eunice, a very hardworking mother of three adorable children, who hails from Eldoret or as others would like to put it the  "city of champions”. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and farming. 

Eldoret enjoys favorable weather patterns and this boosts crop production in the area. Eunice being someone who is very ambitious and someone who always takes advantage of positive things would like to capitalize on the good weather patterns experienced in the region and boast her farming. 
Being a hardworking mother, Eunice has always ensured that she puts food on the table for her family and also to be able to take her children to school.

Eunice detests living in poverty conditions and she has a plan to improve her standard of living which is why she is seeking a loan of KES 42,400 in order to be able to purchase a dairy cow that will help in producing milk and manure to be used in her farm. Milk from the cow will be sold to the local market and this means improved cash flow. Through improved cash flow this means that profits will be high and she can comfortably take care of her family and take her kids to school.

Through your loan Eunice will be empowered economically and be able to improve her standard of living and also that of people living within the area.

Eunice is very comfortable with the repayment plan and the monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Abdulwahd

texts.en: Abdulwahd started his own business selling cosmetics, clothes and perfumes in a small shop. He took out a first loan from Kiva lenders to increase his capital through purchasing more cosmetics and accessories. With time, he developed his business from a cosmetics store to a grocery store. The first loan helped him improve his business very much. He is very thankful for Kiva lenders for their first loan. Abdulwahd did not finish the repayment of the installments of the first loan, but in order to increase his business more, he applied for a concurrent loan of 500,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase more of foods and goods for his grocery. He hopes that this loan will be financed.

loans.use: to purchase more of foods, goods, and items for his grocery.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Kiva Lenders! Meet Alexander --  a most hardworking and energetic person. He is a family man and he has two lovely children that he supports. Being raised from a humble background, Alex practices a lot of humility and this has helped him in the farming business because farming requires a lot of patience and humility.

Alexander lives in the Kitale area of Kenya also known as the bread basket of Kenya and the weather patterns there favor farming which is the main economic activity being practiced there. Alex has been a farmer for the past four years and he has never regretted starting farming because through farming he has been able to take care of his family and earn an honest and decent income. 

Alex is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 in order to be able to start poultry farming. He is very comfortable with the payment period and repayment schedule.

With your loan Alexander is sure that he will improve his life and living conditions and be able to elevate his standard of living.

Through the loan Alex will be able to sell eggs and chicken meat to his neighbors and also the villagers around hence generating more income for his family.

Alex's long term goal is to be able to have more poultry farms, to secure the future of his young family and also to impact society.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Meet Mary, a very dedicated, ambitious, and strong woman who is 52 years of age, but can easily be mistaken to be 30 years old, because of her jovial nature. Mary is a mother of two children and comes from Eldoret area of Kenya that is known to have favorable climatic conditions. Mary has been practicing farming for two years. She has always enjoyed what she does, and does not regret any bit of it. Mary has always been a hard worker, and has been able to take care of her family and take her children to school. Mary never completed her formal education and does not want the same situation to repeat itself for her children. That is why she is willing to go that extra mile and make sure that her children get the best education and become great people in the future.

Mary is seeking a loan of KES 40,000 to start poultry keeping. Through poultry keeping she will be able to get money from selling eggs and meat. Through profits that she would be making, Mary will be able to comfortably repay the loan on time.

Rearing chickens has always been Mary’s dream, and this loan will make her seize the opportunity of starting her own poultry farm. With this loan, Mary will be able to sell eggs to the nearby shops and homes and through the profits generated, she will take care of her family and try to alleviate the poverty that they are currently facing. Mary’s long-term goal is to be able to have more poultry farms, and this will be achieved through savings. Hence, being able to alleviate poverty and having a positive impact on the society.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou owns and operates a buy and sell business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for sixteen years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by purchasing eco-bags and sell them at lower cost.

Relative to this, she would like to take out a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of PHP 50,000 to buy more quantities of candies and toy products needed in her business. Marilou sincerely expresses her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, she dreams of having a brand new van. She also hopes that her business will improve and continue to help her provide for their everyday needs. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for an additional stock of toy products and candies needed in her business.

loans.name: Manzana 1 Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario Manzana 1, integrado por 6 mujeres trabajadores, originarias de la comunidad El Wawa,  que se localiza a una hora del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron recientemente con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida, comprar mercadería, por medio del acceso a su primer financiamiento.

Romelia: Es una joven de 21 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos, el mayor de 7 años asiste al colegio de la comunidad y 2 menores de edad. Su esposo es militar. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 2 años, estableció una pequeña pulpería en un punto estratégico, en el cual circula población que viajan hacia los diferentes municipios y comunidades de la Región Autónoma del Atlántico Norte (RAAN) y hacia Managua. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Puerto Cabezas: granos básicos, chiverías, gaseosas, agua purificada, entre otros. Su sueño es ampliar su pulpería.
texts.en:
The Solidario Manzana 1 communal bank is comprised of six hard-working women from the El Wawa community.  It is located one hour from the Puerto Cabezas municipality.  They organized recently with the goal of improving their quality of life and buying merchandise through their first loan.

Romelia is a 21 year old young woman.  She is married and has three children.  The oldest is seven and goes to the community school.  She has two younger children, and her husband is in the military.

In order to have her own source of income, she established a small grocery store in a strategic location two years ago.  The population travels by this location headed to different municipalities and communities in the Región Autónoma del Atlántico Norte (RAAN) and towards Managua.

She is requesting her first loan to buy merchandise in Puerto Cabezas.  She will buy basic grains, snacks, soft drinks, and purifies water, among other items.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans was born and raised in Kisii a county in Kenya, and later moved to Nairobi the capital city, in search of employment. He was not able to get employed, but decided to start a small business for his upkeep. He managed to save toward growing his business, to be able to earn a little more income. 

However, Evans is not happy about the sanitation situation in his neighborhood and has decided to look for a solution. He seeks a loan to help him purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets. The toilets will create a better environment and reduce the risk of sanitation related ailments. He will run the facility as pay per use toilets, and hopes to repay his loan using the money earned. He hopes to grow his franchise in the future and earn more so that he could improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: Mukus Group

texts.es:
Teresa: Es una señora amable, sociable de 42 años de edad, originaria de la comunidad de Panua, ubicada a dos horas y media del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, casada con 9 hijos: 4 son mayores de edad e independientes y 3 que estudian su secundaria y técnico en docencia en Puerto Cabezas. Su esposo es agricultor y maderero. Recientemente organizo a 3 mujeres luchadoras, con el propósito de conformar el grupo solidario MUKUS, en lengua miskita significa niebla, con el propósito de acceder a su primer financiamiento para comprar productos en Puerto Cabezas y venderlos a precios accesibles en su comunidad.

Esta cordial mujer desde hace un año estableció una pequeña pulpería en un anexo en la sala de su casa de tambo de madera, aun recuerda que inicio con capital propio con C$ 7000 (Siete mil córdobas netos). Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar en el mercado de Puerto Cabezas productos para su negocio: Granos básicos, chiverías, harina, cepillos de diente entre otros productos. Su sueño es comprar gallinas y cerdo engordarlos y venderlos a precios accesibles.
texts.en:
Teresa is a friendly, sociable woman of 42. She is from the community of Panua located about two and a half hours from the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. She is married and has nine children: four adults living independently, and three who are students in secondary school and technical college studying teaching in Puerto Cabezas. Teresa's husband is a farmer and timber merchant. She recently organized these three hardworking woman into a group called MUKUS. In the Miskita language that means mist. The group's goal is is to obtain its first loan to buy products in Puerto Cabezas and then sell them at fair prices in the community.

A year ago Teresa established a small corner store in part of the living room of her wooden home. She started the store using her own money (7,000 cordobas). Now she is seeking a loan to buy the following products from the market in Puerto Cabezas: basic grains, milk products, flour, toothbrushes etc. Her dream is to buy chicks and piglets to fatten and then sell at fair prices.

loans.use: Buy basic grains, milk products, flour, toothbrushes etc. for her store

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene, tiene la edad  de 40 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su esposo  y sus hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de equipo y materiales requeridos para realizar trabajos de belleza y así poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de estilos de corte de cabello y tratamientos de uñas y otros servicios adicionales y con productos y técnicas de alta calidad y seguridad, y de esta manera poderle ofreces a los clientes una mayor cantidad de productos para el uso humano y todos y todos con garantía. Con esta compra pretende tener mejores ingresos para invertir más en su negocio y cumplir algunas metas que en el futuro le mejorará su calidad de vida para ella y su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marlene, age 40, is in a common-law marriage.  She lives with her husband and their children, and they are her greatest priority.  She plans to use the loan to buy equipment and supplies that are needed to do beauty jobs.  This way she will be able to offer a greater variety of haircut styles, nail treatments, and other additional services,  She will have high quality and safe products and techniques.  

This way she will be able to offer her customers a greater quantity of products for their use, and all of them will be guaranteed.  With this purchase she plans to have better income to invest in her business more and to reach some goals, which in the future will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not previously had other loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR has provided her a loan with easier terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon materials.

loans.name: Louay

texts.en: Louay is a 29-year-old single Palestinian refugee, who lives in a Palestinian camp since he was born. Louay works in a construction business specialized in electricity work since 2006. Louay is a hard worker who puts so much effort on developing his business to improve his family's living. Today, Louay is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to build his own dream house inside the camp he is living in. This will be Louay's third loan cycle from Al Majmoua, his previous loans were invested in developing his business with a good standing repayment history. He is looking forward to opening a  shop where he can start selling electrical household appliances to increase his income and develop his living.

loans.use: To continue building his house.

loans.name: Sreyleak

texts.en: Sreyleak is 22-years-old, and a student in Battambang Province. She lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia. Due to the lack of financial support, she would like to apply for a loan of $765 to pay her tuition fee. This loan will help her get a higher education. She hopes that she will finish her Master's Degree and when she has any children, she will urge them to graduate so that they can get good jobs.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fee.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Beverly dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her general store business.

loans.name: Lion

texts.en: Lion wants to by dairy cows and sheep. Lion, who has been photographed at his recently built family home, is a 34-year-old, hardworking, married man and a father of two; nine and seven years old. He does agriculture, livestock for a living, and he says he likes what he does.  At the moment, he’s got pigs and chickens and plants almost all seasonal veggies, beans, and onions that he sells dried. Lion also works in the construction industry and his talents rely on carving on stone.  Lion lived and worked in the neighboring country, Greece, for almost nine years. With the money he saved, he built the house that is not finished yet due to the shortage of money.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows and sheep.

loans.name: Ginna

texts.es: Ginna, tiene la edad  de 34 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y su hijo los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra de frijol y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, además pagar mano de obra de trabajos de conservación de suelos para evitar la erosión principalmente por la lluvia y en la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Ginna is 34. She is married and lives with her husband and son who is her highest priority. She wants to use this loan to buy fertilizers and other products to apply to her bean crops so they can grow stronger, and, also to hire some help to work on soil conservation to prevent erosion mainly by rain and to apply those fertilizers and assist her during the planting process, so she can be sure she is going a good job. She aims to take advantage of good weather and soil conditions in her area ideal for this crop, and also to use her many years of experience in handling basic grains. Also, she wants to be able to buy the best quality products for planting that will have a good development and health as well as an adequate harvest, and have a significant short-term production. She hopes to use the earnings from this harvest to cover family and school expenses and to meet some family goals as well as to continue investing in more crops. This is her first loan received from FUDECOSUR. She had't had loans from any other state banks, but FUDECOSUR gave her this loan without problems and at a very low rate.

loans.use: to plant beans

loans.name: Duman

texts.en: Duman is 35 years old, and he is living in Fuzuli region with his lovely wife and child.  They are IDP-Internally Displaced Person from Fuzuli city. Duman has been in the taxi driver business for seven years. Now his car needs repairs and Duman wants to change the tires of the car. For that he needs a loan in amount of 800 AZN. Duman says he is thankful to Kiva organization and all lenders for this help.

loans.use: to pay repairs and for changing the tires on his car.

loans.name: José

texts.es: José, tiene la edad de 31 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su esposa la cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra de frijol y así que tenga un buen desarrollo, ya que la semilla de frijol de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José is 31 years old and lives with his much-loved partner. With the loan he plans to buy fertilizer and other products for his bean crop so that it will grow well. He wants to purchase good quality beans as well as hire laborers to assist with the application of the products and the maintenance of the plants once they have grown. In this way he will be assured a good harvest.

José is trying to benefit from the good climatic conditions and soil of the area, as well as his many years' experience growing basic grains. He also wishes to buy the best products and of the best quality so that his fields will be productive and healthy and the harvest good. 

With the money he earns from the harvest he wants to use it for the well being of his family, achieve some family goals, and continue investing in his farm. This is José's first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had any loans previously with state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with good terms and low interest rates.

loans.use: Grow beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell calves

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer joven de 18 años de edad soltera y sin hijos.
Ella es una joven artesana, se ocupa de trenzar la madera, vive con sus padres y hermanos. La artesanía es una labor que heredó de sus ancestros y que lleva realizándola toda su vida. Su taller es al aire libre y ocupa para trabajar el patio de su casa. Ella tiene el sueño de tener su propio negocio y un taller de verdad dónde elaborar sus trabajos. Su negocio tiene la necesidad constante de comprar madera y muchas veces Teresa no cuenta con el capital monetario para realizar la compra y pierde clientes y ventas.
Su negocio paga los gastos de manutención de ella y su hermano menor de 9 años, ambos trabajan y venden su artesanía.
Es por esos motivos que Teresa solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera para realizar canastas.
texts.en:
18-year old Teresa is single and doesn't have any children. She is an artisan and makes baskets from wood. She lives with her parents and siblings. She learned her craft from ancestors and has been doing it all her life. She works in the open air on the patio of her house. Her dream is to have her own business and a proper workshop. She has a constant need to buy wood but often lacks the money to do so, thus losing customers and sales.

Teresa uses the income from her business to support herself and her 9-year old brother. They work together making and selling crafts. For these reasons Teresa is seeking a loan to buy wood to make baskets.

loans.use: to buy wood in bulk

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en: Siranush lives in Narek village of Ararat region with her husband and two sons. Jointly with her husband, she has been running a farm for seven years already. Unfortunately, their sons are both teenagers and are not able to fully engage in agricultural activities. That is why it is really hard for Siranush and her husband to make ends meet. The family owns an orchard and grows apricots, pomegranates, apples, peaches and other fruits. Siranush's husband sells the agricultural products in local markets. Now the family wants to expand its agribusiness. A loan of USD 3,000 will be a great support, enabling them to renovate the barn, pay for fuel and fertilizers, and finance the soil-plowing process. Let's help this hardworking woman and her family to implement their goals.

loans.use: to renovate the barn, pay for fertilizers and fuel, and finance soil-plowing activities.

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es:
María, se dedica a vender ropa para damas, caballeros y niños/as, trabaja desde las seis de la mañana a las cuatro de la tarde, está actividad la aprendió junto a su mamá desde que era una niña y que hoy la practica con el fin de tener ingresos para costear los gastos de su hogar, María es casada, su esposo la apoya en atender el negocio.
Le servirá para comprar pantalones, faldas, chores, camisas, blusas, vestidos, ropa interior, toallas, entre otra piezas para surtir de nuevas prendas su negocio, espera atraer nuevos clientes y mantenerse en el mercado para mejorar su situación económica y cumplir debidamente con sus compromisos.
El sueño de la Sra.: María es tener un bazar en el que pueda ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en: Mary sells clothing for men, women and children. She works from from six in the morning until four in the afternoon. She used to watch her mother do this activity when she was a child and now she uses those same skills to cover her household expenses. Mary is married, and her husband helps her take care of the business. She will use this loan to to buy pants, skits, short, shirts, blouses, dresses, underwear, towels and other garments to restock her business. She hopes to attract new customers and stay in the market to improve her financial situation and fulfill all her obligations. Her dream is to open a bazaar where she can offer a wider range of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy pants, skits, short, shirts, blouses, dresses, underwear, towels and other garments

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
In the photograph are Lindita and her three beautiful children ranging in age from six to nine years old. She wants to install doors and windows to their recently built home as seen in the photo; they live in the suburbia of a little city in northern Albania. 

Lindita does agriculture livestock, and she plants mostly seasonal veggies, beans, onions, and potatoes that she sells dried. She also has pigs and sells piglets twice a year. In addition to what she does on her own, she works for pay at a nearby large dairy farm as a technologist. Her husband works only in the summer months at the same place as a worker.

loans.use: to install doors and windows to their recently built home.

loans.name: Asem

texts.en: Asem is a 32-year-old farmer. He is an IDP-Internally Displaced Person from Füzuli city and now lives in Mahmudlu village of Füzuli region. He was married for 11 years and has a daughter. She is 9 years old and goes to third class of school. Asem has been raising cows for six years. He buys little calves, raises them, and sells them in the local bazaar. Today Asem wants to buy two calves for his farm. For this reason he needs 1,200 AZN and therefore, he has applied to Komak company for a loan. He says he is thankful to Kiva organization for this help. In the future, Asem wishes to develop the industry, increase the income, and to give his daughter a good education.

loans.use: to buy two calves for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy catle

loans.name: Jose Eliseo

texts.es:
José, sigue esforzándose por equipar su car wash y opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar una aspiradora para vehículo, para realizar mejor su trabajo, mantener satisfechos a sus clientes y seguir mejorando su situación económica.
Con el financiamiento anterior se pudo comprar una máquina para lavar vehículos, con lo que ha mejorado su negocio, tiene buenas ganancias, brinda a su familia una vida más confortable y cancelo puntualmente su deuda.
texts.en:
José keeps making an effort to equip his car wash and opts for a new loan in order to buy a vacuum cleaner for cars. He wishes to do his job better, to keep his customers satisfied and to keep improving his economic situation.

With the previous loan he was able to buy a machine to wash vehicles, which has improved his business. He has good income, provides his family a more comfortable life and paid off his debt in time.

loans.use: to buy a vacuum cleaner for cars

loans.name: Gezim

texts.en:
Gezim (Joy) in Albanian is a 44-year-old, married villager and father of six. His oldest child, his daughter, is getting married soon.  In their region’s tradition, (northern part of Albania) parents organize and cover the wedding expenses of their children. 

Agriculture, livestock is what he does most. Currently, he’s got two cows that he’s been photographed with, and he sells raw milk and baby calves to the local farmer’s market. He also owns eight dynym of agricultural land where he plants quantities of fodder for animals, and onions, beans and potatoes. To add to this, he works for pay as a night guard, whereas his wife and a son get disability pension.
Gezim would appreciate very much your financial help.

loans.use: to pay for his oldest daughter's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Francisca Antonia

texts.es:
Francisca, invirtió el préstamo anterior en la compra de insumos para elaborar la venta de pupusas y plato típicos, con lo que mejoró el servicio hacia sus clientes, su situación familiar se mantiene, su situación financiera es más estable.
Por la necesidad de cubrir las nuevas demandas de sus clientes requiere de más capital para comprar harina, aceite, loroco, tomates, repollo, bebidas, gas propano, quesillo, chicharrón, aderezos, plátanos, queso, bolsas y servilletas, así seguirá funcionando su negocio, ella tendrá los ingresos que necesita para subsistir y cancelar la nueva deuda.
texts.en: Francisca used her previous loan to buy basic items to make and sell local tortillas and other dishes, which improved her customer service. Her family continues to improve and her financial situation is more stable. As she needs to meet new customer demands, she needs more capital to buy flour, oil, loroco, tomatoes, cabbage, beverages, propane gas, french cheese, pork, seasonings, bananas, cheese, bags and napkins, so she can continue in operation. This way, she will have enough income to survive and repay her new loan.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, loroco, tomatoes, cabbage, beverages, propane gas, french cheese, pork, seasonings, bananas, cheese, bags and napkins

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 56-year-old hardworking and passionate farmer who comes from a banana growing region known as Kisii in Kenya. She is a tender and caring mother of 5 children.  She diligently cares for them.
