Alice has farmed for 3 years and has grown bananas for both home consumption and commercial purposes. She earns a decent living growing bananas,  selling eggs, and growing tea.  She is able to provide for her family.

Alice, an entrepreneur, is someone who plans ahead. She seeks 31,200 KES  to buy a dairy cow that will assist her to accumulate more profits. Alice will be able to sell milk since the demand is high and the supply in her village is low (most farmers don’t have dairy cows). This in return will translate to more profits and income.

Alice is comfortable with the repayment method and interest and is sure that she will be able to repay the loan on time.

Alice's long term plans are to own more than 5 dairy cows after 2 years and secure her family's future and live comfortably.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en: Nina is self-employed from Miasnikyan village of Armavir region. She lives there with her husband and three children (one daughter and two sons). Jointly with her husband, Nina has been running a farm for many years. They cultivate watermelons, tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, and grow various fruits (apricots, peaches, grapes). In order to sustain her agribusiness and make it more profitable, Nina wants to make some investments. With a perfect credit history, she has now applied for a loan of USD 1,000 to buy 15 bags of fertilizer, to pay water bills and to compensate her workers. Nina and her husband work really hard to be able to take care of their children. Let's help them expand their agribusiness and improve their financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase 15 bags of fertilizer, to pay water bills, and to compensate the workers.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teófilo, es una persona reconocida en su comunidad por su responsabilidad y sus buenos principios religiosos, vive únicamente con su esposa; se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos, así mismo combina el cultivo de granos básicos, manifiesta que son oficios  que heredo de sus padres y que hoy son la manera en que genera ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, Su ventaja es que las propiedades en que realiza sus trabajos son propias, trabaja de manera independiente desde hace 6 años.
Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de semilla, fertilizantes, insecticidas, plaguicidas y abono, de esta manera cultivara granos básicos para consumo familiar y poder vender a sus clientes, también tendrá a su disposición afrecho para alimentar el ganado. Uno de los riesgos más fuertes son los cambios climáticos que puedan dañar sus cultivos.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando mucho para generar ingresos necesarios para tener en un futuro una vida más confortable junto a su esposa y cancelar puntualmente su deuda.
texts.en:
Teófilo is a renowned person in his community because of his responsibility and his good religious principles, living only with his wife. He makes a living raising cattle and pigs, and combines this with growing basic grains. He says that these are professions that he inherited from his parents and that today are the way in which he generates income in order to cover the basic needs of his family. His advantage is that the properties in which he works are his own, working them independently for the last 6 years.

He will invest the loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, insecticides, pesticides and manure. In this manner he will cultivate basic grains for the consumption of his family and to be sold to his customers. He will also have bran to feed the cattle. One of the main risks for him are the climatic changes that can damage his crops.

His dream is to keep working hard in order to generate income so as to have a more comfortable life in the future together with his wife, and to pay his debt in time.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertiliser, insecticides, pesticides and manure

loans.name: Amara

texts.en: This is 32-year-old Amara.  He is married, and has one child aged eight. In 2011, Amara established his DVD cassette, downloading, ipod, phones and empty CD business. He began his business because he wants to improve on his livelihood, and take good care of his family. Working six days a week, and nine hours a day, he earns about SLL 620,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Amara now requires a new loan in order to purchase more stock for resale. In the future, Amara plans to educate his children, improve his standard of living, and increase his profit earnings. Competition and low capital are his challenges. He is looking forward to your support.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 33 years old and a resident of a rural area in Kyengera, She has three children and two dependents. 

Ruth's sister passed away three years ago and Ruth is obligated to take care of her sister’s children. She pays their tuition from the little income she earns from her boutique business.

Ruth started her business three years ago as source of income after she had gotten tired of being an employee.  She started this business as a way to support herself and family since she is the breadwinner for the entire family, despite the fact that she is a widow.

Ruth’s business is strategically located but her major challenge is inadequate capital.  This prevents her from buying bulk quantities of items. That hinders business growth and expansion as well as her profits since she has to shop all the time. She  requests funding to bridge the gap.  The 2,000,000 UGX will help her to buy bulk quantities of garments at a reduced rate.

Her neighbors commend her for being a hard-working, determined, and supportive person in society.

loans.use: to buy garments to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, vive junto a su hija, quien ya es mayor de edad y le ayuda en su negocio; siendo muy joven aprendió de su mamá a elaborar tortillas, pero para consumo familiar, en busca de independencia se mudó a una zona en donde se le hiciera más fácil establecer su propio negocio en el que ofrece tortillas y pupusas, no tiene un horario fijo.
El crédito le será de mucha utilidad para comprar maíz, cal, leña y gas propano, al por mayor y que por su naturaleza tienen mucho tiene mucho tiempo de duración, lo cual le permitirá mantenerse trabajando, espera aumentar su productividad, ganar más clientes, incrementar las ganancias para cancelar su deuda sin atrasos.
Su visión es continuar trabajando para mejorar las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Blanca lives with her daughter, who's of age and helps her with the business. At a very young age, she learn from her mother to make tortillas, just for the family. Seeking independence, she moved to an area where it would be easier to establish a business and offer tortillas, although she doesn't have a fixed schedule.  She will use this loan to buy wholesale corn, lime, charcoal and propane gas, this way, they will last her quite a while, so she can work for a long period of time, and, she hopes, increase her productivity, gain more customers, increase revenues and repay this loan without delay. 
Her goal is to continue working to improve her family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, charcoal and propane gas

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph a 53-year-old man who has farmed for the last 4 years. Joseph is an honest and hardworking father of 4 children who enjoys farm work and wakes up every day early in the morning to go to his farm. Joseph resides in Molo, Kenya.

Joseph farms for both commercial and home use.  He sells eggs and milk to generate more income.

Joseph plans to raise poultry but the main problem he faces is getting the business off the ground. He seeks 30,000 KES to be able to make his dream a reality.

Joseph would be able to assure his family a comfortable life.  Joseph has reviewed the repayment schedule and is very comfortable with the payment method. He is sure that he will be able to improve society by employing other people to work for him on the farm.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Engjellushe

texts.en:
Engjellushe (Angel) wants your help again to repair her bathroom.  She used a previous loan to renovate her small one-room house.

Kindly note that she is very grateful to the lenders for their financial support and  kindness.

loans.use: to make some minor renovations to her bathroom.

loans.name: Wawa Prana Group

texts.es:
Este solidario está integrado por 10 mujeres trabajadoras de la comunidad WAWA, que se localiza a una hora del municipio de Puerto Cabezas, recientemente se organizaron para conformar el grupo solidario WAWA PRANA, con el propósito de acceder a su primer financiamiento y comprar insumos para elaborar fritos (pilipitas, pollo frito y ensalada de repollo), tamuga (gallopinto, yuca y cerdo frito). Sus productos son ofertados en el lanchon (medio utilizado para poder trasladarse a otros municipios y departamentos de la RAAN).

Maura es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, tiene 39 años de edad, casada con 7 hijos: 3 son mayores de edad y 4 adolecentes que estudian su primaria. Su esposo es cayuquero. Desde hace 10 meses vende tamua, pan de coco, frito, gaseosas en el lanchon. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar insumos para elaborar sus productos: harina, levadura, aceite, coco, bolsas plásticas, repollo, pilipitas, pollo, cerdo, arroz y frijoles, gaseosas. Su sueño es establecer una comideria en su casa, vender ropa usada.
texts.en:
This communal bank is made up of 10 hard-working women from the community of Wawa which is located an hour from the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. The organized themselves recently as the "Wawa Prana" communal bank with the aim of accessing their first loan and buying supplies for making fried snacks (pilipita bananas, fried chicken, cabbage salad, tamuga (dish made with rice and beans, yuca and fried pork). Their products are sold from a small boat (a way used to travel to other municipalities and departments in the RAAN (North Atlantic Autonomous Region).

Maura is the coordinator of the communal bank. She is 39 years old, married, and has seven children, three of whom are adults, and four teenagers who go to primary school. Her husband is a boat operator.

For 10 years she has been selling tamuga, coconut bread, fried snacks, and soft drinks from the boat. She is requesting her first loan in order to buy ingredients and supplies for making her products: flour, yeast, cooking oil, coconut, plastic bags, cabbage, pilipitas bananas, chicken, pork, rice, beans and soft drinks. 

Her dream is to set up an eatery in her home, and to sell used clothing.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for making their products: flour, yeast, cooking oil, coconut, plastic bags, cabbage, pilipitas bananas, chicken, pork, rice, beans and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ana Gilma

texts.es:
Ana, utilizó el préstamo anterior para invertirlo en la crianza de cerdos y la venta de ropa, con lo que ha tenido mejores utilidades y le sirven para cancelar su deuda, mejorar el estilo de vida familiar. Su negocio ha mejorado puesto que ya empieza a comercializar ganado.
Con su aspiración de continuar trabajando y mejorando su situación familiar se decidió por solicitar más capital que invertirá en la compra de concentrados y vitaminas, tanto para cerdos como para ganado.
texts.en: Ana used her previous loan to invest in breeding pigs and selling clothes, which had higher earnings and will help to pay for this new one and to improve her family lifestyle. Her business has improved since she was able to start marketing her cattle. Her goal is to continue working and improving her family situation so she decided to ask for more capital to invest in the purchase of concentrates and vitamins for both pigs and cattle.

loans.use: compra de concentrados y vitaminas, tanto para cerdos como para ganado

loans.name: Jose Porfirio

texts.es:
José, cultiva granos básicos desde hace 25 años, en ocasiones contrata mozos para que le ayuden a realizar sus actividades, su horario es de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde, su padre le enseño este oficio; José es soltero y aún vive con su familia.
Con el préstamo comprara abono, semilla, insecticida, fertilizantes y herbicidas, con la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios, obtendrá cosechas abundantes y sanas. Como riesgo identifica los cambios bruscos del clima.
Su sueño es mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia, cancelar la deuda e ir ampliando su negocio.
texts.en: José has harvested basic grains for 25 years and sometimes he hires grooms to help him in the business. He works 7 to 3, and he learned this trade from his father. He is single and still lives with his family. He needs this loan to buy compost, seed, insecticide, fertilizers and herbicides. With this purchase of agricultural inputs needed, he hopes to get healthy and abundant crops. He identifies abrupt climate changes as a risk for this season. His dream is to improve his family lifestyle, and cancel this loan and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy compost, seed, insecticide, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eggs, cream, soap, and other goods.

loans.name: Megyefo Nyame Group

texts.en:
The Megyefo Nyame (God the savior) group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The featured borrower of this group, named Abena, is standing on the right in the photo. This is the seventh time that this group requests financial help from ID-Ghana in order to raise the standard of their activities. 

Abena lives with her husband and has two children. All of them go to school and all of them are dependent on them. Abena and her husband are responsible for the family expenses. She did not go to school. 

Abena has been selling Shea butter and other creams for both body and hair in her neighborhood, which enables her to provide for her family. She buys her stock at a market in Ghana. 

Hoping to improve service to her customers, Abena and the other members of the Megyefo Nyame group request a seventh loan from ID-Ghana. The previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy Shea butter and other creams both for body and hair to sell to customers.

loans.name: Muhamet

texts.en:
Muhamet needs your financial help again.  He used a previous loan to renovate his run down home.  He did not finish because the loan was not enough. 

This time Muhamet wants to install a boiler, buy windows, and tile the floor.

loans.use: to continue repairing his home.

loans.name: Tassie

texts.en: This is 51-year-old Tassie. She is married and has six children, ages 35, 30, 28, 26, 20, and 16. In 2009, Tassie established her business selling provisions and assorted items. She began her business because she had to support her family. Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about 1,100,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Tassie has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase more mega drinks, soap, water, sugar, and milk. In the future, Tassie plans to expand her business and to educate her son. Competition and the rainy season are her biggest challenges. This business has helped her in raising her children. She is looking forward to funds that will help her in developing her business so that she will save enough for her retirement. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more mega drinks, soap, water, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento que invertirá en la compra de abono, semilla, herbicidas, plaguicidas, alimentó para cerdos y ganado, fortalecerá el ganado y podrá preparar el terreno para su próxima milpa.
Con ayuda del crédito anterior mejoro su negocio, tuvo cerdos para el destazo, ha logrado finalizar una casa que poco a poco han ido construyendo.
texts.en:
Carmen is requesting for a new loan to be invested in the purchase of fertilizer, seed, herbicides, pesticides, feed to pigs and cattle, which will strengthen his livestock so he can prepare his cornfield for the new season. 
He used his last loan to improve his business, got some pigs for sale and was able to finish his home that was under construction.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, herbicides, pesticides, feed to pigs and cattle

loans.name: Jose David

texts.en:
Jose David is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story.

Jose David is 29 years old and has been married to Ana for the last 9 years. Jose David has two jobs. He works in a bakery that his father started and also works with his wife in a store they opened a couple years ago, in which they sell office and school supplies. In the store he also makes photocopies. He needs this loan to buy more school supplies for the back to school season. After he finishes repaying the loan he wants to buy a color photocopier.

In the future he wants to be known as the best school supplies store in the neighborhood and also build a house.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as notebooks, pens, pencils, colors, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice lives in Ntinda with her family. She is 50 years old and cares for orphans.  She has two children who attend school. 

She constructs houses for a rental business. She has a lot of competition from her neighbors and her tenants don’t pay on time.

She hopes to renovate her houses to meet current market demands. She is hard working and honest. She appreciates the work done by the kiva lenders and pledges to work hard to maintain their trust.

loans.use: to buy materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s education.

loans.name: Zamukanawe Cb Group

texts.en:
Zamukanawe is a group loan led by Donata. The group name means "rise up" in English. 

The group members have different kinds of businesses and they aim to improve the standard of business. They will use the loan to buy bananas and sorghum. The profits will go into savings.

loans.use: to buy bananas and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland wants to invest in a trailer for his agricultural tractor.

Roland is a villager who lives in southern Albania's Korca district.  He is 39 years old and has three children who are 13, 9 and 6 years old. 

He earns a living in agriculture and livestock. He  has dairy cows and calves and grows beans and corn to sell dried. His clients are local market and wholesale buyers.  

Roland’s village is built on fertile soil and potatoes, onions, beans, corn, and wheat grow very well here. Almost every household has cows, since goats prefer mountains for grazing and sheep graze out of the stable.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer for his tractor.

loans.name: Maharram

texts.en:
Maharram is 39-years-old, married and has three children. They live in the Baku region but Maharram is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Djabrayil city. His wife is a housewife. Maharram’s elder daughter is studying at college and both of two other children are going to school. Maharram rents a store and in this store he sells different toys such as cars, puzzles, puppets, etc. He loves little children and therefore loves his job. 

Today he wants to support his lovely business for this reason he has applied to Kiva partner Komak company for a loan in the amount of 800AZN (Azerbaijam New Manat) to buy more toys to sell. Maharram is thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for help. In the future he wants to provide a better future for his children.

loans.use: to buy more toys to sell.

loans.name: Shukufa

texts.en:
Shukufa is 48-years-old. She is married and is living with her husband and three children. She has five children in total, two of them are married. The family members have been internally displaced persons (IDPs) from Füzuli city for over 20 years and now live in the Bala Bahmanli village of Füzuli region. Her elder son entered college last year, her daughter graduated school and helps Shukufa in her business and her youngest son goes to secondary school in their village. 

Shukufa keeps cows. She sells their milk and milk products (yogurt, cheese, etc). Now Shukufa wants to buy more cows to increase her business.  Therefore, she needs a loan of  2100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). It was noted that previously she borrowed a loan from Kiva organization and paid in time. Shukufa is greatly thankful for all loans from Kiva and she wants to build a big stall for cows in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cows.

loans.name: Umucyo Tcb Group

texts.en:
Mwamini is 32 years old.  She is the group leader of Umucyo , which means "light" in English. 

The group members have different types of businesses and they work hard to grown their business. 

Mwamini owns a boutique and has been in the business for five years. She wants to buy more soap and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and salt.

loans.name: Santiaga

texts.es:
Santiaga, hace buen uso de los créditos por esa razón su negocio ha mejorado mucho, nuevamente solicita capital para invertirlo en la compra de maíz, aceite, leña, gas propano, carnes, verduras, arroz, condimentos, etc., para elaborar la venta de comida y tortillas.
Con el capital que anteriormente se le otorgo pudo adquirir los materiales necesarios para mantenerse trabajando y tener recursos económicos para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Santiaga makes good use of loans. For this reason, her business is greatly improving. She is requesting a new loan to invest in buying corn, cooking oil, firewood, propane, meat, vegetables, rice, condiments, and other items so she can make and sell food and tortillas.

With the capital she was previously provided, she was able to get the necessary materials to keep working and have the economic resources that meet her needs.

loans.use: to buy corn, cooking oil, firewood, propane, meat, vegetables, rice, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: Silvia Lupe

texts.es:
Silvia es una mujer de 34 años de edad soltera y madre de dos hijos.
Su vida la ocupa en arte de tejer; a máquina y a mano prendas como; compas, bufandas, guantes, abrigos de niño, etc., la demanda en su mercado es grande y ella tiene la necesidad de comprar lana de diferentes variedades como; la paceña, cruceña y también necesita comprar una máquina de doble tarjeta para tejer. Ella desea incrementar la producción de buzos y bayetas de lana debido a la competencia del mercado para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus 2 hijos. Silvia sueña tener una tienda propia, por el momento vende ambulantemente en las ferias y los mercados.
Es por esos motivos que Silvia solicita un préstamo para la compra de lana y una máquina de tejer.
texts.en:
Silvia is a 34-year-old single mother of two children. She makes a living making wool textiles and clothing. Silvia uses a mechanical loom at times, but also weaves by hand to make such items such as sweaters, scarves, gloves, children's coats, and other wool textiles. 

Demand for wool products is high and Silvia needs to purchase different types of wool, such as paceña and cruceña [wool from La Paz and Santa Cruz]. She also needs to purchase a two-card mechanical loom, so she's applying for a loan. 

Silvia wants to boost her production of wool clothing and textiles as she faces competition. She also hopes to improve her children's quality of life. Silvia would like to set up her own shop, but for now she sells her textiles in local markets.

loans.use: to purchase wool and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  coal.

loans.name: Nyanyo Kpakpa Group

texts.en:
Group member Sarah belongs to this group called Nyanyo Kpakpa (good friend). They are people who are hard working and are into second hand clothing, dresses (shirt and skirt), general goods, kenkey (cooked corn paste) and fish. 

Sarah is 35-years-old and lives with her husband and two children. Sarah sells different types of second hand clothing and ready-made clothing (shirts and skirts). She is taking her time with the business which is going well thanks to the determination she puts in each day. Sarah wants to continue working in order to carry on supporting her family in this way. Sarah is asking for this loan in order to buy different types of second hand clothing and ready-made (shirts and skirts) for her business. Sarah is very grateful for the loan offered and is committed to making the repayments as do other members of this group.

loans.use: to buy different types of second hand clothing and ready-made (shirts and skirts) for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy red oil, rice, and cassava.

loans.name: Nuuruyatu

texts.en:
Nuuruyatu has always had a talent for cooking. She grew up watching her parents, entrepreneurs themselves, in Ghana cook for their clients. Following in their footsteps, Nuuruyatu moved to the United States five years ago to start her own enterprise. 

With only $50, Nurruyatu began making Kenkey, a fermented cornmeal dish popular in parts of West Africa, out of her own kitchen.  She turned to her family and friends to test out the flavors. Once perfected, she moved operations to a commercially licensed kitchen. Her business, Kadosh Foods Enterprise, makes Kenkey, Shito (a hot black pepper sauce found in Ghana), fried fish, and shrimp. 

Unfortunately, rent for the incubator space was expensive. So, the next year, Nurruyatu moved into her own space, allowing her to produce and ship/cater her food to other restaurants, markets, or events.  After investing her money into the new space, she’s now ready to improve the quality of her food products. With this loan, Nuuruyatu will be able to improve the packaging of her products, increasing the quality and appeal. 

Help this self-made female entrepreneur grow her business!

loans.use: To purchase a vacuum sealer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cream, soap, and tissue.

loans.name: Crower

texts.es:
Crower es un hombre trabajador, tiene 26 años de edad, vive en Ica junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos.
Su familia es su mayor motivación para salir adelante, es por ellos que trabaja incansablemente para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Desde hace varios años trabaja como Obrero de Campo en los fundos de la zona donde vive, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, luchadora y con muchos deseos de superación.
Crower está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá remodelar su vivienda como pintarrajear las paredes y mejorar el sistema de seguridad de su domicilio, para que de esta manera su familia pueda vivir en un ambiente más seguro y con mayores comodidades, de esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida y seguirá esforzándose para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Crower is a hard-working man, 26 years old, who lives in Ica with his wife and their 2 children. His family provides his major motivation to get ahead. It is for them that he works tirelessly in order to offer them a better future.

For various years now, Crower has worked in the countryside on the large farms of the zone where he lives.  Things are going well because he is a very responsible and competitive person with strong desires to advance.

Crower is grateful to Kiva lenders because with the help they have offered, he has been able to remodel his home, repainting the walls and making his house more secure. He did this so his family could live in a safer environment with greater comfort. In this manner, Crower is improving his quality of life and will continue striving to advance his children.

loans.use: make home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  milk and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pigs and start a business selling livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine, an iron, and fabric.

loans.name: M. Ghali

texts.en: M. Ghali remembers not being able to feed his family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, M. Ghali, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2,000/hectare this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, M. Ghali is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In five years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, expressed M. Ghali.  With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a website for the business

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel has been a proud and dedicated business owner for 12 years. He knows good landscaping and is proud of the service he provides to his clients. 

"I built this business all on my own – little by little, one day at a time,” explains Angel.

Angel has grown his business from just one client to over 200. He has hired two employees to help him with the many lawns currently in his care.  However, Angel needs additional machinery to be able to provide faster service and continue to grow the business. Angel, originally from Nicaragua, has had trouble accessing the money he needs to purchase this machinery due to a short credit history. With this loan, he will purchase the equipment he needs and build his credit so that he has access to financing in the future.

Help this dedicated entrepreneur build his business!

loans.use: To purchase upgraded landscaping equipment

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John’s background in the military taught him many skills – organization, planning and teamwork. His former role as an automated logistical specialist taught him procedures for shipping, receiving, storing and issuing stock. After receiving his business degree, John turned to these skills to start his own business. 

In order to start his business, John needed trucks. He quickly leased two trucks and went to work with a former comrade shipping materials across the mid-Atlantic. Shortly, John was earning income from his business.

“I was so proud to finally sign my lot lease and pay off my two trucks, which gave me a lot of income to invest in the business.”  

With this income, John was able to hire an additional employee and focus on the organizational aspect of the business.  Soon, John noticed that there was a lag in income when clients weren’t able to pay on time. Currently, John needs to upgrade his tires, but does not have the money he needs to invest back into this business. 

Lend to John so that he can buy new tires and continue to provide employment to military veterans!

loans.use: To purchase new tires

loans.name: Victorina

texts.es:
Victorina, sigue invirtiendo en su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, así como también en la tienda, por lo que opta por un nuevo préstamo con el que comprara bebidas, granos básicos, golosinas, pan, huevos, aceite, tomates, cebollas, repollo, aguacates, sandias, melones, naranjas, etc., con lo que espera mantener a sus clientes muy satisfechos.
Con ayuda del financiamiento anterior ha mantenido su negocio funcionando, teniendo ganancias que son de utilidad para  cubrir los gastos de su hogar y mantener su puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas. Actualmente ha realizado la apertura de una tienda de productos básicos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Victorina continues investing in her fruit and vegetable sales business as well as in the store, so she is opting for a new loan. With it, she will purchase beverages, basic grains, snacks, bread, eggs, oil, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, avocados, watermelons, melons, oranges, and similar items, with which she hopes to keep her customers very satisfied.

With the help of the previous loan, she has kept her business running, having earnings that are useful for covering her household expenses and making her payments on time.  Currently, she has opened a basic household products store.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, basic grains, snacks, bread, eggs, oil, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, avocados, watermelons, melons, oranges, and similar items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various clothing and agricultural products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine, sewing machine and fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, embroidery machine and generator.

loans.name: Khamal

texts.en:
Khamal remembers not being able to feed his family during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now Khamal, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Khamal is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. 

“In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community,” expressed  Khamal. With this loan, Khamal is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more goods such as soft drinks, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes and hair products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mobile phones, accessories and a generator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine, fabric, and sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, embroidery machine, and table.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a table, sewing machine and embroidery machine.

loans.name: Nehemias Omar

texts.es:
Nehemías, está acompañado, vive al pendiente de las necesidades que surgen en su hogar, vive con su compañera de vida, actualmente no tienen hijos; no cuenta con más ingresos que los que genera al cultivar granos básicos y de la crianza de cerdos, estas actividades económicas las realiza desde hace 12 años en un horario de siete de la mañana a tres de la tarde, su negocio nace por la necesidad de tener ingresos para subsistir.
Comprará 6 qq de abono a $27.00 c/u, insecticidas, fertilizantes y herbicidas, así dará a su cultivo un mejor trato para lograr una mayor productividad, espera tener ganancias con las que pueda cancelar la deuda y mejorar las circunstancias familiares.
Su visión es mantenerse trabajando para seguir teniendo una alimentación, vestuario y salud  adecuada para él y su compañera de vida.
texts.en: Nehemías has a partner, and lives attentive to the needs that rise in his home. He lives with his life partner and doesn´t have children currently. He doesn´t have any other income besides what he makes growing grains and raising pigs. He´s done this work for 12 years, from seven in the morning to three in the afternoon. He started this business out of the need to have an income to live. He will buy 6 qq of fertilizer at $27.00 each, insecticides and herbicides. This will help his crops produce more. He hopes to have earnings that he can use to pay his debt and to improve his family´s circumstances. His vision is to keep working to continue to have food, clothes and good health for him and his life partner.

loans.use: to buy 6 qq of fertilizer at $27.00 each, insecticides and herbicides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more goods such as hair accessories, earrings, lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en: Domingas is taking a loan of 600 USD to improve her business. She is married. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy inventory for her store such as cigarettes, sugar, coffee, milk, noodles, and slippers. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of 200 USD. Domingas is a hard working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, sugar, coffee, milk, noodles, and slippers

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, three of whom go to school. She also has additional family members. She operates a retail shop at the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from farming. She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy cooking oil, sugar, rice, soap, and beans. Her major challenges include seasonality and electricity. Her goal and aspiration is to increase her capital base and also diversify her business. She lives in her own house. The family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, sugar, beans, rice, and soap

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel, es soltera y madre de dos hijas de 17 y 19 años de edad; con el firme propósito de tener ingresos con los que pueda cubrir necesidades básicas de su hogar, ella se dedica a vender ropa de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, este negocio lo aprendió en su familia, por el momento no presenta dificultades para realizarlo.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar calcetas, camisas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, ropa interior, entre otras prendas que sean necesarias para complacer los gustos de sus clientes, espera aumentar el número de clientes, tener mayores ventas e ingresos para estabilizarse económicamente.
Su aspiración es trabajar mucho para lograr reunir el dinero para cancelar su casa y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Isabel is a single mother of two daughters, ages 17 and 19. With the firm objective of having income to cover basic household necessities, she makes a living selling clothing from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon. She learned this business from her family, and she currently doesn't have any problems running it.

She will use the loan to buy socks, shirts, skirts, pants, dresses, underwear, and other clothing that she needs to meet her customers' preferences. She hopes to increase her number of customers, sell more, and have more income to be economically stable.

Her goal is to work a lot to return the money so she can pay off her home and improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy socks, shirts, skirts, pants, dresses, underwear, and other clothing.

loans.name: Chojña Pampita Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHOJÑA PAMPITA II” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gregoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, venta de queso, venta de ganado vacuno y porcino.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gregoria es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de compra y venta de ganado; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su pareja que trabajaba en este negocio muchos años atrás, es por ello que decidieron continuar con el mismo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para alimento en tiempo de sequía (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad, posteriormente lo comercializará en las ferias aledañas a su domicilio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el seguro de vida que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "CHOJÑA PAMPITA II" group will start its second cycle of Pro Mujer. As part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana, it is composed of ten members and is directed by a board in which Mrs. Gregoria is the president. There are several businesses that the members of the group move forward including the sale of milk, cheese, livestock and pigs.  The loan they´re requesting will help microentrepreneurs where Mrs. Gregoria is a member. She indicated that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago because of an invitation during a big promotion of the institution.

Currently she has a business buying and selling livestock. She learned this business from her husband who worked in this business many years back. It´s because of him that they decided to continue doing the same. 

The loan she´s requesting will be used for food during times of drought (purchase of livestock) that she will get from the best vendors in her community. Afterward she´ll sell them in the markets around her house. This kind of work allows her to generate income to support her family, as she lives with her partner and has four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded saying that she likes the security that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Ana Lorenza

texts.es:
Ana de 38 años de edad, es una mujer que es comerciante.  Ella estudio  hasta 9º grado en la escuela de su cantón actualmente está casada con su esposo quien se dedica a la agricultura, actualmente tiene un hijo el cual está estudiando en la universidad sacando sus estudios superiores. 

Ana tiene 6 años de tener una tienda en su casa, esta idea surgió desde el momento en que junto a su esposo analizaron una pequeña dificultad que había en su comunidad,  la gente tenía que ir a una distancia de 2 kilómetros a comprar sus productos, entonces fue así cuando empezó a comprar productos para vender y  así fue creciendo  su negocio, además de esta actividad ella tiene unas  vacas lecheras las cuales le sirven mucho, ya que con la leche hace cuajada, queso, crema para vender.

Ana invertirá su crédito en la compra de dos vacas más valoradas en $900 c/u esto hace una cantidad de $1800 en las dos vacas, pero ella tiene unos pequeños ahorros los cuales serán invertidos en esta actividad, estas vacas mejoraran y aumentaran la productividad de leche esto hace que pueda vender más.

Ella tiene planeado comprar a muy corto plazo un procesador de crema,  para tener una mejor calidad de crema y abrir una venta de lácteos en el centro de su pueblo,  ya que no hay ninguno y hay una gran población de personas y sabe que con la ayuda de su crédito de a poco lo puede ir  logrando así pagara su crédito y también tendrá mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Ana, 38, is a woman who is a merchant.  She got a 9th grade education in her rural community.  She is now married, and she and her husband work in agriculture.  They have a son who is getting a college degree at a university.  

For 6 years, Ana has had a store in her house.  This idea came up when she and her husband both realized that in their community people were having to go a distance of 2 kilometers to buy their products.  So it was then that she started buying products to sell, and her business was growing.  In addition to this business, she has 2 dairy cows that are very useful to her, because with their milk she makes milk curd, cheese and cream to sell.

Ana will invest this loan in the purchase of 2 more cows, valued at $900 each.  Thus, she will invest a total sum of $1,800 in the two cows.  She will also use a small amount of her personal savings for this investment.  These cows will improve and expand her milk production so that she will be able to increase her sales.

In the short run, Ana plans to buy a cream processor to improve the quality of her cream, and she will also open up a dairy shop in the center of her town, because there is no such shop, and there is a large population of people.  She knows that with the help of this loan, she will gradually achieve her goals.  This way, she will pay of her loan and also have greater profits.

loans.use: to buy 2 dairy cows

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Son, 61 years old, lives in a remote area of Batheay District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has five children, and four of them are married. To making a living, she manages and operates a small rice farm on land which located very close to her house. Son has been a farmer for nearly 40 years, and she can earn approximately $4 USD per day.

Son is living in a small house, so it is not convenient, as she has lots of members in her family. Son wants to extend her house by constructing one more room in her house, yet she doesn't have enough money. Son is requesting a loan from Kiva now to pay for the room construction fee. She would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to pay for the room construction fee

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés, se encuentra sin los recursos económicos que le permitan comprar de inmediato los materiales necesarios para seguir cultivando maíz, por lo que opta por un nuevo préstamo con el cual comprara abono, semilla, fertilizantes, plaguicidas y pagara mozos para preparar el terreno y eliminar la maleza que pueda evitar que su cultivo se desarrolle de la mejor manera.
Con la ayuda del crédito anterior costeo los gastos de la recolección de la cosecha, cubrió las necesidades de su familia y de los clientes, su familia tiene una mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
Andrés lacks the financial resources that would allow him to purchase immediately the materials he needs to keep growing corn. He has therefore applied for a new loan and will use part of the loan funds to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. He will use the rest of the loan funds to pay laborers to prepare the soil and remove weeds that would otherwise interfere with a successful crop. 

Andrés's last loan covered the cost of the harvest and met the needs of his family and his customers. Andrés's family now has a better diet and new clothes, and their health has improved.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with five children, and all of them go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells charcoal from home. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works two days a week. She has been in this business for seven years. She gets additional income from rental houses.

She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major challenges include transportation  and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a van for delivering her merchandise. She has her own house, and the family has no access to electricity but has piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is 38-year-old married woman. She lives in the small village of Sagarejo district with her husband, two children and pensioner father-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two cows and two calves. Rusudan milks the cows every day and produces cheese to sell locally. She has regular clients. The family also owns a small vineyard, and they produce wine and sell it seasonally. 

Rusudan has a commercial space where she plans to make a market. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 4,000 Gel (Georgia lari) to open a market. She will purchase all the needed stock for opening the market, and she will run it after opening. This will increase the family income, and with increased income, she will improve the living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to open a market

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 32 years old, married and has two children. As a way of generating income, she has engaged in a variety store business within her community in Coron Palawan, Philippines for five years now. Hilda's family is one of the affected by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what they lost. She, together with her husband, works hard to provide for the everyday needs of their family.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Hilda earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Hilda wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. She is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Hilda hopes that her business will last longer and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Nilda Helen

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Nilda Helen has engaged in variety store business within her community for almost 5 years now. She is 34 years of age and blessed with three children. Nilda Helen's family is one of the affected by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what they lost. Her husband, Generoso, helps her in their business and they work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Nilda Helen wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Nilda Helen aspires to save enough money so they can avail their dream house and lot. She also dreams to send all her children to college. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own fish stall for 12 years and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having a better income. 

Mary Jane's family is one of those affected by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regain what they lost.

To further improve sales, Mary Jane would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional fish to sell. With 50,000 PHP, she could purchase more quantities and varieties of fish and other supplies which are needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Mary Jane hopes to grow her business and dreams for her children to finish schooling. She is an active community partner of C.C.T. She meets with her fellowship* group every Wednesday.

*All C.C.T. community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional fish and supplies and pay the operational expenses of her business.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Máxima es una mujer de 23 años, soltera y madre de 1 bebé de 8 meses de edad.
Ella trabaja y estudia, el trabajo lo comparte con su novio el padre de su bebé, juntos se encargan de su negocio que se trata de la venta de ropa y también comparten el cuidado de su bebé que aún es muy pequeñito. Máxima tiene sueños y desea ser una excelente profesional, ella estudia contabilidad y tiene muchas ganas de terminar sus estudios para ejercer su profesión.
Máxima tiene algunas dificultades en sus estudios y esto se debe al pago de sus cuotas mensuales, con el bebé recién llegado sus gastos aumentaron de sobremanera y esto le dificulta el pago de sus mensualidades, ella no quiere abandonar o dejar de lado los estudios contables pero en caso de fallar en los pagos se verá obligada a dejarlo por un tiempo.
Es por ese motivo que máxima solicita un préstamo para el pago de sus estudios y así darle un futuro a su bebé.
texts.en:
Máxima is a 23-year-old woman who is a single mother of an 8-month old baby.  She works and studies, sharing the work with her partner, who is the father of her baby. They manage her clothing sales business together, and they also share in the care of their baby, who is still very little. 

Máxima has dreams, and she wants to be an excellent professional.  She is studying accounting, and she has a great desire to complete her studies in order to practice her profession.

Máxima has some difficulties with her studies, owing to her monthly payments.  They have been difficult for her to make, as with the new baby, her expenses increased enormously. She doesn’t want to abandon or set aside her accounting studies, but if she cannot make the payments she will have to put them off for a while. 

This is the reason that Máxima is seeking a loan: to pay for her studies, and in this way, give her baby a future.

loans.use: to pay for her studies, and in this way, give her baby a future.

loans.name: Marylyn

texts.en:
Marylyn, 27 years of age, married and the mother of two children, lives happily in a rural community with her family. She owns and manages a small retail store, while her husband works on their farm. 

Marylyn aims to improve her store and make it profitable in order to generate more income to better support her family. She wants to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell, and so has requested a loan of PHP 15,000.00 to purchase additional stocks of laundry soaps, snack foods, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, eggs and soft drinks to sell. 

Through hard work and strong determination, Marylyn believes that someday she will make her business more viable and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of laundry soaps, snack foods, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, eggs and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as sport shoes and slippers.

She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $300. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy sport shoes and slippers

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
Debbie is 50 years old and married with four children.

Debbie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Debbie has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Debbie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Edencita

texts.en:
Edencita is 41 years old and married with two children.

Edencita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. Edencita has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Edencita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more snack foods, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 34 years old, widowed and has children. As a way of generating income, he has engaged in a variety store business within his community in Coron Palawan, Philippines, for more than 10 years now. Jonathan’s family is one of the ones affected by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. He has restarted his business and is committed to regain what they lost. He works hard to provide for the everyday needs of his family.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Jonathan wants to make his business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, he would like to avail a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to buy additional grocery items that are needed. He is hoping that he will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Jonathan hopes that his business will become bigger and better. He also desires to help his parents, who are supporting him and are taking good care of his children. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week, and this is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Jose Victorino

texts.es:
José, es casado, vive con su esposa de 48 años de edad y su hija de 11 años de edad; es el pilar principal de su familia, debe proveer de lo que en su hogar se necesite; como una manera de generar ingresos trabaja en el cultivo de granos básicos, elaboración de hamacas, matates, etc., lo relacionado con la agricultura lo aprendió de su padre, mientras que su esposa le enseño a trabajar en la jarcia, no tiene un horario establecido.
Está solicitando capital para comprar insecticidas, fertilizantes, plaguicidas, abono y semilla, para preparar el terreno y proteger la milpa de plagas, espera tener buenos resultados con la inversión y cumplir con el pago de su deuda. Foto fue tomada mientras elaboraba una hamaca.
Su sueño es ofrecer una mejor alimentación, educación, vestuario y salud a su familia.
texts.en:
José is married and lives with his wife who is 48 years old and his 11 year old daughter. He is the pillar of the family. He has to provide what is needed in his household. One way he generates income is working at growing basic grains. He also makes hammocks, canvas bags, etc. He learned his agriculture from his father, while his wife taught him rope work. He has no fixed schedule.

He is requesting capital to buy insecticide, fertilizer, pesticide, manure and seeds to prepare the earth and protect his corn from infestation. He hopes for good results from the investment so he can fulfill his payments on his loan. The photo was taken while he was making a hammock. His dream is to provide better food, education, clothing and health for his family.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizer, pesticides, manure and seeds.

loans.name: Ma. Nida

texts.en:
Ma. Nida is a widowed woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Nida is 47 years old and has four children who are in school.

Ma. Nida has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Ma. Nida requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Ma. Nida has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ma. Nida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim, is 29 years old and is a married man. He lives in the remote village of Prey Veng Province. Kim and his spouse help each other in farming activities in order to put the family in better living conditions. He has been engaged in this field for five years, and his average income is USD 7 per day. 

At the moment, Kim would like to order a solar home system to install at his home. This will allow his family members to gain access to clean energy, helping them with light at night. They also can use radio or TV for their entertainment. 

Due to a shortage of funds, Kim has requested a loan from Kiva to buy a solar home system. He is very happy and thankful, because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided him a special interest rate that is different than the general loan rate. Kim awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system

loans.name: Roland

texts.en:
Roland is 37-years-old, married, and has two children. As a way of generating income, he has engaged in a variety store business within his community in Coron Palawan, Philippines for three years now. He, together with his wife, works hard to provide for the everyday needs of their family. Roland's family is one of the affected by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. He has restarted his business and is committed to regain what they lost.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Roland wants to make his business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, he would like to request a loan amounting to 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. He is hoping that he will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Roland hopes to expand and open another branch for his business so that he could give the best for the education of his children. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy natural products and display tables.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is 35 years old, married and his family lives at Solana. He gets income through his farming business. He plants and harvests rice to sell with his spouse who is his partner in the business. He has been in his business for over 10 years now and he still wants to improve his farming practices. 

He is now asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. With the help of this loan he will improve the growth of crops, leading to more fruitful harvests someday. He will invest additional revenue for his children’s education so they will earn degrees in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for farming

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Coron Palawan, Philippines. She is 57 years old and has seven children. She and Isabelo, her husband, manage a fruit and vegetable stand business, and their income from the business helps with their everyday needs and expenditures. Marlene's family is one of the many affected by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what they lost.

Marlene buys fresh vegetables like eggplant, bitter gourd, ginger, and many others. She also profits from seasonal, native fruits that she sells, such as bananas, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She also sells squash, citrus fruits and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day. 

Marlene is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan to purchase more varieties of fruit and vegetable to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve her family's general living conditions.

Aside from becoming successful in business and future plans, Marlene also hopes to make life easy for her children and grandchildren and give them a better and quality education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fruits and vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Luzvisminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Luzvisminda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Luzvisminda is borrowing 29,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soft-drinks, bread, spices and school supplies for her general store business.

Luzvisminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft-drinks, bread, spices and school supplies.

loans.name: Purification

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Purification works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Purification is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Purification has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 49 years old and married with ten children; four of her children are in school.

Sofia works hard to provide for her family. She works in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Sofia has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business  for twenty years and also earns an income a from general store.

Sofia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rollen

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Rollen works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Rollen is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Rollen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 34 years old and married. She was blessed with two children and they are currently residing in a rural community. 

She engages in cooking and selling meals and snacks within the school campus while her husband cultivates their farm. She and her husband aim to improve their status of living in order to give their children a better life. In this regard, Maribel wants to strengthen her business in order to earn a higher income. 

She planned to prepare more kinds of recipes to sell but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like to obtain a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy rice, pork, chicken, beef, vegetables, cooking oil, and other ingredients she needs to cook and sell food. 

Through this financial assistance, she believes that someday she will make more improvements in her business as well as their status of living.

loans.use: to buy rice, pork, chicken, beef, vegetables, cooking oil, and other ingredients she needs to cook.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, continua en su negocio de venta de ropa, frutas y verduras, con ayuda del crédito anterior logro atraer nuevos clientes y también puede generar empleo a su hijo en su negocio. Cuenta con mejores circunstancias familiares.
Con el nuevo crédito que está solicitando comprará ropa, faldas, camisas, vestidos, ropa interior para ambos sexos, calcetines, entre otro tipo de prendas con las que pueda satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes y seguir teniendo ingresos económicos para salir adelante.
texts.en:
María continues in her business, selling clothing, fruit, and vegetables. With the help of the previous loan, she was able to attract new customers and she was also able to create employment for her son in her business.  Her family’s circumstances are better. 

With the new loan that she is requesting, she will purchase clothing such as skirts, shirts, dresses, underwear for both sexes, socks, and other types of garments.  With them, she can satisfy the tastes of her customers, and continue having income in order to move forward.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as skirts, shirts, dresses, underwear for both sexes, socks, and other types of garments.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 32 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising cows in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional cow to raise.

Helen has been raising cows for 3 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional cow to raise.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 59 years old, married and has six children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Teresita has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. In the future, Teresita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jubelyn

texts.en:
Jubelyn is 37 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries. Jubelyn has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income selling pre-paid mobile phone credits.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and shampoo for her store.

loans.name: Crecencio

texts.en: Crecencio, 48, is from the Philippine village of Rizal, where the main product is rice. He is a happy person, and tends to his farm every morning. To gain additional income and meet his family's needs, he asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seed. In the future, Crecencio hopes that his business will expand so that he can improve his family's quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed for his rice farm.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en: Lucille is 33 years old and married with four children. With all four children in school, Lucille works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soft drinks, etc. Lucille has been in this business for 20 years. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, eggs, milk, soft drinks, and other items for her store.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 40 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Aida has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from selling fruits. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new equipment for her cleaning business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a food cart

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en:
Stephanie knows that women like to be original. “Women are not fond of going to events or being out in public and seeing many other women with the same exact clothing,” she explains. Stephanie also knows that people do not like having to pay a lot to get that exclusivity. She started her business, Zodiacfly, in order to fill this need. 

Zodiacfly Apparel is a women’s fashion company that brings exclusive affordable pieces to women of all ages.  Stephanie will preserve the exclusivity by not ordering the same product twice. However, in order to get her business off the ground, Stephanie needs capital to purchase inventory for her business. 

Help this passionate entrepreneur fulfill her vision!

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her clothing store

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto worked in the electronics industry for many years before he decided he wanted to be his own boss. 

“I worked for others and saw what they could accomplish. I knew I could do better,” explained Alberto. 

For two years, Alberto has owned C.S.T. Electrical Contractors, installing electronics for commercial and residential properties.  As business has continued to grow, Alberto finds himself too busy to fulfill the demand. With this loan, he hopes to hire an additional electrician and fulfill new contracts. 

Help Alberto grow his business!

loans.use: To hire an additional electrician

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a hardworking mother who has been engaged in cooking and selling snack foods within the school campus, and in her community. She is 54 years old and and has five children. Three of them are still attending school. 

Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, Adelina needs to earn a higher income in order to help her husband in meeting the costs of their family. She wants to cook and sell more types of snack, but she has limited capital. 

She has therefore asked for a loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos from KIVA lenders, through their partner ASKI, to buy vegetables, cooking oil, bananas, frozen foods, flour, sugar and other ingredients she needs to cook and sell her snacks. Having this financial assistance will help Adelina to improve her business and generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, cooking oil, bananas, frozen foods, flour, sugar and other ingredients

loans.name: Vevian

texts.en:
Vevian is 30 years old, and married with two children.

She earns a living through a bakery business in the Philippines. Vevian is borrowing 10,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like milk, sugar, yeast, flour, etc.

Vevian has been in the bakery business for one year, and also earns additional income from running a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like milk, sugar, yeast, flour, etc

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly is 50 years old and has six children. She is married, and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of farming flowers in the Philippines. Melly has asked for a 14,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional types of flowers, fertilizers, flower bags, etc.

Melly has been farming flowers for eight years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.
