In the future, Melly would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional types of flowers, fertilizers, flower bags, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finance marketing costs, website development and hiring costs for a new assistant

loans.name: Cassandra

texts.en:
Ever since she was a child, Cassandra was transfixed by the creativity and passion shown by exhibitors at local gem fairs. Consumed by this lifelong love affair with jewelry and design, she decided to pursue a degree in jewelry and metalworking first at Mesa Community College in 2009 and then later from the San Diego State School of Art and Design. 

Cassandra credits her time spent in school as integral in allowing her to find her own voice and style in jewelry design. She also took classes in entrepreneurship and portfolio creation, which helped her channel her distinctive point of view into her handmade jewelry. 

The feeling one gets from her work is exemplified by the name of her business: Lux Amor Pax, which means “light, love, peace” in Latin.

“Every piece I make is created with the intention of bringing light, love and peace to the wearer and everyone the wearer comes in contact with,” Cassandra said.

Every time she sees a stranger walking down the street wearing one of her pieces, Cassandra is filled with joy and satisfaction, and reaffirmed in her mission to provide quality jewelry to her customers.

Cassandra will use her Kiva loan to buy tools and equipment, which will allow her to diversify the pieces she is able to offer to customers. 

Check out her pieces at: http://luxamorpax.weebly.com

loans.use: o buy tools and equipment to make jewelry

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es:
José, logro tener una buena cosecha de maíz, no tuvo problemas de plagas pues preparó de manera correcta el terreno con insumos agrícolas que compro con ayuda del crédito anterior.
Nuevamente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes, plaguicidas, insecticidas, abono y semilla, de esta manara seguirá progresando en su negocio y mejorando el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
José, succeeded in having a good corn harvest and had no problems with pests as he prepared the land correctly correctly with agricultural supplies that he bought with the help of his previous loan.

He is again requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides, manure and seeds, and will in this way continue progressing in his business and improving his family's well-being.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides, manure and seeds.

loans.name: Seilala

texts.en: Seilala, 41 years old, is a married woman with 4 children. For the past 2 years, she has run a small business selling pancakes in her community. Seilala has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, etc. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. Seilala will use her earnings to support her family and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Levaula

texts.en: Levaula, 22 years old, is a single woman with 1 child. For the past 2 years, she has run a small business selling pork buns in her community. Levaula has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, etc. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. Levaula hopes to use her earnings to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra, 33 years old, is a dedicated housewife and the mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, and it is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, oranges, etc in his shop. He is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Azra, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. Her husband wants to use the profits to grow his business in the future. Azra is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for her husband's business

loans.name: Faafeu

texts.en: Faafeu is 65 years old and a married woman with seven children. She runs a small business selling cabbages, cucumbers, tomatoes etc in her community and has been doing this for more than four years. Faafeu has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, etc. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faafeu will extend her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a weed sprayer, and bush knivies

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
LUCIA. Vive en Ricaurte desde hace más de 15 años, desde muy niña empezó a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres económicamente. Ella realizaba trabajos domésticos puertas a dentro en Guayaquil, Quito y ciudades en donde podía encontrar la oportunidad de trabajar.
LUCIA vive con 4 de sus 8 hijos. Quienes aprovechan todo el sacrificio de su madre asistiendo a clases. 2 de sus hijos se encuentran en Colombia prestando el servicio militar. Las 2 niñas estudian y trabajan en Guayaquil. No tiene compromiso con alguna pareja y es muy feliz viendo crecer a sus hijos.
En una temporada, vendía ropa y mucha gente le llevo su mercadería fiada y no le pago.
Actualmente tiene una pequeña actividad de venta de comida en las afueras de un colegio. Ella prepara una variedad de sabores en su casa y las comercializa en horas de receso escolar.
Con el presente crédito LUCIA comprara una cocina más grande- 8 sillas- 2 mesas – y 2 parasoles. Para brindar comodidad a sus comensales.
LUCIA no tiene casa propia y paga una renta. Ella espera muy pronto poder comprar su casa propia para que sus hijos tengan un espacio cómodo en su hogar.
esta segura de crecer en su negocio y poder pagar las cuotas de crédito
texts.en:
Lucia has lived in Ricaurte for more than 15 years.  When she was a young girl, she started working to help her parents financially.  She did domestic work in Guayaquil, Quito, and cities where she could find work.  

Lucia lives with four of her eight children, who appreciate all of her sacrifice by attending classes.  Two of her children are in Colombia serving in the military.  Her two daughters study and work in Guayaquil.  She does not have a partner and she is very happy to see her children grow up.  

She used to sell clothing, and many people would take the merchandise on credit and not pay.  She currently has a small business selling food outside of a high school.  She prepares a variety of items in her home and sells them during school breaks.  

Lucia will use this loan to purchase a larger stove, eight seats, two tables, and two umbrellas to improve the comfort of her diners.  

Lucia does not own her own home and pays rent.  She hopes that she will be able to purchase a home soon so that her children have comfortable space in her home.  She is sure that her business will grow and she will be able to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase a larger stove, 8 seats, 2 tables, and 2 umbrellas.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is 27 years old and married. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband is a trained gardener by profession. He provides services in gardening to different areas. He trembles the plants, waters them and decorates them in good looking shapes by using different gardening tools such as a trowel, a watering can, a transplanting spade, a fork, and an edger. He is very hardworking and expert in the gardening field. People in society call him for gardening services at their houses. He wants to buy some new tools such as a trowel, a watering can, a transplanting spade, a fork, an edger etc for gardening work. He also wants to buy some new plants for gardening work. Therefore, Maria has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband so that he is able to buy gardening tools and more plants. This will help him to continue his services well. Maria is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more plants for her husband's gardening business

loans.name: Tuugaita

texts.en: Tuugaita is 40 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling donuts, meat pies, german buns, etc in her community and has been doing this for three years. Tuugaita has requested a loan to buy a bag of sugar, a bag of flour, boxes of chicken, cooking oil, tongs, frying pans etc. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tuugaita will pay for her children's education and save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, cooking oil, chicken, tongs and frying pans

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra, requiere de un nuevo préstamo para comprar cerdos, pollos de engorde, maíz, maicillo, concentrado, condimentos, verduras, maíz, etc., fortalecerá su negocio y tendrá el alimento suficiente para sus animales de corral, con lo que espera mejorar sus ventas y seguir apoyando a su familia.
Con el financiamiento anterior se ha mantenido trabajando en la venta de tamales, comida y crianza de animales de corral; ha obteniendo los recursos económicos para brindar mejor estilo de vida a su familia y mantener su puntualidad en los pagos de la deuda.
texts.en:
Sandra is requesting a new loan to purchase pigs, chickens to fatten, corn, sorghum, animal feed, condiments, and vegetables.  This will strengthen her business.  She will have enough feed for all the animals in her corral and she hopes to improve her sales and continue supporting her family.

With her previous loan, she was able to continue selling tamales, food, and raising animals.  She has earned enough to provide her family with a better way of life and make her loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, chickens, corn, sorghum, animal feed, condiments, and vegetables.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 42 years old and has three children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the fishing business in the Philippines. Cirila requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Cirila has been for in the business for 10 years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cirila would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is married with 10 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosita is 52 years old and two of her children are in school.

She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like shorts, shirts, pants, etc.

Rosita has been in this business for four years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like shorts, shirts, and pants

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is the age of 40; she is the mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband sells dairy products like milk, curd, and butter. He owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. He owns a milk shop in the market. He sells milk from his own shop daily. He has built up very good relations with his customers and that is the reason his number of clients has increased. To cope with demand he wants to increase his current business. He manages his household necessities from his earnings through his milk sale business. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income through his milk sale business. So, Shabana asked for a loan. In this way she can support her husband’s milk sale business.

Shabana is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To enhance her husband's milk sale business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, beans, coffee, oil, bread, sugar, rice, butter, cookies, drinks etc. for her business.

loans.name: Jimy Jesus

texts.es:
Jimy es un joven emprendedor, tiene 27 años de edad y vive en Imperial junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Tiene un hijo quien es su mayor motivación y por quien lucha día a día para poder brindarle un futuro mejor.
Hace dos años él y su familia llegaron a Perú ya que antes vivían en el extranjero pero por algunos inconvenientes tuvieron que retornar a su país. Actualmente trabaja como Obrero Fiscalizable y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y siempre ha luchado por su familia. Con mucho esfuerzo logró comprarse un terreno y su mayor sueño es tener su casa propia.
Jimy está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá cercar y pagar la limpieza del terreno que compró, así poco a poco seguirá esforzándose para ir construyendo su vivienda y puedan vivir una vida tranquila y con todas las comodidades que su familia merece.
texts.en:
Jimy is an enterprising young man. He is 27 years old and lives with his family in Imperial.

He is a person with a great desire to succeed. He has a son, who is his greatest motivation and for whom he strives day after day so that he can offer him a better future.

Two years ago he and his family came to Peru. Before this, they lived outside the country, but because of some problems they had to return to their country.

He currently works as an employee and it is going very well because he is a very responsible, hard-working person and has always striven for his family. With a great deal of effort he managed to buy a piece of land, and his greatest dream is to have his own home.

Jimy is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have provided him he will be able to enclose and pay for clearing the land he bought. This way he can little by little continue doing his best and gradually build his home and live a peaceful life, with all the comforts that his family deserves.

loans.use: To build an enclosure for his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soap to increase her business.

loans.name: Maria Neary

texts.en:
Maria Neary is 24 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, cream, coffee, etc.

Maria Neary has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Maria Neary aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, soap, shampoo, cream, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sardines and luncheon meat, etc.

loans.name: Aurita

texts.en: Aurita is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her motorcycle services business. She is married and runs her business in front of her house. Aurita makes a good income from her business. She wants to use this loan to buy glue and more tire stock and to pay the mechanic who works for her. Aurita lives in town near the main road, so many people come to her to fix their motorcycle. She opened her business in 2010 with her own working capital.

loans.use: To buy glue and  tires.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice, 38 years old, is married and has 5 children. For the past 3 years, she has run a small business selling ice-cakes in her community. Alice has requested a loan to buy a new freezer, plastic cups, sugar, Chinese lollies, etc. for her business and to make some changes to her house. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. Alice plans to use her earnings to make another profitable business much better than the one she runs right now and to help with her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, plastic cups, sugar, Chinese lollies, etc.

loans.name: Akesa

texts.en: Akesa is 35 years old and single with no children. She owns and operates a small store, selling items such as flour, sugar, salt, noodles, cooking oil, canned fish, drinks, snacks, etc. She has been doing this for one year. Akesa needs a loan to buy a bag of sugar, a bag of salt, a  bag of flour, boxes of noodles, cooking oil, etc. She hopes to use her profits to continue extending her business and to support her family. She became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of sugar, a bag of salt, a  bag of flour, boxes of noodles, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa, 28 years old, is married and has one child who is in school. Josefa works very hard to provide for her family. She has been in business for 3 years and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell. In the future, Josefa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers and cassava

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Abel Wilmer

texts.es:
Abel nació en Huancayo, sierra del Perú y proviene de una familia de padres separados. El emigro a la capital para poder estudiar y conseguir un mejor futuro para el y para su madre, quien se quedo en su ciudad natal. El vive solo en Lima, donde alquila un dormitorio el cual paga gracias al ingreso que le genera su trabajo de medio tiempo en un taller de mecánica.
El dinero no le alcanza para poder seguir costeando su dormitorio, alimentación y educación, por lo cual pronto tendrá que dejar sus estudios y regresar a Huancayo de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
El se encuentra apenas a un año de terminar su carrera técnica en electricidad automotriz y desea poder terminarla y trabajar en un taller para ganar dinero y traer a su madre a vivir con el en Lima.
Abel esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva por todo el apoyo que pueden brindarle y asu vez felicita su gran labor en favor de la educación a nivel mundial, educación que el considera fundamental para poder desarrollarse y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Abel was born in Huancayo, in the highlands of Peru. He comes from a family of separated parents, and he moved to the capital in order to study and achieve a better future for himself and his mother, who remained in her native city.  He lives alone in Lima, where he rents a room that he pays for with the income that he earns from his part-time job in a mechanics' shop.

He cannot afford to continue paying for his room, food, and education, which is why, without the support of the Kiva lenders, he will soon have to quit his studies and return to Huancayo.

He is only a year away from completing his technical courses in automotive electronics, and he wants to be able to finish, so that he can work in a repair shop and earn the money to bring his mother to live with him in Lima.

Abel is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for all of the support that they can give to him.  For his part, he expresses admiration for their great work in favor of education worldwide—education that he believes is fundamental in order to develop and triumph in life.

loans.use: to pay for his technical courses in automotive electronics.

loans.name: Glorie

texts.en:
Glorie is 32 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, soap, coffee, eggs, etc. to sell.

Glorie has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from selling fruits. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Roscena

texts.en:
Being a responsible house wife, Roscena has been engaged in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is 51 years old and blessed with two children. She aims to make her business profitable in order to gain a higher income to sustain the necessities of her family and to save for their future. 

To improve the business, Roscena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines needed for her hogs. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted in order to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Joshua has been engaged in a LPG retailing business in his community for years now. He is 35 years of age and married to Janice, who helps him with the business. They work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs.

What he basically does is buy Liquefied Petroleum Gas tanks from wholesalers, sell them per tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from a small to regular size tank. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue the operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan for assistance. He will utilize the loan to buy more stock of LPG tanks to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Joshua dreams that his business will continue to flourish. He also hopes to always be healthy and fit to work. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of LPG tanks to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Myden

texts.en:
Myden is 23-years-old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc.

Myden has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Myden would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Lelita

texts.en:
Lelita is 57-years-old and married with five children.

Lelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

Lelita has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lelita aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Faalua

texts.en: Faalua is a 31-year-old single woman with two children. She makes and sells ice cakes and donuts in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business.  Faalua needs a loan to buy a sack of sugar, plastic cups, corn flour, plastic paper, etc.  She plans to use her profits to support her family.  Faalua has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy plastic paper, oil, corn flour, a sack of sugar, plastic cups, etc.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en: Mareta is a 46-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation that grows beans,cucumbers, tomatoes, pumpkins, etc. to earn a living. Mareta has requested a loan to buy weed sprayer,chemicals, bush knives, etc. She has been a member of SPBD for 2010 years. Mareta will spend her profits to support her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed sprayer, etc.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 49-year-old lady and she is mother of five children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband has been running a small garment shop in the market. This shop is the only source of income for their family. The Muslim religious festival Eid ul Fitr is very near and also summer season is going on in Pakistan.  So, her husband wants to purchase a variety of seasonal and fancy clothing, such as shirts, pants, shawls, ladies ready to made dresses, and a variety of kids garments. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. So, Irshad requested a loan. This way she can support her husband’s garment sale business.

The loan will help her husband to offer a variety of garments to his clients and increase his net income as well.  Irshad dreams of increasing her husband’s business so that her children can have a better future. Irshad's family sends loads of prayers and thanks to all of the staff of Kiva and Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new variety of garments for her son's garment shop.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. Elvira is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed like a fishing net, ice box, etc. for her fishing business.

Elvira has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Elvira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like a fishing net, ice box, etc. for her fishing business

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 47-years-old and married with one child. He is a very responsible person, he makes sure that he can meet all the needs of his family. Edwin is a small farmer in the Rizal province of Isabela. He is asking for a loan amounting PHP 18,000 to buy farm supplies like fertilizer and seeds to grow.

In the future, Edwin hopes that he can expand his business so that he can meet the quality of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizer and seeds to grow.

loans.name: Saufoi

texts.en: Saufoi is a 59-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Saufoi needs a loan to buy oil, a sack of sugar, corn flour and yeast. She plans to use her profits to extend her business and to support her family as well. Saufoi has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy oil, a sack of sugar, corn flour, a frying pan, etc.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis es un joven emprendedor, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Santiago junto a su familia.
Actualmente estudia la carrera de Mecánica Automotriz porque le gusta la carrera y tiene muchos deseos de superación.
Desde hace un año trabaja como Obrero de Campo en un fundo cerca de la zona donde vive, le va muy bien porque es muy trabajador, responsable y porque quiere ayudar a su familia en algunos gastos del hogar.
Luis está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar materiales para poder seguir sus clases prácticas de la Universidad, ya que tiene que poner en práctica toda teoría que le enseñan, de esta manera podrá especializarse más para que en poco tiempo pueda convertirse en un excelente profesional y trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación podrá cumplir su mayor sueño: "Brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia".
texts.en:
Luis is an enterprising young man who is 20 years old and single. He lives in Santiago together with his family. 

Currently, he is studying for a degree in Automotive Mechanics because he likes this profession and he has a strong desire to improve his situation.

For one year he has been working as a farm laborer on a ranch near the area where he lives. It is going very well for him because he is very hard-working and responsible, and because he wants to help his family with some of the household expenses. 

Luis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support provided to him, he will be able to buy materials so he can continue his practical classes at the university. He has to put in practice every theory that they teach him. In this way he will be able to become more specialized, and within a short time he can become an outstanding professional, working with great effort and dedication to fulfill his greatest dream: "Providing his family with a better quality of life."

loans.use: to buy supplies for his university studies.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 59-years-old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nancy has a fishing business in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Nancy has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Elvira

texts.en:
Ma. Elvira is a 41-year-old resident of Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines and she is married to Sofronio. She manages their household while operating the business. She works hard for their children and to provide an income for their everyday needs.

Ma. Elvira maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan for assistance. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Ma. Elvira dreams to expand her business. She also desiresto save enough for their future through the help of CCT. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Aofilifilifaiesea

texts.en: Aofilifaiesea is a 40-year-old single woman with one child. She makes and sells pancakes and ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Aofilifaiesea needs a loan to buy yeast, flour, sugar, plastic bags, oil, a frying pan, etc. She plans to use her profits to support her family. Aofilifaiesea has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy corn flour, sugar, oil, a frying pan, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rose Marie is 51 years old and one of her children is in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rose Marie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her business.

Rose Marie has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Flavia Francisca

texts.es:
La voluntad y la perseverancia son valores que definen a doña Flavia, una señora humilde y trabajadora de 59 años de edad, que desde hace ocho años se dedica a la venta de zapatos de manera ambulante. Es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos, todos mayores e independientes. Cuando inició a vender logró obtener dinero para un puesto de venta en el mercado de su comunidad, pero cuando murió su esposo, hace cinco años, decidió venderlo. Gracias a la buena atención y los productos de calidad que ofrece ha logrado ganar buena clientela. 
Ella solicita el crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar calzado para niños y adultos. Flavia deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que desea cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, de manera que pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio, ofrecer más productos y lograr obtener un puesto de venta en el mercado. Trabaja con el objetivo de mejorar su condición de vida, quiere obtener el capital suficiente para poder descansar tranquila y segura.
texts.en:
Will and perseverance are qualities that define Flavia, a humble and hard-working 59 year old woman. For 8 years she has been selling footwear in the streets. She is a widow and she has 4 children all pf them adults and independent.. When she started to sell she managed to get the money for a stall in the local market. but when her husband passed away five years ago she decided to sell it. Thanks to the attention she gives to her customers and the quality of her product she has been able to gain a good clientele.

She is requesting a loan to increase the productivity of her capital. She needs to buy shoes for children and adults. Flavia has confidence in the loan as she wants to fulfill the demand from her clients and in this way make more profit. Her goal is to continue to expand her business, offer more product and manage to get a sales stall in the market. She is working with the goal of improving her living conditions. she wants to acquire enough capital to be able to rest quietly and securely.

loans.use: to buy children's and adult's shoes.

loans.name: Maa Kali Group

texts.en:
Sarojini is a married woman of 44 years who lives in a remote village called M.Rampur in the Kalahandi district of Odisha, India. The lady standing first from the right with her hand raised is Sarojini. She lives with her three-member family comprised of her husband and one son who is about 22 years old. She is very energetic, hardworking and enthusiastic and always devotes her time to get her family ahead. 

Sarojini has been doing a rice business as well as a puffed rice business with the support of her husband for the last six years to maintain her family. Initially, she started the business in a low profile with a limited investment. For the expansion of her business, she formed a group and took a loan from Mahashakti during 2013. This is the second loan for her group. Now Sarojini is earning about 5,500 INR per month from her business, which is very scant to manage her family. To add some extra income, the business should grow. For that reason, Sarojini and her group members want another loan. With the loan, Sarojini will purchase paddy in a big quantity. She will process it to rice as well as puffed rice. She has a long cherished desire to build a permanent house for her family.
 
The other three members of her group, Kalyani, Sukanti and Gouri, are doing a milk business, and oil business and a book shop, respectively.

loans.use: to purchase paddy in a big quantity

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 26 years old and married. She is now applying for a loan of $800 to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $80.  She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as fish, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, candles, body lotion, noodles, water and cards. She is a very hardworking woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 14 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future. Her husband is a farmer. She is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko, candles, body lotion,  noodles, water and cards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood and lime for her business.

loans.name: Dina Ruth

texts.es:
Dina, es parte de una familia en la que todos son muy unidos, tiene casa propia, vive con su esposo y sus hijos; su negocio consiste en venta de ropa al detalle, también venta de celulares y accesorios para los mismos, lo hace con ayuda de su esposo, ya cuenta con 20 años de experiencia, lo aprendió por iniciativa propia debido a la necesidad de tener recursos económicos para cubrir gastos de su familia, su horario es de seis de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde.
Invertirá el préstamo en compra de blusas, pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, entre otras prendas para ambos sexos, así como también surtirá el negocio con nuevos modelos de teléfonos celulares, manos libres, chips, carcasas, etc., espera tener buenos resultados y mejorar su situación económica para cancelar la deuda adquirida.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio,  finalizar el pago de su casa, generar empleo y apoyar a sus hijos en su estudio.
texts.en:
Dina is part of a family in which all members are very close to each other. She has her own house and lives with her husband and children. 

Her business consists of selling clothes at retail as well as selling cell phones and related accessories; her husband helps out with the business. She already enjoys 20 years of experience in the business, which she got into on her own initiative when she needed the means to cover family expenses. Her work hours are from six in the morning to four in the afternoon.

She will invest the loan in buying blouses, pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and other garments for both sexes, as well as stocking the business with new models of cell phones, hands free devices, phone chips, cases, etc. She hopes for a good outcome and for an improvement in her financial situation to repay the loan.

Her dream is to expand her business, finish paying off her home, drum up business and support her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and other garments, new models of cell phones, hands free devices, SIM cards, cases, etc..

loans.name: Junior Luis

texts.es:
Junior es el mayor de tres hermanos, vive con sus padres en Lima, su madre es ama de casa y su padre es electricista.
Actualmente su familia pasa por una grave crisis económica, el dinero que gana su padre no alcanza para poder costear sus estudios y los de sus hermanos por lo que pronto Junior tendrá que dejar sus estudios para poder trabajar de no contar con la ayuda de los prestamistas Kiva para poder culminar su carrera.
Junior esta cursando actualmente su ultimo año de estudios y esta muy próximo a graduarse, actualmente esta realizando practicas y con lo poco que gana ayuda en su hogar.
El es el mayor de tres hermanos y sus padres están orgullosos de el porque pese a las dificultades económicas a logrado salir adelante siempre, por lo que lo consideran un ejemplo a seguir para sus hermanos menores.
Junior agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por el apoyo que pueden brindarle, comprometiéndose a terminar su carrera, trabajar muy duro para poder devolver el importe prestado con prontitud y así puedan los prestamistas ayudar a mas estudiantes que como el desean culminar su profesión.
texts.en:
Junior is the eldest of three brothers and lives with his parents in Lima. His mother is a housewife and his father is an electrician. Currently his family is experiencing a severe financial crisis, and the money his father makes is not enough to be able to afford his studies and that of his brothers, so Junior will soon have to set aside his education so that he can work, if he does not have the help of the Kiva lenders to complete his degree.

Junior is in his last year of studies and is very close to graduating. Currently he is doing practicums, and with the little he earns helps with the household expenses. He is the oldest of three brothers, and his parents are proud of him because in spite of the financial difficulties he has always managed to succeed. They consider him an example for his younger brothers to follow.

Junior is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support they can offer him, promising to finish his degree and work very hard so that he can return the amount loaned promptly. This way the lenders will be able to help more students, who like him, wish to complete their professional studies.

loans.use: To pay for his technical studies in machine and tool mechanics.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 47 years old and has one child.  Gemma is married and her child is in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gemma has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Shiera Rose

texts.en:
Shiera Rose is 28 years old with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Shiera Rose requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as gasoline, wood, fishing net, etc.

Shiera Rose has been in this business for four years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as gasoline, wood, fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Senayda Elisa

texts.es:
La señora Senayda  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive   con su esposo y sus 3 hijos  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  pulpería desde hace más de 2 años. 
Doña Senayda el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  manteca, arroz, frijoles, carne de pollo, azúcar, leche, huevos, pan, refrescos, etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer a sus clientes y a su vez brindarles una mejor atención a estos.
Doña Senayda espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de  los  negocios más grande y reconocido de la zona y  seguir  apoyando que sus  hijos para que  sean personas  de bien para la  sociedad, en la fotografía sale uno de sus hijos más pequeños el cual cuida a tiempo completo. 	


Choluteca, Honduras  –  Junio   del   2014
texts.en:
Senayda is a responsible, hard-working, and honest person. She lives with her husband and their three children in the south of Honduras. For more than two years, she has run a convenience store. 

Senayda needs the loan to buy butter, rice, beans, chicken, sugar, milk, eggs, bread, soft drinks, and other items. She hopes that with the loan, she will increase her sales since she will have more products to offer her customers, and be able to provide better customer service at the same time. 

Senayda hopes to be able to cover her living costs and improve her family's quality of life a little. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and in the next few years, become one of the biggest and most renowned shops in the area. She also hopes to continue supporting her children so that they become good members of society. In the photo, you can see her youngest son, whom she looks after full-time. 

Choluteca, Honduras-- June 2014

loans.use: to buy butter, rice, beans, chicken, sugar, milk, eggs, bread, soft drinks, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es:
Maria Alejandra vive en Lima junto a sus padres, su madre es ama de casa y no labora y su padre es chofer en una empresa donde apenas gana el sueldo mínimo.
Ella esta a la mitad de su carrera técnica en producción textil, pero los problemas económicos en casa debido a la baja remuneración que percibe su padre no le permitirán seguir estudiando, teniendo que trabajar para poder ayudar en casa y ahorrar para retomar sus estudios a futuro, de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Ella es una alumna muy aplicada y esta deseosa de poder culminar su carrera y ser una profesional de éxito, quiere triunfar en un mundo donde la demanda laboral para trabajos técnicos aun es en su mayoría masculina.
Maria Alejandra desea agradecer a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo con el que ella podra culminar sus estudios y ser una profesional de bien para la sociedad. Ademas agradece en nombre de todas las jóvenes el apoyo que dan a muchas señoritas con deseos de superación mediante el acceso a la educación.
texts.en:
Maria Alejandra lives in Lima with her parents.  Her mother is a housewife who does not work outside the home, and her father is a company chauffeur, barely earning minimum wage.   She is half way through earning her technical degree in textile production, but the financial problems at home due to her father's low wages don't allow her to continue studying.  She would have to work in order to help out at home and save to begin studying again in the future, if unable to count on the help of Kiva lenders.
    Maria Alejandra is a diligent student and wants to finish her degree and be a successful professional.  She wants to triumph in a world where the labor demand for technical work is mostly for men.  Maria Alejandra wants to thank the Kiva lenders for the help allowing her to complete her studies and become a professional for the good of society.  She also thanks them in the name all young women for the help given to many women wanting to overcome obstacles in life through getting an education.

loans.use: to pay for her technical studies in textile production

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Group

texts.en:
Subhra is a married woman, 37 years old, who lives in a remote village called M.Rampur in the M.Rampur district of Odisha, India. The lady standing first from the right with her hand raised is Subhra.  She lives with her four-member family comprised of her husband, one son and one daughter. She is very energetic, hardworking and enthusiastic and always devotes her time to get her family ahead.
 
Subhra has been doing an oil production and sales business with the support of her husband in her village for the last seven years. In the year 2013, Subhra along with other three members of her village formed a group and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the development of their businesses. This is the second cycle loan for her group. Now she is earning about 6,000 INR per month from her business, which is very scant to manage her big family. To add some extra income, Subhra's husband is doing some seasonal business in his village. So with this loan, she has purchased a big quantity of oil seeds and processes it to get oil. Subhra normally makes oil from ground nuts and mustard. She has a long desire to be a wholesaler of oil in her locality.

The other three members of her group, Pramila, Bilasini and Surati, are doing a hotel, a rice business and a puffed rice business, respectively.

loans.use: to purchase a big quantity of oil seeds

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Todas las mañanas un aire fresco acaricia la cara de Juan Carlos, quien con muchas energías sale de su casa para  analizar el estado de sus cultivos; siempre se asegura que el tomate, las chiltomas y el tabaco estén en condiciones para ser consumidas,  el bienestar de sus clientes es su preocupación. Tiene 40 años de edad, está casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Hace 20 años inició en el negocio de la siembra, el cual ha sido su principal fuente económica. Su esposa ha sido su mano derecha y juntos luchan por brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
Juan solicita el segundo crédito para aumentar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar insumos agrícolas, fertilizantes y productos agroquímicos para controlar el ataque de plagas y otras enfermedades. Manifiesta estar muy agradecido con el primer financiamiento puesto que logró obtener mejores ingresos económicos, lo que le permitió cubrir los gastos escolares de sus hijos y mejorar su dieta alimenticia. Anhela que el rendimiento de sus cosechas sean buenas. Una de sus metas es mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar y comprar equipos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Every morning, fresh air caresses the face of Juan Carlos, who, with much energy, leaves his house in order to analyze the condition of his crops. He always makes sure that the tomatoes, sweet peppers, and tobacco are fit to be consumed, and he is concerned with the wellbeing of his customers.  

He is 40 years old, and he is married with four children.  He started his farm business 20 years ago, and it has been his principal source of income. His wife has been his right hand, and together they fight to give their family better living conditions.

Juan is requesting a second loan in order to increase his capital production; he needs to purchase agricultural supplies, fertilizers, and agrochemicals for controlling attacks from pests and other diseases.

He says that he is very grateful for the first loan, as he was able to achieve better income, which made it possible for him to cover the costs of his children’s schooling and improve their diet. He hopes that his crop yields will be good. One of his goals is to improve the infrastructure of his home and purchase work equipment.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, fertilizers, and agrochemical products for controlling attacks from pests and other diseases.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a piece of land for a home

loans.name: Dianora Del Socorro

texts.es: Dianora es una mujer esforzada maestra de educación primaria labora en un núcleo educativo Rural de la zona donde vive con  29 años de ejercer dicha labor, casada no tiene hijos a su cargo, esta señora tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda, por eso  visito ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como, Zinc, Perlin, Cemento y Cerámica con los que mejorara el techo y el piso para tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Dianora is a courageous woman, and a primary education teacher in a rural educational center in the area where she lives. She has been working as a teacher for 29 years. She is married, and does not have children under her care. 

Dianora needs to improve her house, and this is why she has requested financing from Ceprodel. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as galvanized metal sheets, roof beams, cement, and ceramic tiles, which will be used to improve the roof and the floor in order to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as galvanized metal sheets, roof beams, cement, and ceramic tiles.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es: Ana tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas de 13 años y 8 años de edad. Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora quien con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Su esposo es profesor y le aporta en la economía del hogar. Ana desea mejorara las condiciones de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el repello de las paredes de la vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: cemento y arena. Espera poder contar con esta financiamiento y así dar inicio a la mejora lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old and lives in her own home together with her husband and her two daughters who are 13 and 8 years old. Ana is a very hardworking woman who, with great effort, has managed to bring up her family. Her husband is a professor and supports the economic needs of the household.

Ana hopes to improve the conditions of their home and for this she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in plastering the walls of her house, for which she will need materials like: cement and sand. She hopes she will be able to secure this loan and with it begin the improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy: cement and sand to plaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Cenelia  Elizabeth

texts.es: Cenelia es una señora `Preocupada por la enseñanza de los demás, maestra de educación primaria vive en  unión libre con un hijo al que le brinda el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, actualmente tiene la necesidad de legalizar su propiedad, por eso visito a ceprodel para ser beneficiada y lograr el objetivo deseado  para tener mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en: Cenelia is a woman "concerned with the education for all" as a primary education teacher. She is in a civil union and has one child for whom she provides the necessary support for their development. Currently, she has a need to legalize her property. For this, she visited Ceprodel to receive a benefit and achieve her desired goal to have better living conditions.

loans.use: with property legalization expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for first communion expenses.

loans.name: Fotemogoban 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAPALA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de mil avec madame MINATA débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme   FOTEMOGOBAN 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 73 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "FOTEMOGOBAN 3” are married women, who average 34 years of age and two children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in Commune de KAPALA, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is millet, as is the case with Ms. MINATA, who is standing first from the right in the photo of this women’s group FOTEMOGOBAN 3. With her loan, she intends to purchase a 50-kg bag of fertilizer and a container of herbicide and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 73,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan with interest and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicide and to cover the cost of plowing labour

loans.name: Sandy

texts.es:
La joven Sandy es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de ropa clasificada, desde hace 2 años.
Sandy tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive y también sale a vender a diversos lugares aledaños. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos para seguir realizando su trabajo como compra de blusas, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, camisas, etc. 
Sandy espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda a su negocio el cual le brinda una gran parte de sus ingresos y que  gracias a esta pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hermanos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Junio del  2014
texts.en:
Sandy is a very hard-working and responsible person who lives in a town in the south of Honduras with her family. She has been selling used clothing for 2 years now. Sandy runs her business from home and also goes out to sell in various places nearby. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise to keep her business going, such as blouses, dresses, skirts, pants, shirts, etc. Sandy hopes that this investment will be of great help to her business as it is her main source of income, and thanks to this investment she will be able to increase her income and improve her family's quality of life. She hopes to grow her business in the short-term and in this way continue supporting her family so that her siblings can study and have better opportunities in life. 

Choluteca, Honduras – June 2014

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, skirts, pants, and shirts, etc.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La señora Martha es maestra de educación primaria con 25 años de ejercer dicha labor, madre soltera  con un hijo a su cargo, esta señora tiene la urgencia de mejorar su vivienda por eso visito ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento el que utilizaría en la  Compra de materiales de construcción como: Arena, Cemento, Piedrín, Hierro, Bloque y Mano de Obra, con los cuales realizara la obra deseada como es la construcción de pared y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en: Martha has been a primary school teacher for 25 years. She is a single mother with one child in her care. Martha urgently needs to improve her house, and this is why she has requested a loan from Ceprodel. The loan will be used to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, gravel, iron bars, and cinder blocks, and to pay for labor costs. She wants to put up a wall, which will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, gravel, iron bars, and cinder blocks, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Fotemogoban 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAPALA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de mil avec madame AMINATA BAKOROBA  assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme FOTEMOGOBAN 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 73 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The women live for the most part in traditional families in Commune de KAPALA, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their third farm loan with the institution. The past loans were indeed paid back. 

The crop grown is millet, as is the case with Ms. AMINATA BAKOROBA, who is sitting first from the right in the photo of this women’s group FOTEMOGOBAN 4. With her loan, she intends to purchase a 50-kg bag of fertilizer and a container of herbicide and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 73,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan with interest and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and herbicides and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en: Arnulfo is aged 43. He has requested a Kiva loan for labor and other farm supplies like fertilizer, pesticide and seeds. This loan will help in the harvest to be bought by the buyers. This farm will help his family to secure their finances in the future. Arnulfo hopes that he can give all the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and seeds

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Chak, a 63-year-old father of six children, lives in a rural area of Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. To make a living, he works as a farmer on a small rice field near his house. Until now, it is almost 20 years that he has been involved in this career which allows him to make USD $5 per day.

Chak would like to get a loan from HKL that will be his first loan for him to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of his family members. Chak thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides him with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle and goats to begin a small business in animal sales.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives at Alcala with his wife, and they had five children. Three of them are studying. He gets his income through farming activities. He plants and harvests rice to sell to traders. His spouse also raises hogs for future sale. Together, they work hard to sustain the needs of the family. 

He wanted to earn more profits in the farming business, but he needs additional revolving capital. His income from the previous harvest was just enough to cover school expenses and bills at home. So, he is now asking for another loan of 25,000 Philippines pesos to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides to use for crop maintenance. With enough sustenance, his crops will grow fruitfully, thus giving him a profitable harvest someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
To have additional income, Marites engages in cooking and selling snack foods within the local community. She is now 52 years old and has two children. She and her husband work hand in hand to generate income and sustain the necessities of her family. 

Marites aims to improve her business and make it profitable but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to take a loan of 8,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, bananas, sweet potatoes and other ingredients she needs. She is hoping that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, bananas, sweet potatoes and other ingredients she needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies to feed her cattle and to improve her sales

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Eulalia has engaged in cooking and selling viands and other street foods in her community for almost five years now. She is 45 years of age and blessed with five children. Her husband, Jimmy, helps her in the business, and they work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs.

In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 pesos in sales every day.

Eulalia plans to cook and sell other delicacies, but she doesn't have enough capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional raw products like pork and chicken and seasonings that are needed. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Eulalia dreams to have her own restaurant in the future, and she hopes that her business will last longer. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lilia is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos) through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to buy ingredients needed like vegetables, meat and etc. to sell at her restaurant business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed like vegetables, meat and etc. to sell.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 52 years old, married and has seven children; one child is in school.

She is engaged in a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Vicky has been in the general store for five years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vicky would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Fotemogoban 6 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN 6 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAPALA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de mil avec madame ARAMATA assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme FOTEMOGOBAN 6. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Fotemogoban 6 group are married women who on average are 38 years old with two children, living for the most part in traditional families in Kapala, a commune in the Sikasso circle, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is millet featuring Mrs. Aramata, who is kneeling in the middle in the photo of this Fotemogoban 6 group of women.

She will use her loan to buy one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectares (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 74,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Andrés Antonio

texts.es:
Andrés de 34 años de edad,  estudio hasta 9º grado, está casado y tiene 3 hijos, 2 de ellos estudian. Su esposa maneja una pequeña tienda. Él es empleado, trabaja como distribuidor de jugos desde el 2011, antes trabajo para otra empresa por 3 años, después de acompañarse comenzó a buscar trabajo y se le dio la oportunidad, decidió dedicarse a este otro empleo ya que le ofrecieron mejores prestaciones y dice que le va muy bien. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, detergentes, galletas, golosinas, aceite, etc. Para surtir la tienda de su esposa y realizar unas mejoras a su vivienda.

 A él le gustaría que al menos que uno de sus hijos estudiara administración de empresas y el otro dice que le gustaría ser doctor y él dice que está dispuesto a apoyarlos.
texts.en:
Andres is 34 years old and completed the 9th grade.  He is married and has three children, two of them are in school. His wife runs a small shop. Since 2011, he has been employed, working as a distributor of juices.  Previously, he worked for another company for three years. After he started a family, he began looking for work, something that would give him opportunity.  He decided to dedicate himself to his current job because they offered better work and he says that it is going very well.

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy rice, beans, sugar, salt, detergents, biscuits, sweets, oil, etc. The purpose is to fill the store he shares with his wife and make some home improvements.

He would like at least one of their children to study business administration and the other he says he would like to be a doctor and he says he is willing to support them.

loans.use: to buy rice beans, sugar, salt, detergent, cookies, sweets, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un hombre trabajador, tiene 69 años de edad, es casado y vive en Huarmey junto a su familia.
Su mayor motivación es su familia, es por ellos que desde muy joven ha luchado para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Desde hace más de 30 años se dedica a la pesca artesanal, siempre le ha ido muy bien porque es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, y porque ha sabido superar las dificultades de la vida.
Antonio está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar redes de pesca, ya que sus anteriores redes están deterioradas. Con esto consiguiendo pescar más sus ingresos se incrementarán y seguirá esforzándose para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Antonio is a hard-working 69-year-old man. He is married and lives with his family in Huarmey. His main motivation in life is his family, and since he was young he has fought to give them a better future. He has been working in fishing for the last 30 years, and he has always done well because he is a very hard-working and responsible person and because he has been able overcome life's difficulties. Antonio is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help he will be able to buy fishing nets, as his current nets are worn out. If he catches more fish, he will increase his income and he will keep striving to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets for his business

loans.name: Fotemogoban 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAPALA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

She expects to make average profits of 75,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta is 23 years old and a single woman with no children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for more than two years. Elisapeta has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, yeast, sugar, oil, etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Elisapeta hopes to improve the development of her family from her business income.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, sugar, yeast, oil and etc.

loans.name: Lizafrieda

texts.en:
Lizafrieda is 22 years old and a single woman with one child. She runs a small business selling BBQ in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Lizafrieda has requested a loan to buy boxes of chicken, boxes of sausage, soy, tomato sauce, etc. She joined SPBD (South Pacific Business Development) in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lizafrieda will support her family and save for her future plans to become a good business woman.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chicken, boxes of sausage, soy, tomato sauce, etc.

loans.name: Fotemogoban B Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAPALA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de mil avec madame  MATOU assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme FOTEMOGOBAN B.

Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 36 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
