They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is millet featuring Mrs. Matou, who is kneeling in the middle in the photo of this Fotemogoban B group of women.

She will use her loan to buy 25 kilos of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.25 hectares (about 0.62 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 36,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and its interest, and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel works hard to support her family. Raquel is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Raquel has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: José Herman

texts.es:
José de 30 años de edad,  estudio hasta 7º grado, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos, 1 estudia, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Él trabaja como motorista de un mototaxi transportando personas desde hace unos 2 años. Antes se dedicaba a la agricultura hasta que un día conversando con su amigo le dijo que él se iba del país y que si le gustaría quedarse con su trabajo y él vio que era una mejor manera de traer ingresos a su hogar. 

Él necesita el dinero para comprar frutas y verduras para vender, ya que es otra manera de generar ingresos a través de su esposa ya que su familia siempre se ha dedicado a este tipo de negocio. A él lo que le interesa es que sus hijos estudien y que se superen, él dice siempre estará en la disposición de apoyarles pero respeta lo que quieran estudiar.
texts.en:
Jose is 30 years old.  He attended school until the 7th grade.  He is married with two children, one is still in school.  His wife is devoted to domestic chores. For about two years, he has worked as a driver of a motorcycle taxi, transporting people.

Previously he was a farmer until one day, talking to his friend, the friend told him he was leaving the country and asked if he wanted to keep the friend's job.  He saw that it was a better way to bring income to his home.

He needs the money to buy fruits and vegetables to sell because it is another way to generate income as his wife and his family have always been dedicated to this type of business. To him what matters is that their children study and get ahead. He says will always be available to support them in whatever respects as long as they want to study.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Marys Yesenia

texts.es:
La señora Marys es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con sus  hijos y  su esposo en el sur de Honduras. Sus  negocios son la   venta  de leña, cerdos  y una glorieta.
Doña Marys el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de carnes,  lechugas, arroz, tomates, cebollas, manteca, cerdos, leña, etc. Para tener producto para elaborar comidas y vender en su glorita  y a su vez comprar cerdos para engorde de los mismos.
Doña Marys con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer a sus clientes, también espera cubrir las necesidades  que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad  de vida y la de su familia.
Doña Marys en unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en una de  los negocios  más grande y reconocido de la zona y que sus hijos  se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida. 	

 

Choluteca,Honduras – Junio del 2014
texts.en:
Marys is a responsible, hard working and honest person who lives with her children and husband in southern Honduras. Her businesses are in selling firewoood, pigs and small restaurant. The loan Marys needs is to buy beef, lettuce, rice, tomatoes, onions, pigs, firewood, etc. in order to have products to make food to sell in her restaurant and, at the same time, buy and feed pigs. 

With the loan, Marys hopes that her sales will increase and she will have more products to offer her clients. She also hopes to cover her needs and improve her quality of life a little and that of her family. In a few years, Marys hopes that her business will continue to grow and become one of the largest and best known businesses in the zone. She also hopes her children will become good people will greater opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras - June 2014

loans.use: to buy beef, lettuce, rice, tomatoes, onions, pork fat, pork, firewood, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase shoes and cloth

loans.name: Sabougnouman 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  SABOUGNOUMAN 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAPALA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame MICHATA ABDOULAYE   débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SABOUGNOUMAN 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 30 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 37 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group "SABOUGNOUMAN 1” are married women, who average 38 years of age and four children each. The women live for the most part in traditional families in Commune de KAPALA, in Cercle de SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their farm work during the rainy season. They are on their first farm loan with the institution. 

The crop grown is peanuts, as is the case with Ms. MICHATA ABDOULAYE, who is standing second from the left in the photo of this women’s group SABOUGNOUMAN 1. With her loan, she intends to purchase 30 kg of fertilizer and a container of herbicide and to cover the cost of plowing for maintaining 0.25 hectare.

After the harvest, the produce is sold to a customer base composed of men and women paying with cash or credit in the village and in SIKASSO. She plans on making an average profit of 37,000 francs CFA per planting. This profit will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicide and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Sabougnouman 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  SABOUGNOUMAN 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAPALA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides and to cover the cost of plowing

loans.name: Esther Imelda

texts.es:
Esther vive con sus padres en una zona populosa del puerto del callao en una pequeña casa de madera. Su familia es muy humilde y ambos padres trabajan para poder mantener el hogar.
Su padre es chofer de taxi y su madre también hace servicio de transporte publico de pasajeros en una mototaxi.
A ellos no le alcanza el dinero para seguir pagando las mensualidades de los estudios de la joven Esther, por lo que ella deberá de abandonar sus estudios y sus sueños, para ayudar en casa cuidando a sus hermanos menores ya que aun no tiene edad para trabajar, de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Esther confía en que los prestamistas de Kiva puedan ayudarla a continuar sus estudios por lo que agradece anticipadamente todo el apoyo que estos puedan brindarle.
Ella desea culminar sus estudios y trabajar en una empresa industrial que le permita aprender y desarrollarse profesionalmente, ayudar a sus padres y sacar adelante a su familia.
Ella es una chica muy creyente y agradece a Dios que existan personas desinteresadas como los prestamistas de Kiva que ayuden al prójimo sin esperar nada a cambio, ella piensa que se les colmara de bendiciones por sus tan nobles acciones.
texts.en:
Esther lives with her parents in the populous zone of Puerto del Callao in a small wooden house. Her family is very humble and both parents work in order to maintain the home. Her father is a taxi driver and her mother also works in public transportation services in a motorcycle taxi. They don't have enough money to continue paying the monthly education fees for their young daughter, Esther, and because of this she will have to abandon her studies and her dreams, if she cannot secure a Kiva loan, to help around the house, caring for her younger brothers since they are not yet old enough to work. 

Esther believes that the Kiva loans will allow her to continue her studies and for this she gives her thanks in advance for all the support that they offer her. She hopes to complete her studies and work in an industrial business that will allow her to learn and develop professionally, to help her parents and bring up her family. She is a believer and thanks God that their are selfless people like the Kiva donors who will help another without expecting anything in return. She believes that they will receive many blessings for their noble deeds.

loans.use: to pay for her technical studies in industrial administration.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is 48 years old. She is a mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband works in dairy products sales like milk, curd and butter. He owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. He sells milk to different tea stalls daily. He is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his earnings through his milk sales business. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of his clients. He was in need of one buffalo to increase his income through his milk sales business, so Nasreen requested a loan for him. In this way, she can support her husband’s milk sales business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's milk sales business.

loans.name: Luisa Elizabeth

texts.es: Luisa tiene 29 años de edad  y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijas de 13 años y 6 años de edad. Luisa es una mujer muy trabajadora y admirable por su gran compromiso con su familia. Ella se gana la vida trabajando como jornalera desde hace  mucho tiempo y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar. Ella ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, madera, y un portón dado que desea reparar el techo de la vivienda y cambiar el portón de la entrada de su casa que se encuentra deteriorado.
texts.en: Luisa is 29 years old and lives in her own house with her two daughters who are 13 and 6 years old. Luisa is a very hard-working and admirable for her dedication to her family. She has worked as a day laborer for a many years, and this is how she supports her family. She has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood and an gate, as she wishes to repair the roof of her home and replace the gate that is worn out.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and a gate to repair the roof of her house and to make it more secure.

loans.name: Sandra Del Socorro

texts.es: Sandra del socorro, Mayor de edad casada con 12 hijos todos independientes, originaria del municipio de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial y turística, es una microempresaria el cual tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitación donde ofrece productos de consumo del hogar como: : arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pasta de dientes, leche, fósforo, café, pan, huevos, productos congelados, golosinas entre otros tambien se dedica a la comercialización y comercio de tamales rellenos, simples, revueltos, elotes cosidos y guirilas todos hechos de maíz tierno, y cada 15 días destaza un cerdo el cual lo vende transformado en deliciosos nacatamales, pepena, frito rojo, charrasca, moronga entre otros mas, los cuales vende de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados y distribuidoras de esta localidad, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito los cuales recupera quincenal, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, Sandra se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable en su forma de pago y con muchos deseos de superación personal, uno de sus sueños es poder ver crecer sus negocios para así lograr en un futuro no muy lejano tener mejores ingresos, mejorar su propiedad .Con sus negocios saco adelante a sus doce hijos a los cuales sigue apoyando, realiza sus negocios con entusiasmo y amor,  el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir el inventario en sus negocios como: productos congelados, granos básicos,crema, queso, cuajada, leche, golosinas, elotes, entre otros mas. Sandra agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Sandra del Socorro is an older adult. She is married and has 12 children, all independent. She is a native of the township of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country, a zone that is characterized as being commercially productive and touristic. She is a microentrepreneur whose business is a small grocery store in her house, where she offers products for household use, such as rice, beans, sugar, toothpaste, milk, matches, coffee, eggs, frozen products, and candies, among other items. She also makes and sells stuffed and simple tamales, scrambled eggs, cooked corn on the cob, and güirlas (tortillas with fresh corn and cheese), all made with fresh corn. Every two weeks she butchers a pig, which she sells transformed into delicious nacatamales (pork-filled tamales), cooked pork fat, fried meat, fried pig skin, and blood pudding, among other items. She sells these as an itinerant vendor and in her home. She makes her purchases for cash in the markets and from the distributors in her area. She makes her sales for cash and on credit, for which she collects every two weeks. She has regular and occasional customers. 

Sandra is known as an entrepreneurial woman who is responsible with her payments and has a great desire for personal achievement. One of her dreams is to be able to see her business grow so that she can thus manage in the not-too-distant future to have more income and improve her property. With her business, she raised her twelve children, whom she continues to help. She carries out her businesses with enthusiasm and love. The purpose of this new financing is to invest in working capital and stock the inventory of her businesses with frozen products, basic grains, cream, cheese, fresh cheese, milk, candies, and corn, among other items. Sandra very much appreciates the support that the Kiva investors offer to people of scarce economic resources.

loans.use: to invest and increase her business by buying basic materials such as corn on the cob, sugar, cheese, leaves, cheese, and basic grains, among other items.

loans.name: Heremakono Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe  HEREMAKONO  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  MAMASSONI un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame  AWA  débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes  HEREMAKONO, fait la vente des pommes de terre .
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 5 paniers de 100 kg de pomme de terre au grand marché d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle par la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail  à MAMASSONI  à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 43 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Heremakono group are married women who on average are 48 years old with five children. Most of them live in traditional families in Mamassoni, one of the neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They are on their fifth group loan with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution, to meet their customers' needs.

Mrs. Awa, who is standing in the first position from left to right in the photo of this Heremakono group of women, sells potatoes.

She intends use the loan to buy five 100-kilo baskets of potatoes at the main market, where she is in high demand by her customers due to the quality of her products. Retail sales are conducted in Mamassoni, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit. 

She hopes to attain average monthly profits of 43,000 CFA francs, a portion of which will be used to pay off the loan and its interest, and rest put into savings.

loans.use: buy potatoes

loans.name: Fredisminda

texts.en: Fredisminda is 56 years old, married and a farmer living at Alcala. She and her spouse are farmers. For added income, her spouse also manages a photo studio. She is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to invest in the farming business. She will buy fertilizers, herbicides and pay for the labor cost in farming. Someday, Fredisminda hopes to gain a profitable harvest in order to save funds for the family’s future expenses. In this photo, she is in their photo studio.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and pay for the labor cost in farming.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 42 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to resell like canned goods, eggs, cream, soap, shampoo, etc.

Arlene has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming vegetables. Arlene aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to resell like canned goods, eggs, cream, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Seira

texts.en: Seira is 49 years old and a single woman with two children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Seira has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, etc. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Seira will support her family and save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Ziyodamo

texts.ru:
Зиёдамо жительница города Куляб, Хатлонской области Таджикистана. Зиёдамо 53 года. Она живет вместе с мужем, сыновьями, дочерью и невесткой. У них большая семья. Муж Зиёдамо работает таксистом. Сама она продает хлеб на рынке. Готовый товар ему приносит сын, он с женой печет хлеб дома. 
Зиёдамо на протяжении восемнадцати лет занимается торговлей. Она берет кредит для приобретения продуктов, чтобы испечь хлеб для торговли. Также она намерена открыть пекарню. Основная цель Зиёдамо увеличить количество товара. Так как на сегодняшний день у нее много клиентов и имеющий товар быстро раскупается.
texts.en: Ziyodamo is a resident of Kulob in the Khatlon province of Tajikistan.  She is 53, married, and lives together with her husband, sons, her daughter and her daughter-in-law.  She has a big family.  Her husband works as a taxi driver, while Ziyodamo herself sells bread at a local marketplace and has been doing so for more than 17 years.  Her son and his wife bake the bread at home and deliver it to her at the market.  She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for baking bread.  Her motive for doing so is to increase her supply; she has a lot of customers as of late, and they buy up her bread rather quickly.

loans.use: buy ingredients for breadmaking

loans.name: Mandiaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mandiaye, âgé de 61 ans est un fonctionnaire à la retraite qui s’est lancé en 2010 dans l’aviculture. Il est marié et père de 6 enfants dont l’ainé, un garçon est âgé de 33 ans et le benjamin,  de 16 ans. Monsieur Mandiaye, a démarré l’élevage avec 50 poussins et petit à petit, a améliorer ses ventes. Actuellement, il élève jusqu’à hauteur de 150 sujets ; c’est d’ailleurs l’objet du crédit sollicité : en même temps, il va acheter les aliments volaille (démarrage, croissance, finition). Monsieur Mandiaye est encore très actif : il se lève à 5h du matin et reste mobile jusqu’à 21h 30mn, heure à laquelle il donne aux sujets, son dernier repas avant d’aller se coucher.
Mandiaye avait démarré auparavant la vente de gaz, il possédait un dépôt et avait un verger. Il aimerait développer ses activités afin de maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Monsieur Mandiaye is 61 years old and a retired civil servant. He began poultry farming in 2010. He is married and the father of six children between 16 and 33 years old. He started his poultry farm with 50 chicks. Little by little, he is improving his sales. Currently he can raise up to 150 birds, and this is why he is asking for a loan. At the same time, he will buy bird feed (starter, grower, and layer/broiler). 

Monsieur Mandiaye is still very active. He wakes up at 5 am and stays mobile until 9:30 pm - at which time he feeds his birds for the last time before going to bed. Mandiaye had previously sold gas. He had a warehouse and an orchard. He would like to develop his business in order to maximize his profit.

loans.use: raise and resell chicks.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en: Ismael is a long-time client, aged 46 years, who lives in Delfin Albano municipality. He is a married man with four children. He has applied for a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy mulch to help improve the status of his rice plantations. He has a challenge of little income from his plantations. Although he has many clients in the area who buy his crops, his output is small. Therefore, he wants to use the loan to buy manure and standardize his agricultural output to a level that will give him good yields and money as this will help him to educate his children in better schools.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en: Shumaila is age 32; she is a mother of two children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. Recently, his rickshaw stopped working properly, and now he is unable to generate sufficient income to cover his daily expenses. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Shumaila has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Shumaila is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of rickshaw maintenance.

loans.name: Frances Leo

texts.en:
Frances Leo is feeling blessed with the help of Kiva lenders. He thanks them a lot. He is a very hardworking and dedicated farmer. With the profits from his rice cultivation of last season, he could save for his family.

Frances Leo wants now to save for the future of his family. That’s why he has expanded his rice production. For the purchase of diesel, fertilizers and pesticides, he asks lenders for another loan of 18,000 PHP.

loans.use: to purchase diesel, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en: A 1,000 USD loan is offered to Fernanda to improve her business. Fernanda opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like shoes, long pants and shorts. Fernanda is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Fernanda is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy shoes, long pants and shorts.

loans.name: Sabougnouman 5 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  SABOUGNOUMAN 5 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAPALA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame RAMATOU assise au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SABOUGNOUMAN 5. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 30 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 36 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Sabougnouman 5 group are married women. On average, they are 30 years old, have two children, and live in traditional families in Kapala, a town in Sikasso Cercle, 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see their farming activities through the rainy season. This is their first loan with the institution. 

They grow peanuts with Madame Ramatou, who is seated in the middle of this photograph of Sabougnouman 5.

With her loan, she will pay for 30 kg of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and plowing for 0.25 hectares of land. After the harvest, they sell their crops in Sikasso to men and women who pay by credit and cash.

The profits will allow her to pay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: pay for fertilizer, herbicide, and plowing.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es: Eliseo tiene 38 años de edad y junto a su esposa procrearon tres hijos quienes tienen 13 años, 8 años y 5 años de edad y apoya en su desarrollo. Eliseo trabaja en un ingenio cercano a su localidad y es así como apoya a sus hijos en la economía y en su crecimiento. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el techo de la vivienda. Con el crédito solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera, polines y pagará la mano de obra necesaria para la mejora.
texts.en:
Eliseo is 38 years old and he and his wife have three children who are 13, 8 and 5 and whom he supports. Elisio works at a sugar mill nearby where he lives. This is how he is supporting his children financially and raising them.

With the aim of improving their living conditions, he has made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI in order to pay for a new roof for his home. With the loan requested he will buy sheet metal roofing, wood, purlins, and pay for the labor necessary for the improvement.

loans.use: To buy sheet metal roofing, wood, purlins and pay for labor for installing a roof on his home.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra de 53 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por algunas razones, el nivel de pobreza que había en la familia y la distancia, con ella solo vive uno de sus 4 hijos, ella es viuda y los ingresos provienen de sus hijos.

 Una de sus hijas esta en EEUU y le envía remesas, Sandra toda su vida se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos. Ella necesita el dinero del préstamo para comprar material para reconstruir el techo de su casa, como lamina y madera; ya que en la época lluviosa tiene que andar moviendo sus cosas para que no se mojen. A ella le gustaría ver a sus hijos que se superen y que tengan una familia unida como la tuvo ella y ver crecer a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Sandra is 53 years old.  She didn't have the opportunity to study because of the poverty level of her family and distance.  

Only one of her 4 children lives with her.  She is a widow and the income in her household comes from her children.  One of her daughters is in the United States and she sends remittances.  

Sandra has taken care of the housework for her entire life.  She needs this loan to buy materials such as sheet metal and wood to reconstruct the roof of her house, since she has to keep moving her things so that they don't get wet during the rainy season.  She would like to see her children excel and have a united family like she had and see her grandchildren grow up.

loans.use: to buy materials to reconstruct the roof of her house, such as sheet metal and wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as zinc metal sheeting and 2x2x6 size wood pieces, and pay for labor

loans.name: Ricardo Alcides

texts.es:
Ricardo de 43 años de edad, no estudio ya que sus padres necesitaban el apoyo de él desde niño para llevar ingresos a su hogar. Ricardo, está acompañado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Él se dedica a la agricultura, antes era comerciante, vendía productos en las comunidades pero por el temor a tener enfrentamientos con la delincuencia decidió retirarse del negocio. 

Ahora el necesita el apoyo del préstamo para limpiar la tierra y sembrar 3,500 metros cuadrados de frijol y otros 3,500 de maíz. Ricardo respeta lo que sus hijos quieran estudiar ya que no puede decidir sobre su futuro.
texts.en:
Ricardo, 43, was unable to get an education because his parents needed his support to bring income into the household.  He is married and his wife takes care of the home.  He now works in agriculture although before he was a merchant and sold products throughout the communities.  Fearful that he would run into conflict with delinquents, he decided to change businesses.

Now he is in need of a loan to clean his land and plant 3,500 square meters of beans and another 3,500 square meters of corn.  Ricardo respects the fact that his children want to study, since he cannot decide their future.

loans.use: To clean his land and plant 3,500 square meters of beans and 3,500 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene la edad de 48 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos los cuales estan en edad escolar, es originario de una comarca que esta a 5 km de un pueblo llamado Posoltega. Es profesor de Educacion Primaria desde hace 28 años de la Escuela Julia Martinez. Es una persona alegre,responsable,trabajador,emprendedor,con deseos de superacion.

Don Juan ademas de dedicarse a laborar como profesor, tambien se esta dedicando desde hace 3 años junto a su esposa a la crianza de ave de corral (gallinas), lo que significa que ya cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y que a la vez esta siendo de gran ayuda, ademas que es un proyecto que siempre deseo  realizarlo y que poco a poco quiere aumentar.

El necesita realizarle mejoras a su casa de habitacion, ya que quiere cambiarle el techo a la cosina y las alfajias y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 48, is married and has three school-aged children.  He is from a community that is 5 kilometers from a village named Posoltega.  He has worked as a primary school teacher at the Julia Martinez School for 28 years.  He is a cheerful, responsible, hard-working, enterprising person with a desire to get ahead.

Apart from his work as a teacher, three years ago Juan started raising hens with his wife so he now has experience in that business which is of great help.  It is something he always wanted to go into and little by little expand on.

Juan needs to carry out home improvements and wants to change the ceiling and beams over the kitchen.  This will improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting and wood, and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana is applying for a loan of $600 from TRM (TubaRaiMetin). She is 38 years old and is married. 

She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as shampoo, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, coffee, noodles, body lotion, oils, candles and bread. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.
 
Flaviana lives in a town, near the school; her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy, including students. She is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people to improve their living conditions in the future. She lives in a very simple house.

loans.use: to buy stock for her shop.

loans.name: Sisi

texts.en:
Sisi is 71 years old, and is a widow with ten children. She owns and operates a business selling clothes. She has three years of experience in this line of business. 

Sisi needs a loan to buy scissors, needles, materials, thread, and to renovate her house. She hopes to use her profits to save for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy material, scissors, needles, thread,etc.

loans.name: Sugey De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Sugey es habitante de posoltega es casada tiene un niño en edad escolar su esposo trabaja en la zona franca Yazaki ubicada en la ciudad de león ella cuenta con una pulperia  desde hace 2 años ella es una mujer emprendedora que desea que su negocio se extienda mas.

con este préstamo que se le otorgo la señora ocupo la mayor parte para invertir en su negocios y otra parte para el pago de la mano de obra una mejora que esta realizando para su negocio ella es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchos sueños y metas para crecer en su negocio .
texts.en:
Sugey lives in Posoltega.  She is married and has a school-aged son.  Her husband works in the Yazaki free duty zone located int he city of Leon.  For two years Sugey has been running a grocery store.  She is an entrepreneur who wants to expand her business.

She will use most of the loan to invest in her business and the rest to hire workers for the locale renovation she is doing.  She is a hard-working woman with many dreams and goals for increasing business.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa, a 58-year-old micro-entrepreneur from Cavite, Philippines, has run her office and school supplies business for twenty years, and she makes a good income from this. She is married and the couple is determined to work hard to provide their children with a better education than they currently have. Having a big family requires a lot of effort to provide for everyone’s needs.

A school/office supplies store is where one can buy school supplies, like pens, bond paper, cartolina and the like, without going to a bookstore. She gets the supplies at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To improve her profit, Teresa is taking a loan of PHP 10,000 which she will be utilizing to buy products and other materials. A necessary increase in her inventory will give a favorable boost to her income.

Teresa hopes to grow her business and also to nurture her entrepreneurial skills. She also wants to help her grandchildren in their studies. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of office/school supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: Julia Elena

texts.es:
La señora julia es habitante de posoltega que se encuentra ubicado 11 km de chichigalpa municipio de chinandega ella es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos están a su cargo en edad escolar ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada desde hace 1 año  antes de tener su negocio trabajaba en la costura y de ayudante de cocina.

la señora es una mujer trabajadora ,emprendedora que lucha por la educación de su hijos ella es una persona sencilla, humilde que le gusta trabajar para cumplir todos sus sueños y metas .

ya que ella sueña con que sus hijos estudien en la universidad
texts.en:
Julia lives in Posoltega which is 11 kilometers from Chichigalpa, a municipality of Chinandega.  She is a single mother with three children, two of which are in her care and school aged.  She has a small business selling used clothing, which she has been in for a year.  Before that she used to work as a seamstress and cook's assistant.

Julia is a hard-working entrepreneur who struggles to give her children an education.  She is a simple, humble person who enjoys her work while striving toward her dreams and goals, since she wants her children to get a university education.

loans.use: To buy used clothing.

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita is 36 years old and is married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like shampoo, groceries, etc. Chita has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Chita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 54 years old and is a mother of four. She is hardworking and a dedicated housewife. Her husband owns a poultry farm business. He has been in this business for the past six years. 

Shamim and her husband aim to increase their poultry farm business as there is demand, and they think this is the best time to avail this opportunity. For this purpose her husband wants to buy boilers, cages and other equipment to raise more chickens. But due to a lack of funds they have requested a loan to become more resourceful. Her husband wants to save money for the future for his children.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's poultry farm business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a business making nipa roofing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for twelve years now.

Anita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of nipa to make nipa roofing.

In the future, Anita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of nipa to make nipa roofing.

loans.name: Yesenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Yesenia tiene la edad de 33 años, es casada y con 3 niños los cuales están en edad escolar, ademas tiene bajo su cargo a sus padres. Es una persona trabajadora, humilde, luchadora y con sueños y metas por cumplir. Ella labora para una institución del estado desde hace 6 años, desempeñándose como obrera (limpieza de calles).

Doña Yesenia tiene como meta de futuro reparar su vivienda para darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. 

Sus padres son de escasos recursos y por esta razón necesita comprarle la medicina a su mamá y ayudarle con los gastos de su operacion.
texts.en:
Yesenia, 33, is married and has three school-aged children.  Her parents are also under her care.  She is a hard-working, humble, determined person with dreams and goals to achieve.  She has been working at a state institution for six years as a street cleaner.

Yesenia's goal for the future is to repair her home so she can give her family a better quality of life.  Her parents have very little income so she must buy medication and help cover the cost of an operation for her mother.

loans.use: To pay for her mother's medical expenses (an operation and medication).

loans.name: Uli

texts.en:
Uli is a 58-year-old married woman with eight children. She has a plantation that grows taro, bananas, yams and taamu to earn a living. 

Uli has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed sprayer, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2010. Uli will use her profits to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, etc.

loans.name: Minazini Group

texts.en:
Mwanaid is aged in her forties, married, and has five children, all of whom are in school. She manages a stall selling fruit, vegetables and sunflower oil, a business she has been in for five years. Mwanaid starts selling items from 6am to 6pm daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is her first loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use her loan to buy fruit and vegetables and gallons of sunflower oil. In the coming years, Mwanaid would like to improve her business and build a house. She will share this loan with her loan group" MINAZINI" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables and gallons of sunflower oil.

loans.name: Taupou

texts.en: Taupou is 39 years old and single with five children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy corn flour, sacks of sugar, oil, and frying pans. In the future, Taupou hopes to save her profits to support her family and to pay for her children's education as well. She joined SPBD (South Pacific Business Development) in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, corn flour, oil, frying pans, etc.

loans.name: Agrifina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Agrifina works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming corn and rice. Agrifina is borrowing PHP 6,500 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Agrifina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 32 years old and is married with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Janet has a business making nipa roofing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. She has requested a loan of PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of nipa to make roofing.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of nipa to make roofing.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is 35 years old and is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. 

She has been thinking of how to run a big business but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan and she is applying for her second loan of $800. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as shirts, both long sleeve and short sleeve, long pants, shorts and skirts. She is happy with TRM (TubaRaiMetin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy long sleeve and short sleeve shirts, long pants, shorts and skirts.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 65 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,500 PHP (Philippine Pesos) loan through NWTF (Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.) to purchase additional stocks, like sugar, sardines, noodles, etc. to sell.

Nenita has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks, like sugar, sardines, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a hardworking woman. She is 43 years old, married and had five children. Two of them are studying and in need of an allowance. Her spouse is a mechanic and a farmer too. Together they plant and harvest rice to sell to traders. 

Nida wanted to improve crop production through fertilizers and insecticides. She had insufficient funds, which is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides used in farming. It will help maintain good crops and further produce an abundant harvest. Additional revenue will be kept for education purposes and another part of it will be saved as revolving capital for the farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides used in farming.

loans.name: Arlen Junnieth

texts.es:
La señora Arlen es habitante de chichigalpa es casada tiene dos hijos de los cuales uno esta en edad escolar su esposo trabaja como conductor de taxi ella tiene un negocio en el mercado municipal de chichigalpa de venta de zapatos y chinelas de baño desde hace 18 meses ella cuenta con el negocio de venta de nacatamales en su casa de habitación los días viernes ,sábados y domingo ella destaza el cerdo para obtener mejor ganancia y vender la carne.

la señora solicito el préstamo para invertir en sandalias y zapatos de niñas y niños para tener variedad en su negocio es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora la cual apoya a su esposo en los gastos de su casa ella tiene la meta de llegar a tener mas grande su negocio y vender de todo estilo de zapatos y sandalia.
texts.en:
Arlen lives in Chichigalpa.  She is married and has two children, one of whom is school age.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  She has had a business selling shoes and flip flops at the municipal market of Chichigalpa for 18 months.  She relies on her business selling Nicaraguan tamales from her house on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays.  She also butchers pigs to bring in more income and sell the meat.

She is asking for this loan to invest in sandals and boys and girls shoes to add variety to her business.  She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who supports her husband in paying for their household expenses.  Her goal is to have a bigger business and sell all styles of shoes and sandals.

loans.use: to buy childrens footwear

loans.name: Candida Francisca

texts.es:
La señora cándida es casada su esposo trabaja con conductor de camiones en el ingenio san Antonio tiene 10 hijos los cuales todos están casados ella solo tiene a su cargo a una nieta la cual vive con ella en su casa ella vive en una comunidad cercana a chichigalpa llamada Guanacastal en esta zona la mayoría de sus habitantes son agricultores y comercializadores de cerdo ella tiene una venta de granos (básicos , pollo, carne , jabón, axe, aceite y verduras ) desde hace 20 años ella cuenta con esta venta.

la señora es una mujer trabajadora emprendedora sencilla la cual sueña con llegar a tener una venta mas grande y surtida de productos para el hogar.
texts.en:
Cándida is married and her husband works as a truck driver at the San Antonio plant.  She has 10 children who are all married.  She only has one dependent, a granddaughter who lives with her in a community near Chichigalpa called Guanacastal.  The majority of people living in this area are farmers and pork merchants.  She sells staple grains, chicken, meat, soap, axe, oil, and vegetables.  She has been counting on this business for 20 years.

She is a simple, hardworking, enterprising woman who dreams of having a bigger business and selling a large assortment of home products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Navigator Group

texts.en:
Jane is a businesswoman who makes her living by managing a low class restaurant, commonly known as mamalishe, a business she has been with for six years. She serves breakfast and lunch food. She starts serving people from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. Jane is mid thirties, not married, and has got one schooling son. 

Jane is requesting a third loan via Tujijenge Tanzania. She invested the previous credits in her business; she bought food cooking ingredients such as rice, maize and baking flour. She replaced some defect business equipment like tables, chairs, pots, utensils, etc. with new. With more efforts, she received an extra income which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. She is requesting a new credit which she will use to buy food cooking items. Jane dreams that one day she will be able to improve her business more. 

She will share this loan with her loan group NAVIGATOR, which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food cooking items.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros works hard to support her family. Milagros is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 20,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Milagros has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jessica is 45 years old and has four children who are in school.

She has a nipa roofing making business in the Philippines. Jessica requested a 20,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional nipa leaves to make nipa roofing.

Jessica has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional nipa leaves to make nipa roofing

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Fatima es habitante del municipio de chichigalpa es casada su esposo trabaja en la fabrica del ingenio san Antonino desde hace 15 años ella tiene 2 hijos en la universidad los cuales ella ayuda con el ingreso de su negocio La señora Fatima cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada y de artículos usados y nuevos la señora trabaja en costuras para obtener mas ingresos para la educación de sus hijos.

ella es una mujer trabajadora ,emprendedora ella tiene el deseo de ver a sus hijos concluir sus estudios
la señora Fatima sueña con algún día tener una tienda en su casa de habitación para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Fatima lives in the Chichigalpa municipality. She is married; her husband has been working in the San Antonio sugar plant for 15 years. Fatima has two children studying at university; she helps them financially with the income from her business. Fatima has a small business selling used clothes, and other used and new items. Fatima also does tailoring work in order to earn more to give her children an education.

Fatima is hard-working and enterprising. She wants to see her children finish their education.

Fatima dreams of one day having her own shop in her home so that she can improve her business.

loans.use: to buy packs of used clothes.

loans.name: Maria Justina

texts.es: Doña María es una mujer fuerte y emprendedora que ha trabajado por 25 años en su negocio, la socia se dedica a atender una comideria  y cuenta solo con la ayuda de su hija mayor que le ayuda a vender y hacer compras. Doña María con el crédito planea invertir en comprar más productos para su negocio como verduras, carnes, granos básicos y también algunas ollas de cocina para poder superarse. Gracias a los créditos anteriores ha aumentado sus ventas, obtener más clientes, a comprar una refrigeradora y una cocina.
texts.en: María is a strong and enterprising woman. For 25 years she has worked at her business, a restaurant. María receives help from just her eldest daughter, who helps by buying the supplies, and assists with sales. María plans to use this loan in order to buy more products for her business, such as a meat, basic grains and vegetables. She will also buy some pots and pans. Thanks to previous loans, María has increased sales, gained more customers, and has bought a fridge and cooker.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Jesusamado Salvador

texts.es:
Jesusamado vive en Lima con sus padres y hermanos, ellos vinieron de Arequipa a la capital en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades para su familia. Sus padres trabajan cuidando el local de una parroquia por lo cual apenas reciben de remuneración el sueldo mínimo.
Sus padres no solo afrontan los gastos de la casa sino también los gastos de estudios de Jesusamado y de su hermana y han decidido que la segunda continúe estudiando, por lo que el tendrá que dejar sus estudios para tener que trabajar de no poder contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
Jesusamado mismo decidió que sus padres continúen con el apoyo a su hermana, ya que el considera que el como varón tendrá mayor facilidad para seguir adelante y no desea que ella trunque su futuro por su causa.
Es por tal motivo que esta solicitando el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva a fin de poder continuar con sus estudios y así lograrse como profesional y ayudar a sus padres.
Jesusamado quiere agradecer a los prestamistas de Kiva por el gran apoyo que le brindan para seguir estudiando, y considera de vital importancia el estar capacitado para poder salir adelante en la vida, por lo que pide confíen en el para ser beneficiario que no los defraudara.
texts.en:
Jesusamado lives in Lima with his parents and siblings. The family came to the capital from Arequipa in search of better opportunities. Jesusamado's parents work looking after a church and receive minimum wage for this.

Jesusamado's parents do not just have to deal with household costs but also with the costs of Jesusamado and his sister's studies. His parents have decided that Jesusamado's sister can continue to study but that he must leave his studies so that he can go out to work, unless he receives support from Kiva lenders.

Jesusamado himself decided that his parents should continue to support his sister's studies. He believes that as a man it will be easier for him to get ahead, and he does not want his sister to cut short her studies.

As a result Jesusamado is applying for the help of Kiva lenders in order to continue with his studies, to have a profession and to help his parents.

Jesusamado wants to thank Kiva lenders for their great support in allowing him to continue studying. He thinks it is very important to have good training in order to prosper in life. He therefore asks you to trust in him as a borrower; he will not disappoint.

loans.use: to pay for his studies in industrial electronics and machinery.

loans.name: Roger Jesus

texts.es:
Roger es un hombre de 22 años de edad soltero y sin hijos.
Él vive en casa de sus padres tiene un hermano, terminó la escuela secundaria y se propuso continuar con los estudios superiores, ahora se dedica a su carrera de grado en la universidad pública. Roger se encuentra en tercer año de su carrera de grado y aún le quedan 2 años para terminar, su propósito es poder culminar toda su carrera satisfactoriamente y estar preparado para su futuro. El sueña con terminar su carrera y poder trabajar en lo que más le gusta; ser contador público.
Es por esos motivos que Roger solicita un préstamo para poder culminar su carrera de grado y poder ejercer.
texts.en:
Roger is 22 years old, single and has no children.

Roger lives at his parents' house and has one brother. He finished secondary school and decided to continue into further education. He is now studying for his undergraduate degree at a public university. Roger is in third year of his degree, and still has two years to go before he finishes. His aim to to finish the degree satisfactorily and to be prepared for his future. Roger dreams of finishing his degree and of working in the field that he most likes: public accounting.

For these reasons, Roger is applying for a loan in order to finish his undergraduate degree and practice his profession.

loans.use: to buy able to finish his undergraduate studies and start working.

loans.name: Maria Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
María es una comerciante con más de 10 años de experiencia los cuales le han servido para llenarse de conocimientos, habilidades y facultades para realizar una buena labor y profesión que le permita generar recursos para mantener su hogar y familia.
A sus 50 años de edad tiene dos hijos, pero con un ánimo y entusiasmo de trabajar para salir adelante envidiable, hace tres años inicio con un negocio de tienda general donde distribuye productos de la canasta familiar. 
En busca de mejorar su empresa y atraer nuevos clientes solicita un crédito para la compra de surtido en grano, abarrotes y productos de aseo que hasta la actualidad no distribuye pensando en fidelizar nuevos clientes y aspirando a convertir su empresa en un mini-mercado con empleados y surtido suficiente para cubrir cualquier demanda por parte de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is a businesswoman with more than ten years experience. This experience has helped her to develop her knowledge and skills in order to do a good job. This work allows María to earn the income to support her family and household.

At 50 years old, María has two children but is enthusiastic and motivated at work so that she can prosper. Three years ago, María started a general store where she sold staple goods.

In a bid to improve her business and attract new customers, María is applying for a loan in order to buy stock - grains, groceries and hygiene products, something that until now she has not sold. She wants to sell these items to make customers more loyal and to convert the business into a mini-supermarket with employees and enough stock to satisfy all of her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy stock for her bread shop, hygiene products, and groceries to increase the stock on sale to customers.

loans.name: Ra'no

texts.ru: Эту женщину на фотографии зовут Раъно. Ей 61 года. Она уроженка не большого района Дж.Расулова. Раъно работает учительницей в местной школе в течение 36 лет. Она любит детей и ей нравиться проводить время с ними. Также долгого времени Раъно занимается земледелием, выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Земледелием она занимается со всей семьей. Сейчас она посеяла рис и ждет богатый урожай. Но чтобы получить богатый урожай необходимо обработать землю минеральными удобрениями. У Раъно не хватает денег, чтобы приобрести достаточное количество удобрений, и она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en: This woman's name is Ra'no. She is 61 years old. She is a resident of the small region of J. Rasulov. Ra'no works as a teacher in a local school for 36 years. She loves children and she likes to spend time with them. Also Ra'no has been doing land cultivation for many years growing agriculture crops. She has been doing this together with the family. Right now she has sown rice and is expecting a rich harvest. But to get a rich harvest she needs to process the land with a mineral fertilizer. Ra'no does not have enough money to buy a required amount of fertilizer and has come to ask for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizer to process the harvest of rice.

loans.name: Eireen

texts.en: Managing a small retail store is a primary activity of Eireen within her community. She is a 45-year-old mother of four. Her husband works in their farm and also operates their motorcycle transport business to generate additional income. They aim to improve their business and increase their income to sustain their necessities and support the education of their children. Having inadequate capital, Eireen is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to increase her capital in order to buy more stocks of canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, snack foods and soft drinks to sell. She is hoping that someday she will improve her business and increase her income through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, snack foods and soft drinks to sell

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Lola

texts.en: Lola was born in 1987. She is married and is bringing up two children. She lives with her family in the north of Tajikistan. Lola is a kind and industrious woman. She has her own business deal. Lola has been busy with animal husbandry for more than eight years. She feeds sheep. Lola buys sheep, feeds them for some months and sells them in a local market. Lola likes her job so much and works with pleasure. This business is the main source of her family's income. Lola is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy sheep to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Henriguita

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Henriguita to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as pans, buckets, spoons, plates, cups, etc. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2013. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Henriguita independent because she can be responsible for herself and help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy pans, buckets, spoons, plates, cups, etc.

loans.name: Malika

texts.en: Malika is 20 years old. She is a student in her third year at the Pedagogical University of Tajikistan. Malika studies at the faculty of Chemistry and Biology. Malika studies in absentia. She also works in a school in her region as a secretary. Malika dreams of graduating from the university with excellent marks and being a good teacher. She must pay for her tuition and that’s why she is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to pay for her tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 53 years old and has 11 children. Melanie is married and three of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming nipa in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to pay for laborer's salaries for the harvest of nipa leaves.

Melanie has been farming nipa for 18 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers to harvest nipa leaves

loans.name: Mera

texts.en:
Mera is 58 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell of nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of nipa roofing to sell.

Mera has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Pesi

texts.en: Pesi is a 24-years-old woman who is single with one child. She runs a business selling noodles, tinned fish, freezers, etc in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Pesi has requested a loan to buy a freezer, tinned fish, a cooler, noodles and other daily goods. She plans to use her profits to save for her child's education and to support her family as well. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, tinned fish, a cooler, and noodles

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 66 years old and single. She works very hard to help her parents.

She runs a buy and sell of nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of nipa roofing to sell.

Mila has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en: Tahmina is a young and clever woman. She is married. She lives with her husband, who is a builder. Tahmina works in a local theater as a makeup artist. She has worked in this position for more than three years. Tahmina likes her job and does it well. Tahmina needs financial support because her father is ill. He has a heart problem. Tahmina is asking for a loan of 2000 TJS to buy medicines for treatment of her father. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment of her father.

loans.name: Luz Edilma

texts.es: Con el ánimo de ser una persona independiente y generar sus propios ingresos Edilma decidió iniciar el oficio de confección hace aproximadamente 10 años, profesión que aprendió gracias a sus años de trabajo en empresas que prestan similares servicios, pero cansada de recibir siempre el mismo sueldo se aventuró en busca de mejores oportunidades para ella y sus dos hijos por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de mercancía específicamente telas para realizar confecciones en camisas iniciando su propia marca y aspirando que este crédito sea el comienzo de un buen volumen de trabajo que le permita conseguir un local propio y ampliarse ofertando empleo a varias personas
texts.en: With the goal of being an independent person and generating her own income, Edilma decided to start making clothes 10 years ago, a profession she learned thanks to her years of working in businesses that offered similar services. She was tired of always receiving the same salary and ventured out in search of better opportunities for her and her two children. Therefore, she wants to request a loan for the purchase of merchandise, specifically fabric, to make shirts, starting her own brand. She hopes that this loan will be the beginning of a high volume of work that will allow her to get her own storefront and expand, offering employment to many people.

loans.use: buy fabric to make her own shirts.

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en: Rosanna, is aged 41, married and blessed with three children. She has managed her rice farming business in their village for almost ten years; from the last crop she earned a net income of PHP 50,000, which was spent on house repairs. Due to insufficient funds to use in her farming business she would like to take a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides for her farm. She's hoping that her farm will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: Nzasa Group

texts.en:
Nasra, a business woman aged in her mid twenties, has two daughters, one who is at school and another is small. She is married and supports her family by managing a beauty salon. Nasra also sells soft drinks; soda and water.  She has been in this enterprise for three years now and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
 
From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her second loan request which she will use to buy Muslim types of dresses for selling and hair products for her salon.  She used the previous credit, which she repaid successfully, to buy salon hair products. Nasra dreams that one day she will be able to improve her business and build a nice family house. She received extra income which she used to cover household expenses. 

Nasra will share this loan with her loan group ”Nzasa” which consist of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy Muslim types of dresses for selling, and hair products for her salon.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is 59 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Inocencia is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Inocencia has been raising pigs for five years and earns additional income from farming corn and rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear and foodstuffs

loans.name: Ilda

texts.en:
Ilda is applying for a loan of $1,200 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 28 years old. She is married and has one child. Ilda is running a kiosk in front of her house and wants to use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as slippers, candles, soft drinks, sugar, salt and body lotion. She is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Ilda is living in a town nearby the school. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students. Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy slippers, Fanta, beer, water, fish and other products.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Analisa works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store business. Analisa is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her motorcycle transportation business.

Analisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Peou

texts.en: Peou is a 54-year-old farmer who grows rice and vegetables. She is a widow who lives with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Both of her children are workers. All of them can earn approximately $14 per day. Peou is requesting a loan of $300 to build a bathroom. This loan will help her improve her living conditions. In the future, she is planning to increase the amount of rice and vegetables that she grows.

loans.use: To build a bathroom

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en: Gulbahor is a divorced mother of 3 children.  She raises her children independently.  Last year, she started her business, selling vegetables at a local market. She sells all kind of vegetables - potatoes, carrots, cabbage, tomatoes and etc. Gulbahor’s working day begins early morning and she works hard to earn her living. Gulbahor is ill and must buy medicines for treatment. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy medicines for treatment

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
This is Richard, a farmer, married with one child.  He is a very hardworking father. He always makes sure that he can sustain the needs of his family. Richard is requesting a loan of Php 18,000, to purchase a sack of fertilizer and two sacks of seedlings.

In the future, Richard hopes that he can renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of fertilizer and 2 sacks of seedlings.

loans.name: Amparita

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Amparita works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Amparita is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Amparita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: A portion of Hana's Group's 3,000$ loan helped a member to buy an air-conditioner and cosmetics.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 54 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. Emelita works very hard to provide for them.

Emelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emelita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, noodles, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future, Emelita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida lives in an agricultural region. She is 36 years. She is married, and brings up two children. 

Farida has been busy with growing agricultural products more than 16 years; she grows wheat and potatoes. She also has additional income from animal husbandry. Farida’s husband helps her with managing business. She grows feed for cattle on her own land. 

She is going to make periodically sowing, and that’s why she is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. 

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is a hard-working father of three children. His wife works as a full-time house wife. Ronald manages the family farm to improve the family's living conditions with his wife's help. He grows rice in their field. Ronald has a vast area of farm to manage, and that’s why he is asking for a loan of 18,000 PHP. He will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and fuel. He will manage his farm well to increase his yields and to save some of his earnings for the next crop season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and fuel.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 58 years old and has three children. She is now a single parent, for she was separated to her husband due to family conflicts and misunderstandings. Despite this, she has the determination to uplift the living status of her family. 

Aside from farming, she was also engages in making and selling hollow blocks within her community. She aims to make more stock of hollow blocks to sell, but she has inadequate capital. 

For this reason, Myrna wants to avail an additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy cement, gravel, and sand, and to pay the labor cost incurred in making hollow blocks to sell. 

Through patience and strong determination, Myrna believes that someday she will further improve the business as well as their status of living.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, and sand, and to pay the labor cost incurred in making hollow blocks

location.town: Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gelita

texts.en:
Gelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Gelita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more items like biscuits, bread, soft drinks and other groceries. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Gelita would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items like biscuits, bread, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
Nelma is 59 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of nipa.

Nelma has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Nelma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundle of nipa

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 49 years old and married with three children.

Felomina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Felomina has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years, and also earns an income from fishing.

Felomina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: 30 años de experiencia hablan por sí solos, de la calidad no solo del servicio si no del trabajo que desempeña Orlando en su cerrajería, siendo una persona muy reconocida en el barrio por su larga trayectoria, como ha laborado 30 años con los conocimientos que en ese tiempo aprendió no había estado enterado de que habían herramientas que le podrían dar los mismos resultados pero en un periodo inferior de tiempo, por esta razón quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de herramientas para facilitar su trabajo pues sus 66 años de edad cada vez pesan más a la hora de realizar un acabado o una reparación. Es padre de 2 hijos ambos mayores de edad los cuales los tuvo con su actual esposa los cuales le  han servido como fuente de inspiración y fortaleza para sacar su negocio adelanta y espera seguir con su tradición ofertando sus servicios de cerrajero a todo el que llegue ante él.
texts.en:
Thirty years of experience speak for themselves as to the quality, not only of the service but also the work, that Orlando does in his metal shop.  Orlando is well known in his neighborhood due to his long tenure there.  

He has worked for thirty years, yet with the knowledge that he gained in that time he hadn't realized that there were tools that would allow him to get the same results in less time.  Therefore he is asking for a loan to buy tools to make his work easier, because at the age of 66 the time it takes to add a finishing touch or make a repair gets increasingly difficult.  

He is the father of two boys, both of whom are adults, and whom he had with his current wife.  They have served as a source of inspiration and strength to get his business ahead.  He hopes to continue the tradition of offering his metalworking services to everyone who comes to him.

loans.use: to buy tools in order to minimize his production time and reduce his workload because his advanced age makes work difficult

loans.name: Wazo Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Agia is a mother of two sons and five daughters. Five of them are school aged, one is still too young for school, and the last is grown up. Since Agia's  husband does not have a high income generating job, she chose to start a small businesses to support her family's needs.
