Agia fries fish and chickens; she also sells fabrics and sarongs on credit. Agia hopes to increase her business income with her husband's help to build a nice family house. She is known for being a hardworking mother on her street. She starts working from 6:00am to midnight each day and makes a fair profit each month. 

She is requesting her eighth loan via Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. Agia used the previous credits, which she paid back successfully, to invest in her businesses. She bought three more buckets of fish together with chickens that she fried and sold. Due to her hard work, Agia earned a profit that she used to buy a home TV and start building a house. She was able to cover part of her household's food expenses and school fees.  Agia will use this new credit to buy stocks for both businesses. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "WAZO TEGETA," which consists of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock for both of her businesses.

loans.name: Vevirly

texts.en:
Vevirly is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She used the loan for buying more grocery stock for her variety store. The income from her business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She works hard for her and her child's future.

She would like to apply for another loan of 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better, as more items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vevirly hopes to have other sources of income and dreams to have a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Katherine

texts.es:
Katherine es una mujer de 20 años de edad soltera y sin hijos.
Ella término sus estudios secundarios y se dedicó al oficio de la peluquería, con la ayuda de su familia logró abrir un pequeño negocio de peluquería, es un emprendimiento muy sencillo ya que los materiales con los que cuentas son muy básicos. Gracias a este negocio ella se ocupa de los gastos  de educación de su hermanito menor ya que su familia no puede pagarlos. Ella necesita ampliar su negocio, le hace falta material de trabajo para poder tener mayor clientela. Su hermano menor estudia en la escuela primaria y todos sus gastos están solventados por la peluquería, él conoce esta situación y se siente muy feliz y agradecido por tener sus gastos mensuales pagados.
Katherine sueña con tener un negocio más estable para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y piensa que está por buen camino.
Es por esos motivos que Katherine solicita un préstamo para mejorar su peluquería y así continuar pagando los estudios de su hermanito menor.
texts.en:
Katherine is a 20-year-old woman.  She is single and doesn’t have any children.

She finished secondary school and went to work as a hair stylist. With the help of her family she managed to open a small hair salon.  It is a very simple establishment, because the tools she has are very basic.  Thanks to this business, she is able to take care of the schooling expenses for her younger brother, because her family couldn’t pay them.  She needs to expand her business, but she doesn't have the tools she needs to be able to have a larger clientele.  

Her younger brother goes to elementary school and all his expenses are paid for from the hair salon.  He understands the situation and is very happy and thankful for having his expenses paid.

Katherine dreams of having a more stable business in order to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.  She thinks that she is on the right track.  For these reasons Katherine is asking for a loan to improve her hair salon and, in this way, to keep paying for her younger brother’s schooling.

loans.use: to improve her hair salon and, in this way, continue to pay for her younger brother's schooling

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 42 years old. He learned to carry out farming work when he was very young. In addition to farming, he works as a day laborer. Jesse has to walk  one kilometer to get to work. He also owns cows, which he has to feed and milk in the mornings. He needs the loan to farm 2 hectares of rice to prepare the land, to buy fertilizers, and to pay labor costs.

Jessie's wishes for the future are to improve his family's quality of life, to increase production of basic grains, and to live comfortably in a decent place, so that his children can continue studying and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Rose requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle business. She has been in this business for 3 years now. In the future, Rose would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn. She is 59 years old and currently resides with her husband, Rudy, in Cavite, Philippines. 

She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than 40 years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Evelyn would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 50,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her business and to become successful in all that she is pursuing in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God that she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Muminjon

texts.en: Muminjon is a young and hardworking man. He is not married and lives with his parents. Muminjon's father is a shepherd and his mother is a teacher. Muminjon is the only child in his family. He is a student in his first year. Muminjon studies hard and is going to get a higher education so he can work in any organization in future. Muminjon is asking for a loan to pay his tuition. He awaits your help.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Yorfi Ledy

texts.es:
Yorfi es una soñadora, emprendedora, amable y cordial mujer de 35 años de edad dedicada a las confecciones actividad que aprendió desde muy joven gracias a sus familiares que han desempeñado estas labores por varios años. 
Gracias a este trabajo Yorfi ha podido criar, alimentar, darles un hogar y estudio a sus 3 hijos, todos ellos menores de edad.
Yorfi trabaja realizan confecciones a terceros y su volumen de producciones s muy constante por lo que necesita siempre tener los insumos para poder atender cualquier pedido que con frecuencia son para realizar en tiempo records lo que le supone siempre tener el material a la mano para empezar la producción por ende quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos como hilos, nylon, agujas, entre otros y realizar un mantenimiento a sus máquinas para garantizar su funcionamiento y la entrega oportuna y sin inconvenientes al cliente. 
Su gran sueño es poder tener un gran taller de confecciones rodeada de muchos empleados y brindarle a su familia un buen bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yorfi is a dreamer.  She is an enterprising, kind, and polite woman, age 35.  She works as a seamstress, a job that she learned from a young age thanks to her family members who have been doing that type of work for a number of years.

Thanks to her work, Yorfi has been able to raise and feed her three children, as well as give them a home and schooling.  All of her children are minors.

Yorfi sews for third parties, and her production volume is quite steady, so she always needs to have supplies to take care of whatever order.  Frequently these orders are needed in record time, so they suppose that she always has the necessary supplies on hand to begin production.  To this end, she wants to ask for a loan to buy supplies such as thread, nylon, needles, and other items, and to perform maintenance on her machines to guarantee their functioning and a timely delivery, without inconveniences, to the customer.  

Her big dream is to be able to have a big seamstress workshop surrounded by many employees, and to give her family well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her workshop such as thread and nylon, and to perform maintenance on her machines.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education fees.

loans.name: Mavjigul

texts.en: Mavjigul is married and has a child who is two years old. She always wanted to provide her family with good living conditions. Mavjigul is going to start her own business. She studied the course ‘To Get Ahead’ for women's organizations and got enough skills about business. Her husband will help her with business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy cattle for organizing a new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing a new business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 52 years of age, married and has two children. As a way of generating income, she has engaged in variety store business within her community for almost nine years now. Her husband, Rodolfo, helps her in their business and they work hand-in-hand to provide for their needs.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Aida wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like the help of a loan amounting to 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Aida hopes to stay strong and fit for work so that she could continually help to sustain their everyday needs. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a diligent mother who engages in a hog-raising business to support her husband in gaining income. She has six children and they live happily in a rural community. Despite hardships, they have the determination to uplift their status of living. 

Felicidad aspires to improve the business but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy hog feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Being a hardworking mother, she believes that someday she will further improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Ma. Greta

texts.en:
Ma. Greta is 40 years old and married with five children who are all in school.

She earns a living by farming corn and rice in the Philippines. Ma. Greta is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Greta has been farming corn and rice for six years and also earns additional income from a food vending business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for a member's children’s education.

loans.name: Jenny Fe

texts.en:
Jenny Fe is 36 years old, married, and has two children. 

Jenny Fe works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming corn and rice.

She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jenny Fe has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Jenny Fe aspires to to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ana De Jesús

texts.es:
Ana de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta  8° grado es acompañada y madre de dos hijos, pero no son de su actual pareja, pues tiene como un año de vivir con él. Su actual pareja se dedica a prestar servicio militar en el cuartel desde hace 4 años, los niños de Ana van a la escuela, ella se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a atender los clientes en la casa, pues tiene una pequeña tienda, que inicio debido a que en la casa donde vive recién la ha comprado y en el lugar anteriormente, había una tienda, y la gente del lugar siempre preguntaba si que pasaba con la tienda  y fue así que decidió intentar ponerla ella, pues anterior a eso ella trabajo en una funeraria.

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar productos para la tienda, (pollo, aceite, cuajada, churros, dulces, arroz, azúcar, etc.) los productos los compra en el pueblo de donde viaja en carro y de donde la deja el carro, transporta las cosas a pie, donde camina unos 10 minutos, ella cree que le toca muy difícil pero lo hace para que a sus hijos no les falte nada.

Sus sueños son mejorar la casa pues donde vive es de bahareque, planea también echarle ganas en el trabajo para mejorar las condiciones económicas y darle la oportunidad a sus hijos para que estudien, pues todo lo que ella hace es para el bien de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 28 years old, studied until the 8th grade. She is in a relationship and is the mother of two children, although they are not from her current relationship since she has only lived with him for a year. Her current partner has made a living enlisted in military service for 4 years. Ana’s children go to school. She is engaged in homemaking and serving customers in the house. She has a small store that she opened owing to that they have bought the house where they live recently and in the previous place there was a store. The people in the area were always asking what was happening with the store and that was how she decided to try to open it. Before this she worked in a funeral home.

The loan that she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to purchase products for the store (chicken, oil, cuajada cheese, churros, sweets, rice, sugar, etc.). She purchases the products in the town from where she travels by car and from where she leaves the car. She transports the things on foot by walking some 10 minutes. She believes that it is very difficult for her but she does it so that her children do not lack anything.

Her dreams are to improve the home since where she lives is made of adobe. She plans to also throw herself into her work to improve her economic conditions and provide the opportunity to her children to study. Everything she does is for the good of all of her family.

loans.use: to purchase products for the store (chicken, oil, cuajada cheese, churros, sweets, rice, sugar, etc.).

loans.name: Nasima

texts.en:
Nasima is smart woman. She was born in the year of 1967. She is married. Her husband, Gaybullo, is a farmer. Their children are adults. 

Nasima has her own business deal. She has been busy for six years with sewing. Nasima sews national women’s dresses. She has learned sewing from her mother. Nasima’s daughter-in-law helps her with managing the business. 

Nasima is going to develop her business. She plans to buy an embroidery machine to make embroidery on clients' clothes. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy an embroidery machine for increasing working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a hard-working mother who works and manages a school canteen within their community. She is 43 years old, married and has two school-aged children. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she needs to increase her income in order to help her husband in sustaining their  necessities and financing the education of their children. With this in regard, Elizabeth wants to cook and sell more kinds of snacks and meals in the school canteen in order to increase her income. Having inadequate capital, she would like the help of an additional of PHP30,000.00 to buy vegetables, meat, fish, bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, cooking oils and other ingredients she needs to cook and sell. Through this loan, she believes that she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fish, bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, cooking oils and other ingredients she needs.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 48 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is single with no dependents. Arlyn is an entrepreneur who has been engaged in operating a convenience store, eatery, refreshment and lodging-house business for 15 years already and earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month doing this type of work. At the present time, he is also an elected Barangay Official in his community. He has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional stock of consumable goods like groceries, meats, beef, chicken, spices, ingredients and drinks for his existing businesses. Arlyn has been a member of PMPC since last year. In the future, Arlyn hopes to expand his refreshment and eatery business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of consumable goods.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Hardworking mother best describes Emma, 43 years old. She is residing in the Poblacion Municipality of Sibutad, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Emma has three children and is married to a carpenter.  The wage that her husband gets isn’t enough to sustain their daily needs in their family. So, Emma started a business, a food stand or “carenderia.” Emma has been in the business for more than a year now. 

Emma wants to expand her food stand business. She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family, especially her children, and she wants to be able to send her son to college. In order for Emma to make her wish possible, she needs 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) additional capital and will use the money to expand her business. She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things that are needed in the food stand. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, and utensils

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 57 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural business raising poultry in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Myrna has been in poultry for one year now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Myrna would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es:
María, invirtió el crédito anterior en los materiales necesario para elaborar los diferentes menús del comedor, con lo que ha tenido un buen resultado ya que tiene  más ganancias, cancelo sus deudas y ha logrado cambiarse de local a uno más amplio, seguro y en mejor zona comercial.
El crédito que está solicitando será de utilidad para comprar carnes, pollo, embutidos, arroz, aceite, verduras, bebidas, gas propano, etc., con los que prepara la comida para la venta y también  mejorara el nuevo local para tener una vistosidad más agradable para sus clientes.
texts.en: María invested her previous loan in the supplies needed to make different food stand meals.  She has had good results, because she has had better earnings, paid off her debts and has managed to move from her stand to one that is larger and safer in a better commercial zone.  The loan that she is asking for will be used to buy meat, chicken, cold cuts, rice, oil, vegetables, drinks, propane gas, etc.  She will use these supplies to make meals to sell, and also to improve her new stand—to make it more colorful and agreeable for her customers.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, cold cuts, rice, oil, vegetables, drinks, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel de 52 años de edad,  es un hombre trabajador, está acompañado, tiene dos hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos estudio tercer grado en la escuela  de su comunidad; su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar ellos dependen directamente de él. Manuel se dedica al servicio de pintura automotriz y también pinta casas, tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, aparte de esto se dedica a la siembra de árboles frutales, también trabaja en la agricultura, esto lo hace todos los días recorre al menos unos cuatro kilómetros de su casa al trabajo.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para  seguir trabajando en la agricultura y en su vivero de plantas que tiene en sus casa,  también comprara abono e insumos. con lo cual pretende que sus ingresos incremente, sus sueños es tener su propia casa, ya que actualmente vive en la casa de un amigo puesto que él no ha podido lograr construir una para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel, 52 years old, is a hard-working man. He is in a relationship. He has two children, of whom one studied until the third grade in the school in his community. His wife is engaged in household chores. They depend directly on him. 

Manuel makes a living from automobile painting and he also paints houses. He has made a living from this activity for more than 20 years. Apart from this, he makes a living from sowing fruit trees. He also works in agriculture. He does this every day. He travels at least some four kilometers from his home to work.

The loan that he is requesting is to continue working in agriculture and in his plant nursery that he has in his home. He will also purchase fertilizer and supplies with which he hopes to increase his income. His dream is to have his own home. He currently lives in the home of a friend since he has not be able to build one for himself and his family.

loans.use: to continue working in agriculture and in his plant nursery that he has in his home, and to also purchase fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Tujikomboe Kitopeni Group

texts.en:
Bosco, who is married, is a father of one schooling boy and is aged in his thirties. He has been a carpenter since 1995, making varieties of furniture. He is also engaged with a roofing activity. Bosco starts business from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. per working day and is able to make a fair profit each month. 

He is requesting for his first credit via Kiva's partner Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this credit to buy business wood for making more furniture. Bosco would like to become a successful person managing a modern carpentry business. 

He will share this credit with his group "Tujikomboe Kitopeni," which consists of seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy wood for making more furniture.

loans.name: Simba Group

texts.en:
Maija is in her 30s, single and has got one school-age daughter. 

Maija is a business woman who has been selling cosmetics and beauty products for two years. She has been involved in the business since she has been depending on herself. She sells door to door, from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly return. 

She is requesting a second loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan (paid back successfully) to restock her business with new products. She managed to resell all her products and earned an extra income that she used to meet her family's welfare costs together with paying school fees for her child. She is now requesting a new credit to replenish her business with new stocks of hair products and cosmetics for selling. Maija desires to manage a frame for her business.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Simba," which consist of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her business with new stocks of hair products and cosmetics for selling.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 56 years old and lives in Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child now at her adult age. 
Esterlita earns a living from her skills and passion in dressmaking. She has also been engaged in the hog-fattening business for seven years already and earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month doing these types of business activities. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing an additional two piglets and sacks of booster feed for her hog fattening business.
Esterlita has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Esterlita hopes to expand her hog fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional two piglets and sacks of booster feed.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with two children. Veronica is 29 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin, Philippines.

Veronica is a farmer and grows coconut crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan to pay for labor cost and land preparation for an expansion of the coconut plantation.
 
Veronica has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Veronica hopes to save more for future consumption.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost and land preparation for the expansion of the coconut plantation

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. At the age of 51 and married, she busies herself to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full-fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative for her capital in supporting her gardening activities. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase more kilos of bananas to sell. In the future, she wishes to become the supplier of bananas in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of bananas to sell

loans.name: Doroteo Jr.

texts.en:
Doroteo Jr. is 37 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is single with no dependents.
Doroteo Jr. has been engaged in farming activities, particularly rice production, for three years already and earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month from doing this type of work. At present, he is also working as a casual utility man in the local government unit of his town. He has requested a loan to be used for financing the labor cost and purchase of commercial fertilizers and sprays. Doroteo Jr. has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Doroteo Jr. hopes to engage in other type of agribusiness.

loans.use: to finance the labor cost and purchase of commercial fertilizers and sprays.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Kris Joy is 24 years old and is third of ten children in the family. Her mother, Josephine, is a member of Project Dungganon-NWTF and supports her family through her buy- and sell- fish business in the Philippines.

Kris Joy is studying for the Bachelor of Science major in Information Technology and is currently in the first year of this four-year course.

Josephine is borrowing Php. 7,879 to pay for the tuition fees of the first year, first semester of her daughter's study. 

When she graduates, Kris Joy plans to help her family and other brother and sister to finish their studies in college.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Berlita

texts.en:
Berlita is 50 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are in school.

She is engaged in an ambulant vending peanut business in the Philippines. Berlita has been doing this for eight years now, and she has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Berlita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanut to sell.

In the future, Berlita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Juvilyn

texts.en:
Juvilyn is 34 years old, married, and has two children.

She earns a living by farming corn and rice in the Philippines. Juvilyn has been farming corn and rice for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Juvilyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° con un esfuerzo enorme, por la situación económica de la familia en ese entonces, es casado con su esposa tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solo una niña vive con ellos, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar mientras que él cultiva maíz, frijol, y también se dedica a la albañilería, a la construcción de casas en la comunidad y el pueblo cercano y en ocasiones viaja a la ciudad a lo del mismo trabajo, él tiene ya 30 años de dedicarse a la agricultura y unos 40 años de dedicarse a la albañilería, manifestó que lo de la agricultura lo aprendió de su padre  y la albañilería por un amigo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  abono, pago de mosos,  compra de fertilizantes, para el cultivo de maíz y frijol, pues cultiva bastante.  Él considera que si se le ayudara mucho, pues no cuenta, con el dinero para realizar los trabajos, sus sueños son mejorar la casa y si es posible construir otras para que sus hijos vivan ahí, también piensa apoyar a su ultima bebe a realizar sus estudios hasta la universidad.
texts.en:
Francisco, 56 years old, studied up to sixth grade;  it took a huge effort given the economic situation of his family at the time. He is married and has 3 children, only one of whom, a daughter, lives with them. His wife takes care of the household chores while he grows corn and beans, and he also works in construction, building houses in the community and the nearby town; he occasionally travels to the city for construction work. He has been working  in agriculture for 30 years and in construction for 40 years. He said that he learned agriculture from his father and masonry from a friend.

The loan he is requesting is to buy manure, pay his employees, and purchase fertilizer to grow corn and beans, of which he grows a lot. He believes that it will be of great help to him, because he doesn’t have the money to do the work. His dreams are to improve his house and, if possible, build other houses so his children can live in them. He also would like to support his last child in her education through university.

loans.use: to buy manure, pay his employees, and purchase fertilizer to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, junto a su compañera de vida son responsables de abastecer a su familia de lo necesario para cubrir sus necesidades básicas, ambos viven en compañía de sus hijos en edades de 25, 23, 18, 15 y 10 años de edad, sus actividades económicas son  la crianza de cerdos y ganado, así mismo también practica  el cultivo de granos básicos. Son oficios que aprendió dentro de su familia, su mayor ventaja es que posee propiedades en las que puede desarrollar estas actividades.
Utilizará el préstamo lo invertirá en compra de abono, plaguicidas, insecticidas, herbicidas y semilla, para sembrar dos hectáreas de maíz, espera lograr una cosecha abundante con la que piensa abastecer su hogar y comercializar otra parte para mejorar su situación familiar.
Su mayor sueño es mantener el apoyo a sus hijos para que culminen sus estudios, brindarles una buena alimentación, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
Francisco, along with his life-partner, is responsible for supplying his family with that which is necessary to cover its basic needs. They both live in the company of their children who are 25, 23, 18, 15, and 10 years old. His economic activities are breeding pork and livestock. He also cultivates basic grains. These are trades that he learned as part of his family. His main advantage is that he owns properties on which he can develop these activities.

He will use the loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizer, pesticides, insecticides, herbicides, and seed to sow two hectares of corn. He hopes to have an abundant harvest with which he is thinking of supplying his home and selling the other part to improve his living situation.

His greatest dreams are to maintain the support of his children so that they finish their studies, and to provide better food, clothing, and health to them.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, insecticides, herbicides, and seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy women’s underwear to sell.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva, 59 years of age, is married and blessed with four children. 

She has owned and managed a rice farm in their village for almost 20 years and earns a net income of PHP 10,000.

Her income from her business was spent on her hog-raising business. Due to insufficient funds on her farming business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides for her farm. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Bebelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Bebelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients for her food production business for her restaurant business.

Bebelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Carolyn is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to purchase recyclable materials needed in her business. She also used the loan in her piggery. Her loan helped not just in her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

She would like to apply for a new 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan for her to buy additional hogs and feeds needed for her business. She will also use the loan in her junk shop. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carolyn dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional hogs and feeds needed in her piggery.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is married with one child. Frank is 58 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Frank grows and cares for pigs to earn a living. He has been doing this for five years. He has requested additional capital to buy additional piglets and feeds.

Frank has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Frank hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Myra Paula is 16 years old. She is the first of five children in the family and a daughter of Pilar, who is a member of Project Dungganon-NWTF. 

Pilar is borrowing 6,897 Philippines pesos to pay for tuition fees of her daughter for the first year/first semester.

Myra Paula is currently in the first year of her four-year Bachelor of Science in Tourism Management course.

When she graduates, Myra Paula plans to help her parents.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various items, including skin lightening soap, shea butter, jewellery, crockery and hair extensions, which will then be resold

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik lives in Karakert village with her family. The family consists of her husband, mother and two teenage children. Astghik works as a nurse in the local kindergarten. Because of a low salary, she has always been forced to look for other revenue sources. In particular, she has been engaged in farming and animal husbandry for many years. Jointly with her family, Astghik keeps cattle and cultivates corn, apricots and grapes. 

The family is now planning to expand its agribusiness a little bit. Astghik has applied for a loan of USD 3,000 to buy 1 hectare of agricultural land. Astghik and her husband try really hard to take care of their children and Astghik's mother, who is a 67-year-old pensioner. Let's help them expand their agribusiness and make their lives more comfortable.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land (1 hectare)

loans.name: Salvadora

texts.en:
Due to financial hardship, Salvadora has been engaged in a hog-raising business to earn additional income. She is 34 years old, married and has two schooling children. She and her husband are aiming for a successful life in order to educate their children and give them a bright future. 

With this regard, Salvadora wants to improve the business and make it more profitable. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy hog feeds, vitamins and more piglets to raise. She believes that this loan will be a great help for her to further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins and more piglets to raise

location.town: Brgy. Sto.Domingo West, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline is 40 years old and married to James. They are blessed with six children between the ages of 18 and 6.  

For the last six years, Roseline has run a general store to sell assorted household items and consumable products to her customers.  She earns an income of 30,000 KES per month.

She has applied for 7,846 KES to buy solar lamps and modern jikos.  The anticipated profits will pay school fees for her children.

She desire to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy solar lamps and modern jikos for sale.

loans.name: Dufatanye Group

texts.en:
Esperance is 48 years old and a mother eight children. 

She is the group leader of Dufatanye CB which means "let's work together". The group members have different businesses and they wish to increase their inventory. Experance sells clothes and has been in the business for five years. With the loan, she wants to buy more clothes to sell. She will use the profits to provide for the family.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Sokhim, 36, lives in a rural village ing Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Cambodia. She is married and has three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. For the last 18 years, Sokhim has been growing cassava on two hectare of farmland. She can earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Sokhim is just with VisionFund for this cycle, and now she is applying for a loan to pay for buying fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to pay for buying fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Al- Alhan Group

texts.en:
Al- Alhan is a group comprised of five women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB.

Jamila is the leader of the group. She is a 34-year-old married woman with one child. She has an elementary education, but couldn't complete her studies. 

Her husband is the family's breadwinner  and she is a housewife.  They live with her family in their own house. His income is not enough to cover all the family's expenses. Jamila decided to help him meet the household expenses. 

Their house lacks of many food materials which negatively affects their life. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB  to purchase food materials for her house.

Jamila looks forward to providing her house with all kinds of foods materials in order to secure a future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase food for her household.

loans.name: Al Shames Group

texts.en:
Ibtikar is the featured borrower of Al Shames group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends and they are seeking the best for their families' living development.

Ibtikar is a 37-year-old married mother of four, who has been running her grocery store for 14 years, to support her beloved husband who works as a blacksmith and a van driver in covering their increasing family needs.

Ibtikar is a hard worker with a very good reputation in her region. Her loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with special released summer beverages and offered products to satisfy customers needs and increase her sales.

She hopes that in the future she can expand her working place and diversify her displayed products.

She is the lady on the left side of the picture with the yellow top, as for the other group members, Basima is at the center, and Suzan is on the right.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special released summer beverages and offered products to satisfy customers needs and increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs (fertilizers) for her crops.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio,41, is married to a government employee and they are blessed with three children. He has managed a farm in their village for almost fifteen years and earns a net income of  80,000 PHP. 

Due to insufficient funds, he would like to request 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and insecticides for his farm. He's hoping that his farm will become more productive.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and insecticides for his farm.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her business. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her child. Her income from business assists with their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan to buy slippers, undergarments, umbrellas, and blankets. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ofelia dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to give her family a better future. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase slippers, undergarments, umbrellas, and blankets needed in her business.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie is 45 years old, married, and has children. He has earned an income through a variety store business within his community in Coron Palawan, Philippines for ten years. He and his wife work hard to provide for the everyday needs of their family. Ronnie’s family was affected by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. He has restarted his business and is committed to regain what they lost.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

Due to limited funds, Ronnie wants to make his business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, he would like to borrow 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. He is hoping that he will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Ronnie hopes to expand his business and to send his children to school and provide them with a better future. He meets weekly with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 44 years old and single. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Alma has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from candle making.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Aiperi

texts.ru: Айпери 23 года, замужем, детей нет, но в ближайшее время планируют. У Айпери среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, вместе с супругом занимаются полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад с суммы 5,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду, Айпери на сегодняшний день имеет 1 теленка и 10 овец, прибыль от бизнеса составляет 5,000 сом в месяц (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айпери обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Айпери планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Aiperi is 23, married and has no children yet, though she is planning to in the near future. She has a secondary education and plants crops and raises livestock with her husband as the family's main source of income. She started farming 5 years ago with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Aiperi now has one calf and ten sheep and earns 5,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her business, she applied for a loan with Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep. She plans to use her profits to continue investing in and developing her business.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Phun Rin Group

texts.en: Rin is 37 years old, a farmer and a married woman with three children. All her children are students. Her husband is a farmer, too. They all live in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. They can earn approximately $11 per day. Now she would like to apply for a loan of 8,000,000 KHR as a group of four members to build latrines. This loan will help her live in a better condition. In the future, she is going to buy a Tuk Tuk (a motor with a trailer)  for her husband to run in Phnom Penh City, renovate her house and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to build a new latrine

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 41 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Helen operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. She sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, cooking oil, biscuits, candies, etc. 
 
Helen requested a loan from NWTF for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional items such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, cooking oil, biscuits, candies, etc. to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, cooking oil, biscuits, candies, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, poison and manure.

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
Ry, a local farmer from Battambang province, is 50 years old and a married mother blessed with four children; one attends school. 

She meets her daily cost of living by farming five hectares of rice and working another job. This is the third loan for Ry with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her previous loan and it enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle. 

She requests a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) by forming a group of three.  As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy potash and to pay for plowing. She believes that she can gain improve her yield.

loans.use: to buy potash and to pay plowing fees.

loans.name: Channe

texts.en:
Channe is 28 years old and a villager from Kampong Cham province. She has three dependent children  and struggles to make a  living growing rice.  She also works at a construction site. She has had this business for 8 years. 

This is not the original loan for Channe with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her previous loan and it has enabled her to gradually improve her lifestyle. 

She requests a new loan to buy a decent motorbike to commute to her work. She hopes this this purchase will cut travel costs so that she can use that money to support her children instead.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to commute to work.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Salah Al-Den Group

texts.en:
Salah Al-Den is a group which comprises four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 110,000 YER from AMB.

Sabria is the leader of the group. She is a 43-year-old married woman with six children. Her oldest child is 25 years old and the youngest one is 8 years old. She has a university education and now she is a teacher. Her husband has been an immigrant in Saudi Arabia for many years. Her salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. The house where she lives with her children lacks many food items. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food items for her house.

Sabria looks forward to providing her house with all kinds of food items.

loans.use: to purchase food items for her house.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 41-year-old married mother of two who opened her own housewares shop in 2012. She supports her husband who specializes in concrete work.  Together, they try to cover their family's increasing needs and requests.

Abir is a hard worker and has three years of experience.  She is well known in her region for her encouraging prices and good quality products.

Abir requests her first loan cycle from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special items that will attract customers' attention and increase her selling.

She looks forward to reciving this loan and hopes to use the increased income to educate her children.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special items that will attract customers' attention, and increase her selling.

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a 54-year-old married mother of seven children, who has been working in the business of selling clothes for eleven years. She opened her present clothes selling shop in 2009.

Salwa works hard to develop her business and increase her income in order to cover her children's expenses, while her husband is working abroad in order to provide his family members with a good standard of living.

Salwa is applying for her second loan cycle from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection. She hopes to keep on increasing and developing her business in a well managed way so that she can continue to respond to both her customers' and her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special summer collection.

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es:
Evelio siempre se ha desempeñado como vendedor ambulante de frutas, hace 30 años tiene su negocio y manifiesta una profunda pasión por esta actividad.
El trabaja todos los días a partir de las 6:00 am y se esfuerza mucho con el afán de brindarle un sustento a su familia que depende únicamente de esta actividad.
Hoy en día tiene algunos clientes fijos que le hacen compras semanales, este es su pilar fundamental.
El solicita un auxilio económico para la realizar la compra de surtido de frutas de distintas clases, de este modo podrá tener un inventario más amplio para ofrecer a su clientes y mejorar sus ventas.
Su mayor sueño es tener un local en el que pueda vender sus productos y así tener unas utilidades más estables.
texts.en:
Evelio has always been a fruit street vendor. For 30 years he has had his business and he exhibits a profound passion for this activity. 

He works every day from 6:00 am and he works hard in an effort to provide a livelihood for his family who depend solely on this activity.

Currently, he has some regular customers who buy from him weekly, this is his mainstay.
 
He is requesting financial assistance to make the purchase a supply of fruits of various kinds, and thus have a large inventory to offer his customers and improve his sales.

His greatest dream is to have a store where he can sell his products and have more stable earnings.

loans.use: to buy stock for his business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Patricia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Patricia is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Patricia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her pay educational fees.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 39 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, noodles, sanitary pads, diapers, etc.

Lourdes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn is a 37-year-old mother of three dependent children from Kampong Cham province. 

She meets her daily cost of living by growing cassava and rice. She can earn up to 35,000 KHR per day.  She has farmed for 17 years. 

Horn, an eight-time borrower, formed a two-member group to get a new loan VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her previous loan and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle. 

As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing fees and labor cost, and to buy rice and insecticide. She believes that the yield will be better than before.  She plans to earn more income to keep her children.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee and labor cost, and buy rice seed and insecticide.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 42-year-old married mother of four, who opened her own bakery in 2011.  She has fifteen years of experience.

Samira is a hard worker with a very good reputation in her region. She is well known for her special baked traditional Saj bread and Manakish, and is recommended by most of her customers.

Samira works hard to develop her business, but her and her husband's income isn't enough to take this step forward.

They use their incomes to cover the family's needs. 

Samira requests her first loan from KIva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a bigger oven which is necessary to increase the amount of baked products to sell.

She works hard to move her bakery a larger place and recruit someone to help her in the future.

loans.use: to buy a bigger oven to  increase her baked products.

loans.name: Paula Emilia

texts.es: Paula Emilia mayor de edad casada con seis hijos los cuales todos son independientes, originaria de una de las comarcas de Chinandega ubicada al norte del occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, lechera, ganadera, Paula es una microempresaria y administradora de sus propio negocio el cual consiste en la venta de refrescos naturales como: ensaladas de frutas, pitaya, remolacha, leche con bananos, pozol, semilla con leche, granadias, papayas, calalas, mamón, melón, chilla con tamarindo, naranjas entre otros tambien ofrece a sus clientes deliciosas enchiladas, tacos, tajadas, las cuales las ofrece en una de las terminales de este municipio, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados y distribuidoras de esta localidad al igual que a agricultores de la zona que le ofrecen las frutas mas frescas, tambien vende hielo, popsicles, gelatinas, gaseosas, jugos entre otros, sus ventas son al contado tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano y poder lograr a los clientes que viajan desde muy oscuro a sus centros de trabajos, gracias a la buena atención que les ofrece a sus clientes es que tiene mayor demanda de sus productos, uno de sus sueños es poder seguir mejorando su casa de habitación y crecer mas en su negocio,con los ingresos de sus negocio logro sacar adelante a su familia, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de materia prima como:pajillas, bolsas, carnes, pollo, tortillas, aceite, azúcar, sal, variedades de frutas naturales, leche, palillos, crema, repollo, salsas de tomates, cebollas, entre otros. Paula agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece  a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en: Paula Emilia is an older woman who is married with six children, and all are independent.  She is originally from the region of Chinandega located in the Northeastern part of the country, a zone known for its productive commerce, milking cows, and livestock.  Paula is a micro-entrepreneur and administrator of her own business which consists of fresh natural juices made from things like fruit salad mix, dragon fruit (pitaya), cabbage, banana milk, a corn drink (pool), milk seed, pomegranate, papaya, sliced up fruit bits (calala), mamey (mamón), melons, chili with tamarind, oranges, and other things that she offers her customers such as delicious enchiladas, tacos, slices of ripe plantain (tajadas), which she offers in one of the markets in her town.  Her shopping is done in bulk in markets and distributors in the area as well as from farmers in the regions that offer fresh fruit.  She also sells ice, pop cycles, jello, sodas, juices and other items.  Her sales are made in cash, and she has regular clients.  She begins working very early in order to serve customers who travel from first light to their jobs.  Thanks to the good attention she pays to her customers, there is great demand for her products.  One of her dreams it to be able to continue improving her house and to grow her business.  With the income from her business she wants to help her family get ahead.  Her objective with this new loan is to invest in capital in order to purchase raw materials like straws, bags, meats, chicken, tortilla, oil, sugar, salt, a variety of fresh fruits, stir sticks, creme, cabbage, tomato sauces, onions, and other items.  Paula is thankful for the support of Kiva investors who offer help to people of lesser means.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like straws, bags, meats, chicken, tortilla, oil, sugar, salt, a variety of fresh fruits, stir sticks, creme, cabbage, tomato sauces, onions, and other items.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 34 years old and has been blessed with two children.She has run a restaurant for the last four years and makes a monthly income of 15,000 KES which she uses to support her family.

She has applied for 35,000 KES from Visionfund Kenya and will use the entire loan amount to buy a food mixer for use in the restaurant.

Christine plans to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a food mixer.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and two go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She operates a clinic on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for the last four years. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy cough syrups, malaria tablets and vaccines. Her major challenges include seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a fridge to store medicine. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, tablets and syrups

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa previously acquired 12,000 PHP  which she used to buy materials needed in her tailoring business. It has helped her to produce more items which provided a bigger income.  Her earnings helped to educate her children and pay for personal, house hold, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 9,000 PHP loan to buy fabric, needles, thread, cloth and other materials. Her profits will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nimfa dreams to have more customers and hopes to have a better future. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God as that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Hovhannes

texts.en:
Hovhannes lives in Yerevan with his wife and two sons. 

Hovhannes’s younger son Khachatur (who is 18 years old) studies at Armenian Medical University. He is currently in his second year of study in the dental department. Hovhannes works hard to be able to cover his family's basic costs and provide appropriate living conditions for family members. 

Because of financial difficulties that the family is currently facing, it is very difficult for Hovhannes to save money for his son's education. This is the reason Hovhannes asks for this loan. With the help of the loan, he will be able to cover Khachatur’s university tuition. 

It is also worth mentioning that the previous loan that Hovhannes had taken for the same purpose was a huge support for him and his family.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.ru: Фатиме 60 лет, замужем, все дети самостоятельные и проживают отдельно. У Фатимы среднее образование, много лет она проработала в больнице. С 2002 года Фатима занимается  сельским хозяйством, разводит скот, но преимущественно занимается полеводством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 6 коров, 20 овец и 2 лошади, также земельный надел размером 3,0 ГА, где в основном выращивает фасоль, картофель и многолетнюю траву. Реализуя свою продукцию оптовым покупателям. Также продает молоко местным жителям.  Фатима известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день деятельность Фатимы приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 6,500 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Фатима обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений и обработку земли. Доходы от кредита Фатима планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена отремонтировать дом в будущем.
texts.en: Fatima is 60 years old and married. All of her children are self-sufficient and live independently. Fatima has a secondary education. For many years, she worked in a hospital. Since 2002, Fatima has been practicing agriculture and raising cattle, but she primarily practices crop farming. She has 6 cows, 20 sheep and 2 horses on her farm, as well as a 3.0 hectare plot of land on which she primarily grows beans, potatoes and perennial grasses. She sells her crops to wholesale distributors. She also sells milk to local residents. Fatima is known as a principled, honest, respectable and dependable person. Currently, Fatima's business brings in a monthly profit of 6,500 som (KGS). For the further development of her farm, Fatima turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS). The loan enables her to purchase mineral fertilizers and till her land. Fatima plans to use the earnings from the loan to develop her farm. She is also determined to renovate her home in the future.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers to till her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her clothing business.

loans.name: Reina Dinora

texts.es:
Reina de 24 años de edad, es ama de casa, estudió hasta el bachillerato, luego decidió acompañarse y ahora es madre de un hijo de tres años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida, su mamá y sus hermanos, su compañero de vida se dedica a la construcción mientras que ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo desde hace un año lo hace en el horario de 3:00 pm a 5:00 pm, también se dedica a la siembra de maíz junto con sus hermanos, en el horario de 6:00 am a 11:00 am, trabajo que aprendió con ayuda de su madre.

El préstamo que esta solicitando Reina en CREDICAMPO, es para la compra de insumos agrícolas como dos litros de veneno, semilla y abono, para obtener un poco mas de ingresos y darle a su hijo todo lo que necesite.

El sueño de Reina es pagar el crédito sin ningún inconveniente para quedar bien con la institución, darle a su hijo la oportunidad que se prepare para que sea un profesional y llegar a tener 10 vacas lecheras para obtener aun mas ingresos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Reina is a 24 year old housewife. She completed her Secondary studies and decided to enter into a relationship. Now she is the mother of a 3 year old boy. She lives with her life companion, her mother and her siblings. Her life companion works in construction while she has been working selling products from catalogs for the past year. She works from 3 pm until 5 pm. She also grows corn together with her siblings from 6 am until 11 am, work that she learned with the help of her mother.

The loan that Reina is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy agricultural inputs like two liters of poison, seeds and fertilizer so she can generate a little more income and provide her child with all that he needs. Reina's dream is to pay off the loan without problems so she can stay in good standing with the institution. She wants to give her son the opportunity to study to become a professional. She would like to own 10 milk cows to obtain even more income and provide a better quality of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy two liters of poison, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Riya

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Riya is 43 years old and married with two children. 

For more than several years, she has been growing cassava to make a living on one hectare of farmland, while her husband is a classical Khmer musician in a local area. Together, they can earn about KHR 57,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 20,000 each day for their future needs. 

This is the first loan for Riya with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. This loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her rice farming production, to make more cassava, and to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra began her business providing hairdressing service approximately 10 years ago.

When she found herself without a job and desperate not knowing what to do, she met a man who introduced her to the hairdressing business.

Now, this man is her husband and they have managed to have a marriage with three children. The business still exists and is very productive but she wants to expand it to make it much bigger and more profitable. For this reason, she asked for a loan to purchase hair relaxers, wigs, spray and shampoo, so that she can serve her customers better.

This loan will allow her to increase her capital and generate more income for her family, offering them a better quality of life and a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase hair relaxers, wigs, spray and shampoo.

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en:
Rabab is a 32-year-old married mother of five who has sold Hookahs since 2012.  This shop enables her to support her husband and increase their income to cover the family's increasing needs.

Rabab loves smoking Hookahs and  that is  why she has a successful business. She requests a loan to increase her Hookah inventory with special released collections that will attract customers' attention.

She works hard to develop her business.  She might rent another shop and start  selling charcoal.

loans.use: to purchase Hookahs.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia, is a 58-year-old single woman. She owns and manages a rice farm  in her village and earns 20,000 PHP. 

Her net income  is spent on her hog raising business. Due to insufficient capital, she would like 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and insecticide for her farm. She's hoping that her farm will continue to grow and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and insecticide for her farm.

loans.name: Laheb Group

texts.en:
Laheb is a group which is comprised of five members of women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB.

Ashowk is the leader of the group. She is a 44-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 24-years-old and the youngest one is 8-years-old. She is an uneducated woman but has an economic mind. Ashowk's husband is an employee in the public sector with a small salary. Due to his small salary, his family has an economic crisis most days. So, Ashowk wants to help him with the expenses and she wants to improve the living standards of the family.  For this reason, she applied for a loan of  30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials for her house.

Ashowk looks forward to preparing her house with all kinds of food materials in order to save a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase food materials for her house.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is 43-years-old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Haydee works very hard to provide for them.

Haydee runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like biscuits, cooking oil, candies, soft drinks, toothpaste, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell.

Haydee has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, cooking oil, candies, soft drinks, toothpaste, sugar, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Haydee would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional items like biscuits, cooking oil, candies, soft drinks, toothpaste, sugar, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is 26-year-old married woman who lives with her family in Ajloun, Jordan.

She started a home-based business last year to buy and sell blankets.  This business helps to support her husband earn a family income. 

She requests a loan to buy more quantities and varieties of blankets.

loans.use: to buy more quantities and varieties of blankets.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 49-years-old and married with six children.

She earns a living through a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Virginia has been in pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and plant nappier grass.

loans.name: Nyomo Baa Fe Group

texts.en:
Nyomo Baa Fe (God will provide) is a group of two persons whose members live in the same neighborhood. The representative for the group, Mary (on the right) is 50 years old and is married with children.

Mary has had little schooling but for fourteen years, has run a business to sell bags and wax-prints. She gets her supplies from one of Ghana's markets.

In their quest to satisfy her customers, the Nyomo Baa Fe group requests a fifth loan. This loan will help them respond better to customer requests and make more profits. 

All previous loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy  bags and wax-prints.

loans.name: Al Afaf Group

texts.en:
Randa is the featured borrower of Al Afaf group. Because they have always been neighbors and friends, she joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua.

Randa is a 44-year-old married woman, who has been working in embroidery and crafts business for ten years. Her business is going just well enough to cover her family's needs, but needs an additional external push to financially cover any unexpected issues. For this reason, her acquired loan will be invested in performing necessary maintenance on her house to keep it a healthy living place, since she can't afford to take the requested amount directly from her business.

Randa is the second lady from the left side in the picture. As for the other group members, Amal is to the far left side wearing jeans, Warda is the second from the right with a veil covering her hair and Houda is on the far right side of the picture.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance on her house to keep it a healthy living place.

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en:
Tahani, age 38, sells accessories to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for the past seven years, selling her wares from her home in order to supplement her husband's income while also taking care of the family. She and her husband have four children.
 
Tahani is an Iraqi citizen living and working in Lebanon.
 
She is requesting a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua to buy newly-released accessories and cosmetics collections. This will allow her to expand her business and increase her income. 

Her previous loan helped her significantly in increasing her business capital. 

In the future, she hopes to open her own separate shop, where she can diversify and sell her products more widely.

loans.use: to buy newly-released accessories and cosmetics collections to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to equip his tailor business with basic materials and to perform maintenance on his sewing machines.

loans.name: Tukomboane Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a businesswoman and a mother of three children; two attend school. She is not married and supports her family by running a beauty salon.
