She services people from 10 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair profit each month. Mwajuma starts her business later because she is not able to hire a house-girl/helper who can help with home activities. She has a small child who needs to be cared for before Mwajuma goes to work. She has been in this service for five years.

Mwajuma requests a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this credit to improve her salon service with new hair products. She dreams of improving her business and living a better life.

Mwajuma will share this loan with her loan group" Tukomboane" which totals eleven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable  to repay the loan.

loans.use: to improve her salon service with new hair products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear merchandise such as clothes and shoes as well as cosmetics to offer for sale

loans.name: Tahseen

texts.en:
Tahseen, age 25, is employed in a local company in his community and makes a very low wage. This income is barely enough to cover the basic family needs. He lives with his wife and their four sons in Rafah.

Tahseen requested a Murabaha loan from FATEN in order to buy a water purification machine for his home. The loan will allow Tahseen to provide clean water for his family. He is glad that he and his wife will have access to clean water, but is even happier to be able to offer this benefit to his children.
 
In the future, he would like to improve his family's living conditions and be able to afford the items required to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Hanzada

texts.en:
Hanzada, age 24, is employed as a pharmacist. She is a Palestinian refugee. She completed her university studies five years ago, but at present she cannot afford to open her own pharmacy. She is expecting a child, and she and her husband are both working hard to develop their living in order to make sure that their baby will have a fruitful future, with better prospects than their own. 

At present, their combined income is not enough to cover Hanzada's upcoming hospital needs. She is therefore requesting a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua. She will use her loan funds to cover hospital costs for the birth of her baby.
 
She is working hard to establish her own business. She also intends to open a clothes shop in the future.

loans.use: to cover hospital costs for the birth of her baby

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has four children and lives in Kisii, Kenya. She has been farming for the past three years. She sells milk and eggs and raises crops. Through farming she has been able to earn a decent income and provide the basic needs for her family.

Rose requested a loan for 10,400 KES, which she will use to buy a dairy cow and increase the number that she currently has so that she can meet the demand for milk. With the profits, she will provide a secure and comfortable life for her four children. Rose's biggest dream is to see her children have a good future and to impact the society positively.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Ana tiene 34 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, su hijo de 3 años de edad y su hija de 12 años de edad. Ana tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la venta de antojitos típicos como: yuca frita, pasteles de carne, papas fritas y fruta. Este negocio es el que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Ana solicita este crédito a FUSIA para  comprar los materiales necesarios para terminar el muro frente a su vivienda. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, hierro, etc. para enrejar el muro y así poder dar mayor seguridad a su familia y proteger sus pocas pertenencias.
texts.en:
Ana, age 34, lives in her own house with her life partner, her three year old son, and her 12 year old daughter.  Ana has been selling typical snacks such as fried yucca, meat pies, French fries, and fruit for eight years.  This business is what allows her to bring sustenance to her household and to give her family better living conditions.

Ana is requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy the materials needed to finish the wall in front of her house.  She will use the requested loan to buy cement, sand, and iron, etc. in order to finish the wall.  This way she will be able to give her family greater security and protect their few belongings.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building a wall in front of her house.

loans.name: Sikola

texts.en:
Sikola runs a restaurant business in a rented space at the local market. She works six days a week and has operated her business for the last six years. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality.

Sikola lives with her husband and their two children in Kampala. Both the children attend school. She also helps to support two additional family members. The family lives in a house that does not have access to electricity or piped water. Sikola's primary monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use her loan funds to buy bunches of green bananas as well as rice, beef, chicken, beans, and cooking oil. 

Her goal is to see her children educated to the university level.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas as well as rice, beef, chicken, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood, crates and barrels, which will be resold

loans.name: Kutbiya

texts.ru: Кутбия, 21 год, не замужем, детей нет. У Кутбии среднее образование и с детства она занимается сельским хозяйством. Стартовав с 40 000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день она имеет очень хорошее хозяйство: 1 дойная корова с теленком, 20 овец. На своем земельном участке, Кутбия ежегодно сажает кукурузу, возделывая ее самостоятельно. Также реализует молочную продукцию. Прибыль от деятельности Кутбии составляет примерно 20 000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 45 000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений и дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита Кутбия планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества скота, а также она мечтает накопить средства и провести свою большую и веселую свадьбу.
texts.en: Kutbiya is 21 years old, unmarried and does not have any children. Kutbiya has a secondary education. She has been practicing farming since childhood. Starting her business with 40,000 som (KGS), she currently has 1 dairy cow with a calf and 20 sheep on her farm. Kutbiya also sows corn every year on her plot of land. She cultivates the land all by herself. She also sells dairy products. Kutbiya's profits from these businesses are around 20,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of the further development of her business, she turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She requested a loan for 45,000 som (KGS) to buy mineral fertilizers and a milk cow. Kutbiya plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of cattle. She also dreams of saving money to throw herself a large and happy wedding reception.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing environmentally-friendly vegetables and to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sabougnouman 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  SABOUGNOUMAN 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAPALA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso.
La spéculation cultivée est d’arachide avec madame MAMOU assise à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SABOUGNOUMAN 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 30 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 36 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Sabougnouman 4 groups are married women averaging 28 years of age, with two children. They mainly live in traditional families in Kapala, a township in the district of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their first agricultural loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

They grow peanuts, which is what Mrs. Mamou does, for example. She is the second one seated from left to right in the group photo.
With her loan, she plans to buy 30 kg [66 lbs] of fertilizers, 1 jug of herbicide and pay the cost of labor to work 0.25 ha [0.5 acres] of land.
She plans to earn an average of 36,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, herbicide and the cost of labor.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer de 40 años de edad casada y sin hijos.
Su vida la comparte con su esposo y juntos se encargan de la elaboración de quesos y derivados lácteos. Ellos residen en ‘Machaca marca’, es una comunidad del altiplano boliviano, el clima del lugar es bastante árido, en el día los rayos solares caen muy fuerte sobre el área y de noche el frío congela los pastizales que come el ganado. Aún de esta manera los pobladores del lugar se dedican a la ganadería y comercio de animales. Lidia es experta en la elaboración de quesos, su producción siempre sobresale del resto ya que la dedicación que le otorga es completa, ella desea incrementar sus ingresos aumentando su producción para lograr esa meta necesita comprar ganado vacuno lechero. Su sueño lo comparte con su esposo y es mejorar su calidad de vida para completar su familia y tener hijos.
Es por esos motivos que Lidia solicita un préstamo para la compra de vacas lecheras para aumentar su producción de quesos.
texts.en: Lidia is a 40 year old woman and is married with no children. She shares her life with her husband and together they make cheese and dairy products. They live in Machaca marca, a community in the Bolivian high plateau. The climate of the place is rather arid; in the daytime the sun's rays fall very strong on the area and at night the cold freezes the pasture that the cows eat. Even so, the inhabitants of the place work in cattle and in animal businesses. Lidia is an expert in cheesemaking. Her products always stand out from the rest and the dedication she puts into it is complete. She wants to increase her income by augmenting her production, and to achieve this goal she needs to buy dairy cows. Her dream, which she shares with her husband, is to improve their quality of life to complete the family and have children. It is for these reasons that Lidia requests a loan for the purchase of dairy cows to augment her cheese production.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows to augment her cheese production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for his home.

loans.name: Kuluypa

texts.ru: Кулуйпе 59 лет, вдова, мать троих детей. Кулуйпа на протяжении многих лет занимается полеводством, стартовав в далеком 1980 году. Благодаря упорному труду, Кулуйпа на сегодняшний день имеет прибыль 15,000 сом (KGS)в месяц от продажи произведенных исключительно ручным трудом продуктов. На своем участке мерою 1,018 ГА она выращивает помидоры, арбузы, также осенью продает грецкие орехи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулуйпа обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений для обработки земли. Кулуйпа планирует получить хороший урожай и увеличить прибыль от реализации сельскохозяйственной продукции, также часть средств потратит на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Кулуйпа планирует вложить в открытие столовой, она давно хотела заняться общепитом, тем более, что продукты выращивает самостоятельно. Кулуйпа считает, что эта деятельность будет очень прибыльной.
texts.en: Kuluypa is 59 years old. She is a widow and the mother of three. For many years, Kuluypa has been growing farm produce, having started all the way back in 1980. Thanks to Kuluypa’s hard work, at present she earns a revenue of 15,000 KGS per month from selling her produce. Her farm relies exclusively on manual labor. At her land plot of 1.018 ha [2.5 acres], Kulypa grows tomatoes and watermelons; in the fall, she also sells walnuts. In order to develop her business further, Kuluypa has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 80,000 KGS to buy mineral fertilizers for treating her land. Kuluypa plans to obtain a good harvest and increase her revenue from selling farm produce; she also will spend part of the money to buy livestock. Kuluypa plans to invest her resulting revenues into a new diner. She has been planning to go into the restaurant business for some time now, especially since she grows her own produce. Kulypa believes that this business will bring excellent revenues.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing environmentally friendly products and to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Magaret

texts.en:
Margret sells fruits and vegetables to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for four years, and she works six days per week. Her major challenges include seasonality and the perishable nature of her products.

Margret lives in Kampala with her husband and their five children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. The family lives in a house that has access to electricity and piped water. Margret's primary monthly expenses include school fees.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO. She will use her loan funds to buy tomatoes, onions, oranges, passion fruits, and watermelons to offer for sale. 

Her aspiration is to buy coolers for some of her fruits so that she can keep them fresh.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, oranges, passion fruits, and watermelons to offer for sale

loans.name: Beauty3 Group

texts.en:
Apple Grace is the featured borrower of Beauty3 group. She has come along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been best friends since they arrived in Lebanon. They came here to work as housekeepers, after they left their hometowns in the Philippines seeking work with a better income.

Apple Grace is a 25-year-old single lady who works hard for her living, and to support her parents, too. Her share of the loan will be invested in making necessary maintenance to her house back in Philippines, to keep it a healthy living place.

Apple Grace is the first lady at the far right side of the picture, with a blue top. As for the other group members, Estela is the first on the left, while Mirriam is the lady at the center of the picture.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance to her house

loans.name: Peter Jeremy

texts.es:
Peter proviene de un hogar de padres separados, el vive solo con su madre en el populoso distrito de Comas en Lima. Ella a sido padre y madre para el debido a que su padre los abandono y nunca a aportado económicamente para el sostenimiento del hogar.
Su madre trabaja de costurera eventualmente en distintos talleres y a sabido sacar adelante con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio a su hijo, dándole una educación hasta donde le a sido posible, lamentablemente ahora esta pasando por un mal tiempo y no puede financiar mas los estudios de Peter, por lo que tendrá que dejar sus estudios técnicos para comenzar a laborar de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
El desea terminar sus estudios en mecatronica automotriz y tener en un futuro un taller propio donde pueda dar trabajo a jóvenes como el deseosos de aprender y salir adelante, por esto es que esta muy agradecido con todo el apoyo que pudieran brindarle los prestamistas de Kiva para continuar sus estudios y hacer de su sueño una realidad.
El quiere devolver todo el sacrificio que a realizado su madre por ayudarlo, ayudarla económicamente y darle una vida digna.
texts.en:
Peter comes from a broken home and lives alone with his mother in the populous Comas district of Lima. She has been both father and mother to him since Peter's father abandoned them and never financially contributed to support their home. 

His mother works as a seamstress in various workshops, and she has managed to get ahead with great effort and sacrifice for her son, giving him an education as far as possible. Unfortunately, she is now going through a bad time and can no longer finance Peter's studies. Without the support of Kiva lenders, Peter will have to give up his technical studies.

He wishes to finish his studies of automotive mechanics and to have his own workshop in the future, where he can provide work for young people like him who are eager to learn and get ahead. This is why he is very grateful for all the support that Kiva lenders can provide for him to continue his studies and make his dream a reality.

He wants to pay back his mother for all the sacrifices she has made to help him, to help her financially, and to give her a decent life.

loans.use: to pay for his technical studies in automotive mechanics

loans.name: Hudsun

texts.en: Hudsun is a 53-year-old married man, who lives with his family in Baqaa, Jordan. He retired over five years ago, and because of the needs of life he decided to open a small grocery shop near his house. In this way he supports his family's living conditions. Now he is seeking a loan, which will to help him to buy more foodstuffs to sell at the store.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for the grocery store

loans.name: Gloria Ines

texts.es:
La señora Gloria se inició como vendedora de comidas rápidas hace unos años pero con esfuerzo, gana y humildad logro el alquiler de un local el cual quiere comenzar a trabajar y darse a conocer en el pueblo pues cambiara de aires en busca de oportunidades para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
Solicita un crédito para surtir su nuevo sitio de trabaja comprando bebidas, y materia prima para la elaboración de sus comidas desde panes, carnes, verduras, salsas para la elaboración de sus comidas.
El crédito será de gran ayuda pues será la oportunidad de empezar su negocio de la mejor manera con surtido y bebidas para satisfacer a sus clientes siendo su principal reto fidelizar los clientes para generar los recursos necesarios para llevar una alimentación y un buen estilo de vida a sus tres hijos
texts.en:
Gloria got started as a fast food vendor some years ago, but with effort, enthusiasm and humility has managed to rent a sales outlet where she wants to begin working and become known in the neighborhood, as she will try something new, in search of opportunities for improving her family's quality of life.

She is requesting a loan in order to stock her new work location, by buying drinks and ingredients for making her fast foods such as bread rolls, meats, vegetables and salsas for making her dishes.

The loan will be a great help as it give her the opportunity to begin her business in the best way, with supplies and drinks for satisfying her customers.  Her main challenge is building customer loyalty in order to generate the necessary resources for providing a healthy diet and a good standard of living for her three children.

loans.use: To buy drinks and ingredients for making fast food.

loans.name: Maa Dukuri Group

texts.en:
Urmila, aged about 50 years, is the group leader of a twelve-member group of Basumatipur village, near Bhawanipatna town, situated in Kalahandi district of Odisha state in India. Her family comprises five members: her husband, one son and two daughters. The member standing third from the left with a raised hand in the first row is Urmila. She is a very active lady who wants some extra income out of her own efforts.

At present, she is doing a sweets business in her locality with the support of her husband. She, along with the other eleven members from her village, formed a group. It is the first time they will take a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses. 

At present, the family income of Urmila is about Rs. 9,000 per month, which is not sufficient to maintain the family. 

From the loan amount, she will purchase milk and milk products, such as cheese and paneer, as well as sugar, kaju, kismis, saffron, coconut, oil and other sweets-making items. She is having a desire to establish a hotel in her locality.

The other eleven members are doing a tea stall, betel shop, grocery shop, tailoring, milk business, vegetable vending, utensil business and tent house business.

loans.use: to purchase milk and milk products, such as cheese and paneer, as well as sugar, kaju, kismis, saffron, coconut, oil and other sweets-making items

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 54 года, вдова, имеет 4 детей. Гульмира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхозкультур – кукурузы, арбузов, хлопка на собственном земельном участке мерою 1,53 ГА. Начав свой бизнес в 1980 году, на сегодняшний день кроме развитого полеводческого бизнеса в ее хозяйстве есть 2 лошади, 2 коровы, 10 овец. Продажа молока и молочных продуктов, а также экологически чистых продуктов частным покупателям  приносит в месяц около(KGS) 20,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку селитры для обработки земли, а также приобретения двух дойных коров для увеличения прибыли от реализации молока. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, а также постройку большого сарая для скота.
texts.en: Gulmira is 54 years old, a widow, and has 4 children. As the main source of income for her family, Gulmira practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She grows corn, watermelons, and cotton on her 1.53 hectare plot of land. Starting her business in 1980, she currently has 2 horses, 2 cows and 10 sheep on her farm in addition to her highly developed crop farming business. She earns about 20,000 som (KGS) each month from the sale of milk, dairy products, and eco-friendly ("green") fruits and vegetables to private buyers. For the purpose of the further development of her business, Gulmira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requested a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy saltpeter fertilizer to cultivate the land, as well as to purchase two dairy cows to increase her earnings from selling milk. Gulmira plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her business, as well as to build a large barn for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy saltpeter fertilizers for growing eco-friendly products and to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 29-year-old married woman from Jenin city. She is a mother of two sons and two daughters. Dalal's husband is a worker, and he makes a low income. This income barely covers all the family’s needs. She would like to improve the family’s living conditions and buy all the needed stuff.

Dalal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a solar water-heating system for her home. By taking this loan, Dalal will be able to provide hot water for her family without using electricity.

Dalal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar water-heating system for her home.

loans.name: Hovik

texts.en:
Hovik lives in Jajur village, in Shirak region, with his wife and four children (two sons and two daughters). Hovik’s elder daughter, Hripsime, is 20 years old and studies at Gyumri State Medical College. (She is in the photo with Hovik.) She is currently in her third year of study in the Department of Pharmacy.

Hovik works hard, to be able to cover his family's basic costs and provide appropriate living conditions for the family members. Because of financial difficulties that the family is currently facing, it is very difficult for Hovik to save money for his daughter's education. This is the reason he has applied for this loan. With the help of the loan, he will be able to cover Hripsime’s college tuition.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's tuition at medical college, in the department of pharmacy

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Uganda, in Kampala. She is married and has four children, and three of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a retail shop at a market. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for five years.

She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 400,000 from MCDT – SACCO. She will use the loan to buy sugar, beans, cow peas, and flour. Her major challenges include seasonality and electricity.

Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children to university level. She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and electricity.

loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, cow peas, and flour to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sheet metal roofing, wood, cement, sand and gravel for building a room for her kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines and drinks.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is a very hardworking and responsible person who lives in a community in greater Accra, Ghana with her family. For five years, her business has been selling towels and secondhand clothing through hawking in and out of her neighboring areas. 

Felicia needs this loan to buy more towels and secondhand clothing so that she will serve customers better and make more profit. She hopes that this loan will increase her sales considerably and that it will be a great help. 

She hopes that, thanks to this loan, she will be able to improve her family's quality of life by increasing her household income. She hopes to grow her business in a short period of time and thereby keep helping her family, so her children will get the education they need so they can have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy more towels and secondhand clothing so that she will serve customers better and make more profit.

loans.name: Avon Group

texts.en:
Ludimin is the featured borrower of Avon group. She got together with the other group members to get a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua. The group members have been friends since they came to work in Lebanon, having left their hometowns in the Philippines seeking a better future. They trust and care for each other.

Ludimin is a 32-year-old, divorced mother of one child. She has been working in Lebanon, as a housekeeper and in beauty cosmetics sales, to provide her son with the best education, ever. Ludimin is the second from the right, in the photo. She will invest the loan she applied for in increasing her beauty cosmetics stock, with specially released spring and summer collections. She hopes to increase her income and make sure that her son will have the education that she is sacrificing her life to provide him with.

As for the other group members, Leonida Dela is the first one on the left, and Rossana is the second from the left, with a white top. Jean is the first on the right.

loans.use: To increase her beauty cosmetics stock, with spring and summer products

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Margaret Lorena, age 28 and unmarried, runs a "sari-sari" (general store) business to earn an income. She uses her income to help support her parents.  The store forms part of the family home in Poblacion, Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte, and her clients are her neighbors and passers-by. 

Since she supports her parents, she has decided to improve her small business in order to better support their needs. She has therefore requested a loan in order to purchase inventory items for her sari-sari store. 

Aside from the financial assistance from Paglaum, she also received add-on benefits like insurance and savings. 

She hopes that with Paglaum's help, she will become a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to purchase inventory items for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Dubai Group

texts.en:
Sharifa, who is in her twenties, is not married. She has been a pharmacist for one year and is able to make a fair monthly return. She opens her business from 9:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily. She decided to request another loan from Tujijenge to keep improving her business. 

This is her second loan request from Tujijenge. She used the previous loan to restock medicines in her shop. She has paid back successfully her loan. Sharifa earned a profit, which she used to pay for her medical and welfare expenses. 

She will use her loan to replenish her pharmacy with new medicine. Her ambition is to greatly improve her pharmacy.

Sharifa will share this loan with her loan group "Dubai", which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her pharmacy with new medicine.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Uganda, in Kampala. She is married and has four children, and two of them go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells old clothes at the market, on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for three years.

She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 400,000 from MCDT – SACCO. She will use the loan to buy a bale of old clothes to sell.

Her major challenges include seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to increase her capital base. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is 32-year-old married woman who lives with her family in Zarqa, Jordan. Two years ago, she started to sell clothes and bridal clothes at her home as a support for her family’s income and to help her husband, too. 

To improve her project, she is seeking a loan to rent a store and also to be able to register it.

loans.use: to rent a store and also to be able to register it.

loans.name: Meryi Marisol

texts.es:
Meryi es una joven emprendedora, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Huarmey junto a su familia.
Es madre soltera, tiene un pequeño hijo quien es su mayor motivación para salir adelante y por quien lucha día a día para poder brindarle un futuro mejor.
Desde hace 1 año se dedica al negocio de venta de calzado, le va muy bien porque es una persona trabajadora, responsable, honesta y sobre todo porque ofrece productos de excelente calidad.
Meryi está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para surtir el negocio de venta de calzados. Des esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos y seguirá esforzándose para ampliar su negocio y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Meryi is an enterprising young person. She´s 19 years old, single and lives in Huarmey with her family.

She is a single mother and has a young son who is her biggest motivation to succeed and for whom she struggles every day to be able to provide him with a better future.

For the past year, she has been selling shoes. She is doing very well because she is a hard-working, responsible, honest person and above all because she offers excellent quality products.

Meryi is grateful to Kiva lenders because with the support they have given her she will be able to buy merchandise to stock her shoe-selling business. In this way, she will get higher incomes and continue her efforts to expand her business and to improve her family´s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock for her shoe-selling business.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with two children and one of them goes to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal at the market on retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for seven years. 

She has requested a loan of Ugandan Shillings 700,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal to sell. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. She rents a house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is single. She is 25 years old and lives in Caracol, Salug, Zamboanga del Norte.

Mary Ann sells dresses, shoes and sandals to earn a living and has had this business for 18 months. Each month, she earns PHP 8,000 doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to purchase more items to sell/retail.

Mary Ann has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell/retail.

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en:
Manvel is from Vanadzor town. He lives there alone. He studies at Yerevan State Institute of Theater and Cinema. He is currently in his fifth year of study in the Faculty of Theater with specialization in dancing. Manvel also works as a dancer at Vanadzor State College of Art. 

It is really hard for this young man to combine his job with his studies but he does everything to make ends meet. Because of the financial difficulties Manvel is facing, he is not able to save money for his education. This is the reason he has applied for this loan. With the help of the loan, he will be able to cover his university tuition.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Julie Group

texts.en:
Victoria is the featured borrower of the Julie Group. She joined the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometowns in the Philippines seeking better working opportunities.

Victoria is a 41-year-old married mother of three, who works in selling prepaid mobile phone cards for her living. Her acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with prepaid mobile phones cards to increase the quantities she sells and improve her family's living standards. 

She is the first lady on the far left side of the picture; as for the other group members, Gemma is the lady at the center of the picture, while Julieta is the first from the right.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with prepaid mobile phones cards.

loans.name: Virginia Flora

texts.es:
Virginia es una mujer de 41 años de edad soltera y sin hijos. Su vida la dedica a la producción y comercialización de quesos. Ella vive en la comunidad 'Caluyo' una región caracterizada por la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino y camélido entre otros. el clima del lugar es bastante inhóspito, de día bajo los rayos solares el calor es intenso y de noche bajo la luz de las estrellas el frío es bajo cero grados. Virginia trabaja constantemente toda la luz del día, que determina su jornada laboral, durante la noche enciende su fogata para abrigarse. La vida del establo es muy difícil, largas jornadas de trabajo duro y largas noches de intenso frío. Todas esas dificultades son la costumbre de Virginia, la producción de quesos es muy sacrificada y ella necesita mejorar su negocio comprando vacas lecheras y asi con los beneficios mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es por esos motivos que Virginia solicita un préstamo para comprar vacas lecheras y así mejorar su producción quesera.
texts.en:
Virginia is 41 years old and single. She doesn't have any children. She dedicates her life to making and selling cheese. She lives in the community of Caluyo, which is a region known for its cattle rearing, as well as sheep, lama, and other species. The local weather is quite inhospitable: during the day the heat is intense in the sun, and at night under the starlight the cold reaches temperatures below zero. 

Virginia works constantly as long as the day lasts, since daylight determines her work schedule. At night she lights a fire to keep warm. Life in the stable is very hard: long days of hard work and long nights in the cold, but these hardships are Virginia's way of life. Cheese making requires sacrifice and she needs to improve her business by buying dairy cows. The profit will allow her to improve her quality of life.

This is why Virginia is requesting a loan to buy dairy cows, and in turn improve her cheese output.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Getu

texts.en:
Getu lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and two of them go to school. She has additional family members. 

She operates a salon business. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works seven days a week and has been in this business for one year. 

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy relaxers, treatments and braids. 

Her major challenges include seasonality and electricity. Her goal and aspiration is to own a fully stocked salon providing bridal services. She rents a house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy braids, weaves, relaxers and treatments.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 38-year-old married man who has been blessed with six children; his wife adds an additional income to support the welfare of their family.  Martin has been operating a posho, or windmill business, for a period of three years, earning an income of KES.10,000 at the end of every month.

Martin was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a neighbor, and is now servicing his first loan of KES.90,000. He intends to use this amount to buy an additional posho mill machine to increase the output of his client's farm produce.

Martin plans to use the anticipated income to educate his children, hopes to start another posho or windmill business in the nearby town, and to serve his community efficiently.

loans.use: To buy a posho mill or windmill

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth tiene 37 años de edad la cual logro estudiar hasta el nivel primario casada con el señor Emilio Jesús el cual se encuentra en el exterior trabajando en el armado de Torres de alta tensión, tienen 3 hijos dependientes de sus ingresos los cuales están en etapa escolar y son alumnos muy buenos. La señora trabaja muy duro para poder darles a sus hijos las cosas que ella no pudo tener de pequeña, ella entrega leche cruda a una empresa reconocida de la ciudad de Cochabamba, además elabora quesillos y yogurt todos los días, el motivo del presente crédito es para poder comprar chala y paja para su ganado lechero ya que en esta época del año y por el frio este alimento está escaseando y es un alimento necesario para que el ganado vacuno siga produciendo la cantidad de leche mínima dado que si la producción baja también lo hacen sus ingresos, por ello quiere tomar precauciones para mantener su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 37 years old and went as far as primary level in school. She is married to Emilio Jesus who is outside the country working, building high-tension electricity towers. They have three dependent children who are school-aged and are very good students.

She works very hard in order to give her children the things she was not  able to have when she was a child. She delivers raw milk to a well-known company in the city of Cochabamba, and in addition makes soft cheeses and yogurt every day.  

The reason for this loan is to be able to buy corn husks and straw for her dairy cattle, as at this time of year and because of the cold, this feed is becoming scarce and it a necessary food for the cattle to keep producing the minimum quantity of milk, given the fact that if her production goes down her income will also. For this reason she wants to take precautions for maintaining her financial stability.

loans.use: To buy corn husks and straw for her dairy cattle.

loans.name: Karina Angela

texts.es:
Karina es una joven emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Pachacamac junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Desde hace casi 1 año trabaja en la venta ropa en el mercado en un pequeño puesto, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta y muy respetuosa y amable con los clientes.
Karina está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprarse un juego de dormitorio para que pueda dormir con mayor comodidad. De esta manera, seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder cumplir su mayor sueño: "Tener su propio negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia".
texts.en: Karina is an enterprising 21 year old young woman. She is single and lives in Pachacamac with her family. She is a person with lots of desire to move forward. For almost 1 year she has been working in a small stand at the market. She is doing very well because she is a very responsible, hardworking, honest person, who is very respectful and kind to customers. Karina is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their support she will be able to buy a bedroom set so that she can sleep more comfortably. This way she will keep on working hard to later on fulfill her greatest dream: "To have her own business and improve her family's quality of life".

loans.use: To buy a bedroom set.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 26-year-old gentleman who is married and blessed with two children aged five and two years old. He is a fish seller and his has been in this business for the last 10 years making a profit of about Kenya shillings 18,000.

He is currently applying for his first loan with a Vision Fund Kenya which he plans to use to buy more stock of fish for resale. He plans to use the anticipated profits to buy a goat for his family.

In future he would like to have all his children well-educated.

loans.use: To buy a stock of fish for resale.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 23 years old, married to Jackson and they are blessed with two school-going children. She is in the business of rental houses and sells water as a secondary business. She earns a monthly  profit of KES18,000.

She has applied for a second loan of KES 30,000 which she plans to use to buy building materials and paints to paint all these in order to renovate them. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children.

In future she plans to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy building materials and paints for painting.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is single with two children, and both of them go to school. She has additional family members.  She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis . She works seven days a week; and has been in this business for four years. 

Prossy has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 700,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. 

Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to make her business prosper.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory, including door locks, saws, paint, and electrical wire.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married and has five children who are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, Angelina has operated a motorcycle business.

With the loan, she wants to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman with five children all of whom go to school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a nursery school and she has been in this business for the last four years. She wants to expand her school to accommodate more students. 

With the loan she wants to purchase more text books for her pupils. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more text books for her pupils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more traditional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Campamento Group

texts.en:
We are happy to report on the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Campamento” meaning “Camp”, located in the rural community of Momostenango in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. The group is composed of ten dynamic women who are committed to leaving poverty behind and leading empowered lives. The ladies have successfully completed paying off their previous loans funded by Kiva investors last September.  The women report that the loans have been a great boost to their businesses (agricultural endeavours, animal husbandry and the production of handicrafts). They are requesting a new loan that is especially important now that there are three new members in the Trust Bank.

Calixta was our featured client back last September. She reports that because of her loan, she was able to purchase a few pigs and dozens of chickens and turkeys as well as food to fatten them up quickly. She has been able to put aside to some funds to take care of her family. 

Maria is another member of the Trust Bank with seven children who range in age from four to fifteen. She is 37 years old and raises chickens, turkeys and pigs. In addition, she is a talented textile artist and embroiders beautiful blouses. Maria is requesting her first loan and will use the funds to purchase chickens, another pig and feed for them. She also needs to buy more supplies  including thread and fabrics for her embroidery business. Her ultimate goal is for her children to be educated and she is pleased that five of them are in school.

Business and personal tools are essential to ensure the success of Maria, Calixta and the other ladies in the Trust Bank. Friendship Bridge understands this and has combined the loans with education for the women. The concept is called “Microcredit Plus”. Each month, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares timely information with the ladies about how to effectively manage their businesses (accounting, budgeting, customer service, marketing, pricing indebtedness), how to take care of themselves and their families (hygiene, nutrition, health, the use of medicinal plants) as well as women’s rights and self esteem.

The Trust Bank “Campamento” feels proud to belong to the Friendship Bridge/Kiva alliance. They are grateful for the confidence of each Kiva investor in funding their loans. We shall report to you on their progress in the very near future. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to purchase chickens, another pig and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cement, sand, bricks, etc., for building a wash basin with bathroom.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married with three children and all go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She provides outside catering. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for 5 years. 

She has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 700,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy food warmers and serving dishes. Her major challenge includes seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land and also build permanent business premises. 

She rents a house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy food warmers and serving dishes.

loans.name: Palestina Group

texts.en:
Hadija is a mother of one schooling kid and is aged in her thirties. She is not married and supports her family by managing a beauty salon. Hadija has been in this business for six years now and is able to make a good monthly profit. She starts servicing her customers from 09:00am to 09:00pm daily. 

Palestina is a new group from Tujijenge comprising of four businesswomen who desire to improve businesses via a Kiva loan. As a group, they are requesting TZS 2,500,000 to be apportioned among four members. 

Hadija is one of them who will use her portion to upgrade her business by ordering new salon hair products to service more people. She believes that with this support, her business with receive more new people and likely retain existing ones. She is so thankful to everyone who will be supporting her group. 

Hadija, together with her group member will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to order new salon hair products to service more people.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 40-year-old lady who is married, and blessed with three children between the ages of 21 and 4 years. She sells second hand clothes, a business she has done for the last eight years, and the business is doing well.

She has applied for her fourth loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which she plans to use to pay for school fees for her son, who is the secondary level of schooling. 

She hopes her business does well so that she can repay the loan, as well as expand the business.  In the future, she would like her children to get a good education.

loans.use: To pay for school fees

loans.name: Victo

texts.en:
Victo lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. 

Victo has a retail shop. She works seven days a week. She has been in this business for ten years. 

She has requested a loan of UGX 700,000 (Ugandan shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy rice, sugar, beans, flour, and cooking oil. Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to make her business prosper. 

Victo rents a house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, beans, flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children; three attend school. She takes care of additional family members. 

She has been charging and selling all kinds of batteries from her home for the last 12 years, and works seven days a week. She gets additional income from a motorcycle. 

Rose has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 1,200,000 from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to buy more batteries to sell. 

Her challenges include fluctuating battery prices and seasonality. Her dream is to put up a big shop in the area. 

She rents a house with access to electricity, but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy batteries

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 25 years old. She is married to Gordon and together they have been blessed with two children of 6 years and 4 years. Together they support eight members of their family. 

Dorothy operates a retail shop, a business she has done for the past year, earning a monthly income of KES 50,000. She has requested a loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 45,000 which she will use to add a retail stock of clothes and handbags to her shop. This is Dorothy's second loan after successfully repaying her first.

With the additional income, Dorothy will be able to provide basic education to her children as well as provide other basic needs to her family. She desires to open a grand shop in the near future.

loans.use: to add retail stock.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy wheat flour, milk, eggs, maize flour, sugar for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, milk, eggs, maize flour, sugar for her business.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a farmer. Her main source of income is dairy farming and poultry farming, and through these two ventures she has been able to earn a decent and honest living. She has been engaged in farming for the past five years and has been able to support her family with her earnings. She is the hard-working, honest mother of four children living in the Molo area of Kenya. 
  
Purity is seeking a loan in the amount of KES 20,000. She will use her loan funds to buy poultry. With this investment, she will be able to generate more income with which to support her family.
 
Purity is sure that she can comfortably repay the loan on time, and she hopes to take on additional loans in the future to further support her business.
 
Profits generated from her expanded poultry farming venture will be used to cover family expenses and to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Icyerekezo Cb Group

texts.en:
Goretti is 35 years old. She is married with four children. She is a group leader of Icyerekezo group, which means the vision in English. 

Goretti has spent five years in the business of selling cooked food in her restaurant. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas and different foodstuffs to cook in her restaurant. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house. All the group members aim at making their businesses more profitable and to change their lives.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to make food for sale in the restaurant

loans.name: Alicia Afua

texts.en:
Alicia, a second year student at Health Concern, Ghana and thrives to be a professional care giver in the near future.  This loan is to help pay for her school fees.

Prior to this loan her father assisted in paying her fees, however there was an occasion when she was not able to pay her fees.

Her profession interests her because it would help her acquire more knowledge and upgrade herself in the medical field. It would also help her render services to her community after the completion of her studies, something she could not do without education, she says.  She aspires to be a public health nurse with a degree in five or ten years to come.

More and more people die out of ignorance everyday; it is Alicia's aim to embark on this medical course, to assist and educate such people on some of the basic things that would prevent death, and that inspires her most to reach her goals.

If it had not been the help of this loan, she would have deferred her course and waited till her father is able to pay up her fees.

She wants to encourage investors to continue giving support to young and ambitious students.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is single, with two children, and both of them go to school. She has additional family members. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

She sells charcoal at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week .She has been in this business for two years. 

Scovia has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal to sell. 

Her major challenges include transportation and fluctuating prices. 

Her goal and aspiration is to increase her capital base so as to serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcaol

loans.name: Tumema

texts.en:
Tumema is a 40-year-old woman who is unwed, with two children. She has a small taxi business to earn an income. She has eight years with this business. 

Tumema needs a loan to buy new tires, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil and petrol. 

She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tumema joined SPBD in 2006 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tires, a new gear box, a taxi sign indicator, engine oil and petrol

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a 28-year-old single woman with one child. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Julie needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD this year.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove

loans.name: Pepe

texts.en:
Pepe is a 50-year-old, unwed woman with three children. She makes and sells meat pies in her community to earn a living.  She has one year of experience in this business. 

Pepe needs a loan to buy a new stove, bags of flour, cooking oil, seasoning, onions, salt and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Pepe became a member of SPBD this year.

loans.use: to buy a new stove, bags of flour, cooking oil, seasoning, onions, salt and plastic bags.

loans.name: Las Solidarias Chucam Group

texts.en:
The town of Chucam is located in a rural area in Chichicastenango, in the western highlands of Guatemala. Eight women, who have a vision of eliminating poverty and leading empowered lives, have formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Solidarias de Chucam”. The ladies are involved in textile and handicraft businesses.

Elsa, a young 26-year-old woman, is the Treasurer of the Trust Bank. She has had seven years of formal education, but because of the lack of funds, she was unable to complete her schooling. However, Elsa is very aware of the importance of education, and wants her little daughter to receive a good one. 

She works hard in her textile business, where she creates beautiful, typical blouses and purses that enjoy great demand. 

For this reason, Elsa is requesting a loan from Friendship Bridge, along with the other women in the Trust Bank. 

She will use her loan to purchase fabric, zippers, thread, needles and other supplies for her textile business. Elsa looks forward to selling her increased inventory at an Artesan’s Market near her community. Many tourists attend the market, and Elsa wants to have lots of inventory for them to choose from.

The women of the Trust Bank acquire additional tools to improve their personal and business lives from the educational components of their monthly meetings. A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer shares useful and timely information about effective business management practices (budgeting, accounting, customer service, over-indedtedness) as well as health, hygiene and nutrition. The ladies also learn about self-esteem, women’s rights and violence against women. “Microcredit Plus” is the name that Friendship Bridge gives to this combination, and it is one that truly works.

On behalf of the hard-working and motivated women in the Trust Bank, Elsa thanks Kiva investors for believing in them and funding their loans. They are committed to working diligently and keep their goals in sight! Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: To purchase fabric, zippers, thread, needles and other supplies for her textile business

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer luchadora y verraca, con gran capacidad para hacer negocios y un carisma innato que la caracteriza.
Ella inicio su negocio hace algunos años con un pequeño capital que tenia y desde ese momento comenzó a crecer como empresaria.
Su negocio en una chaza donde vende ropa como pantalonetas, camisetas, medias, ropa interior, entre otros, son artículos de buen movimiento y ella se siente feliz con su actividad.
Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle una carrera universitaria a su hijo para que sea profesional.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de mercancía para capitalizar su negocio y aumentar su inventario de productos.
texts.en:
María is a fighter, a force of nature with a great talent for business and an innate charisma that defines her. She started her business a few years ago with a little bit of capital that she had and since that moment, she began to grow as a businesswoman.

Her business is a small stall where she sells clothing like shorts, shirts, tights and underwear, among other items. They are pieces that sell well, and she is happy with her activity. 

Her greatest dream is to be able to provide a university education for her son so that he can be a professional.

She requests a loan to buy merchandise to grow her business and increase her inventory of products.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing such as men's and women's shirts, men's pants, as well as skirts and underwear.

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu  lives in Uganda, Kampala. She is married, with four children; two of them go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She operates a food stall at the market on a retail basis; she works six days a week. She has been in this business for two years. 

Nulu has requested a loan of Ugandan shillings 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, sweet potatoes, and cassava . 

Her major challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her goal and aspiration is to make her business prosper. 

She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, cassava, sweet potatoes, and green bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bedroom set.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a generator and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Lotoi

texts.en:
Lotoi is 50 years old and married with three children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for six years. 

Lotoi needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Lotoi will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose
